story:
WELCOME

Thank you for your time and consideration in reading this project and watching the video. I believe a noble endeavor like this can make a positive difference in our lives and to those who suffer from cancer. I hope I can inspire you to become part of this exciting project and to consider a generous contribution now and in the future.  It is my great pleasure and honor to meet and welcome you!

Getting to the Point

We all spend an average of $25 to $50 regularly in many things. Just think about how much money Uncle Sam takes from your paycheck every month, how many times you've gotten a parking ticket, paid for an expensive item you didn't need, or bought non-winning lottery tickets. This is the perfect time to reflect and get into action: what would I rather be doing with these $25 - $50?  Well, I can think of only one marvelous thing!  Crowdfunding my project to help others.  Why not spend a few dollars on something we both want to be part of…cash for a unique project! …. Yes, cash to continue developing a much needed drug for patients with pancreatic cancer who are desperately waiting for a breakthrough. Do not miss this opportunity to be a part of something significant!

I will do the hard work and you will get the satisfaction of having contributed to this project.  We both will be proud to help others by supporting this unique project. Why do I think your contribution will make a difference? Here's the reason: more than four decades have passed since the war against cancer was declared by Congress. For pancreatic cancer the net result is ZERO because scientists keep repeating again and again methods that don't work.  We have NOT conquered pancreatic cancer!! The death rates continue to increase and there are no drugs or cures to deal with this lethal malignancy.  But together, you and I can make the difference. You can help me achieve my goal of creating something different and you will get the satisfaction of helping me to do it! But the only way I can advance this project is with your generous help!

Let’s make the difference together! Support this project, and If This Matters to You please chip in with any amount you can and get a reward for your contribution!

Who leads this campaign?

This fundraiser is led by Dr. Irene Gonzalez, an entrepreneur, independent inventor, business executive, and scientist. She holds BA, MS and PhD degrees and has over 15 years of experience in scientific research at Johns Hopkins University, and 20 years of experience in the biotech and pharmaceutical industries developing commercial therapeutics for several human diseases including cancer, ophthalmology, infectious diseases and neurology. She created the novel technology from which therapeutic compounds for cancer and other diseases are created. This technology brings a unique and novel approach to the treatment of pancreatic cancer. Dr. Gonzalez is pursuing something completely different to the current standards of care that could make a difference and potentially impact the way pancreatic cancer is treated and managed.

Dr. Gonzalez’s commitment

I am fully committed to develop this therapeutic. To demonstrate my passion, commitment, and dedication to this project, I have contributed $200,000 to support all aspects of this project since inception. I strongly believe in this novel and unique technology and I care about those who are suffering and desperately waiting for a breakthrough that could help them to deal with pancreatic cancer. However, the costs to successfully develop this therapeutic are enormous. If this project is not continued, it is not because I didn't try financially, intellectually, and with genuine commitment and passion, but because the amount of money required to successfully develop this therapeutic is staggering.

Your generosity and compassion for those who suffer from this devastating malignancy is humbling and greatly appreciated. Even if you cannot contribute, you can still be part of this campaign by helping me to reach out and spread the word to your family, friends, colleagues, and everyone else in your community, city, and country. 

Why pancreatic cancer?

Pancreatic cancer is a highly aggressive and lethal malignancy with a five-year survival rate of less than 5%, and with an 85% death-rate and increasing. The only available drug has failed to improve pancreatic cancer outcomes. My goal is to develop a novel therapeutic with no side-effects and no-toxicity that can significantly increase the patient’s quality of life and survival over the current standard of care. This is a critical unmet medical need that must be addressed now to help pancreatic cancer patients.

Current therapies for pancreatic cancer are palliative not curative

The current drugs for pancreatic cancer are toxic, not curative, do not improve the quality of life of pancreatic cancer patients, and have not changed the death rate in nearly five decades of fighting against this cancer.

Famous, and non-famous people, have died of pancreatic cancer.

This disease does not have borders, and does not discriminate among nationality, gender, race, age, poor, rich, and social, political, or marital status; anyone can contract pancreatic cancer.

Luciano Pavarotti, an Opera Singer, left us on September 6, 2007; at 67 he died of pancreatic cancer.

Randy Pausch, a professor at Carnegie Mellon, left us on July 25, 2008; at 47 he died of pancreatic cancer.

Steve Jobs, CEO of Apple, Inc., and pioneer of the personal computer revolution left us on October 5, 2011; at 56 he died of pancreatic cancer. If the funding goal is exceeded, I will be able to carry out the studies planned;

Sally Ride, a physicist and first US woman in Space, left us on July 23, 2012; at 61 she died of pancreatic cancer.

Martha Keochareon, a nurse working at a hospital in Charleston, S.C., left us on December 29, 2012; at 59 she died of pancreatic cancer.

Many non-famous people have died and continue dying of pancreatic cancer

Funding for this project is absolutely essential to advance the therapeutic development efforts.  Your kind, invaluable, and generous contribution will help me to move the project faster, and most importantly, develop a much needed drug for pancreatic cancer patients. 

Accomplishments

Proof of concept has been demonstrated in vitro using pancreatic cancer cells and in a mouse model of pancreatic cancer. The therapeutic compound in development inhibit the growth of cancer cells and tumors. However, to be able to continue developing the therapeutic in advanced models of pancreatic cancer, I need your generous support.

What is the goal of this campaign?

The campaign goal is to raise $150,000 or more to synthesize the active molecules of the therapeutic, carry out animal studies, and create and validate the therapeutic prototype that will be used in further studies. Your generosity in helping me achieve the initial goal of $150,000 is deeply appreciated; however, the more you contribute the faster I can develop this promising and unique medical solution for the people who need it most, the pancreatic cancer patients.

If the funding goals is achieved and exceeded,  I will be able to carry out the proposed studies. If the funding goal is not achieved, I still can use the funds raised to continue advancing the development of the therapeutic until the funds are depleted. I will continue searching for additional contributors or investors to complete this goal. 

How your financial contributions will be spent?

28% for compound validation; 20% for animal studies; 12% for patent expenses 

10% for compound synthesis; 18% for leases, administration, and insurances

 12% for lab tests and R & D;   4% for R & D

CREDENTIALS

Irene Gonzalez, PhD, Founder, President, and CEO; 25 years experience in public biotech and pharmaceutical companies in business, management, operations, commercial therapeutic and diagnostic development, GMP and regulatory, technology evaluation, tech transfer, patent preparation, translations, and consulting in all areas of expertise.

Donald D. Fallon, Chief Financial Officer; 25 years of senior financial and accounting management experience in public and private biotech, and pharmaceutical companies. 

Richard M. Thorn, PhD; 25 years experience in product development in various executive and management positions in public biotech and pharmaceutical companies. 

Collectively, the team has 75 years of combined experience in all aspects of business, operations, project management, drug development, and regulatory.

You can read more about me and the team by visiting our website here. Please send your comments below.

Asking for your generosity

I hope I have inspired and convinced you of the critical need and noble mission of this project that could potentially change the unsuccessful more than four decades of fighting pancreatic cancer. Please join me, be part of this journey, be part of history, and get one of our rewards!

Write to us and share your story

Please tell me about you or a person you know who is suffering from pancreatic cancer.

E-mail us at contact@valenstherapeutics.com

You can find also this campaign on:

Face book:  http://on.fb.me/1522m3J

Twitter:  https://twitter.com/irenegon628     Check this site and follow me

Blog site:  http://bit.ly/12P4Az8

My webpage:  http://bit.ly/12LMC4p

Note to all our contributors: Your contributions will fund the goals of the project; however, further development of the therapeutic will depend on our ability to continue raising money from the public and/or from accredited investors since the costs to bring this therapeutic from its current stage of development to the FDA for approval, to clinical trial, and to the hospital bed are staggering. Since funding is the key to advance development of this therapeutic, we cannot guaranty that its full development will be fulfilled.

You cannot contribute but want to help:

Win a $75 Gift Certificate of your choice if you send referrals through your social networks to get the word out, and achieve a minimum of 5 contributors at the $100 level.

story:
Join Integral Yoga Institute New York in the Global Garland, at www.globalgarland.org  http://on.fb.me/1hlcc69

Across the United States and the world, numerous events will highlight the contributions of this Yoga master to natural health, vegetarianism and nonviolence, and interfaith understanding.

The Life & Interfaith Vision of Swami Satchidananda - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WGUkuiH5DhU&feature=c4-overview&list=UUIYImjBo7odQiJsEY8eGS-w

Two big events will take place in New York in 2014. The world’s first Interfaith Kirtan for Peace on June 7th at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, will bring together devotional chant from many faiths. Highlighting Swami Satchidananda’s and Integral Yoga’s pioneering work in yoga for natural health, and its leadership in the emerging field of yoga therapy, an Enlightened Health Fair on October 18 with Dr. Dean Ornish, Dr. Mehmet Oz and other luminaries in the field will illuminate the critical role of yoga as an economically viable and effective way for individuals to take control of their own health.

Your donation

will help to keep ticket prices low so that as many people who would like to can attend these important events.

Your funds

will also provide an opportunity for Integral Yoga to offer free yoga classes to underserved communities throughout the five boroughs of New York City.

Your support

will help Integral Yoga continue to bring natural health through low-cost or free yoga classes to people of all ages, sizes, shapes, conditions, colors and countries of national origin.

About Swami Satchidananda

His Holiness Sri Swami Satchidananda, the founder of Integral Yoga, is one of the most revered Yoga masters of our time. Regarded by many as an apostle of peace, he serves as an example of the teachings of Yoga and its goal of Self-Realization. Known as the “Woodstock Guru” after he opened the 1969 festival with a message of peace, Swami Satchidananda’s love, humor and ability to make the teachings of yoga accessible to all endeared him to millions around the world. His interfaith work—“Truth Is One, Paths Are Many”—won him the admiration of popes and presidents and many awards from distinguished interfaith organizations.

See the trailer from the documentary, Living Yoga. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MJuuxFNPQ7w&list=UUIYImjBo7odQiJsEY8eGS-w

About Integral Yoga

Founded in 1966 in New York City, Integral Yoga, a nonprofit organization, has grown into one of the world’s most renowned yoga schools, with Institutes in New York and San Francisco, world headquarters at Satchidananda Ashram-Yogaville near Charlottesville, Virginia, and teaching centers and instructors on six of the seven continents.  As the name indicates, Integral Yoga addresses all aspects of the human being—body, breath, mind and spirit—to give each of us an easeful body, a peaceful mind and a useful life. Inspired by Swami Satchidananda’s belief that yoga is for
everyone, Integral Yoga has created yoga classes for people dealing with a wide
range of chronic and life-threatening conditions, and programs like Yoga At
School™ http://iyiny.org/about-us/yoga-at-school/and Yoga At Work® (http://iyiny.org/about-us/yoga-at-work/). For many decades, Integral Yoga teacher training has been a leader in certifying yoga instructorshttp://iyiny.org/teacher-training/spring-200-hour/

story:
AS FEATURED IN ;

                  

                                 

     


Say hello to the most unique eyewear product.........

The  Sleep mask reinvented for the 21st century..........

Occles are unique bridgeless eyeshades that wrap around the head and block out all ambient and uv light. The silicone  rubber eye seals ensure a comfortable fit and the design helps prevent panda/raccoon eyes.

They have been invented to allow relaxation and sleep  whenever strong light is present-not just for sunbathing.

We want to help you upgrade your travel experience.

Whether you are in business or economy -block that disruptive light from the passenger next to you with the film playing or reading light on. 


As an aid to helping with anti-aging of the delicate skin around the eye, Occles can help and when used with a cooling eye gel the cooling, restful experience is quite addictive.

Occles have been developed to protect your eyes completely from disruptive light throughout your journey from flight to beach,  help combat jet-lag on a  flight or block sun glare when you lay at the beach they also  deliver the added benefit of reduced tan lines.

Next time you’re jetting off think about your eyes.............

Are you aware of the risk your eyes are exposed to flying at 30,000ft? 

Dermatologist Mark Glashofer* has reported that UVA rays can penetrate the window glass and burn skin and eyes whilst travelling. It is recommended to wear both a UV certified eye mask and sunscreen. One solution is British designed Occles Travel Eyewear, a must have accessory to be included in your hand luggage for flight travel all year round. 


The design is set to revolutionise how we relax and get some shut eye during a flight and whilst protecting our eyes from UV damage. Dr Doris Day a New York dermatologist has been quoted saying that UVA Rays can pass through aeroplane windows and that UVA rays are stronger at altitude. 

Day said, “The fact is, flying at 30,000 feet [for 60 minutes] can be as dangerous as 20 minutes in a tanning bed”.


Occles are a UV certified travel sleep mask providing protection from UV light at altitude on a plane or to block out the intrusive reading light of the passenger next to you.  

Say goodbye to squinting and premature crows feet, this revolutionary eyewear will help  anti-age your eyes , keeping skin smooth and eyes protected from harmful UV damage. The 'no pressure' eyecups cover and protect the peri-orbital area of the skin around the eyes known to be more sensitive and where age spots can sometimes appear first.

‘The human cost of eye damage means that new innovative solutions are needed to protect our eyes from the harmful effects of strong light. Occles are leading the way in their design and approach'

Dr. G. Mulholland,  Associate Director Innovation (2014)




Occles are the brainchild of couple, Hugh Robertson and Lynne McLeod. We first had the idea for Occles three years ago whilst lying on a beach in Greece. Struggling to rest our eyes in the strong sunlight, we looked around and noticed various methods being employed by our fellow holidaymakers to block out the sun’s glare. The most common seemed to be a towel over the head! 


We knew at that moment, there had to be a better way. 

  • Do you love the sun but not its glare?
  • Does it cause you to frown, inducing those unwanted wrinkles lines?
  • Does that glare prevent you from achieving that feeling of total relaxation, to zone out and re-charge?

A recent Mintel report posted  results that shows over 40% of people who spend time at the beach believe they look healthier with an even suntan on their face. Its actually hard work though due to the strength of the sun!!

The bridge-less design minimizes tan lines making them popular with sunbathers. A major plus is their 21st century unrivaled design and style which you will be happy to be seen wearing.

What look do you want?

Raccoon eyes?  

      

 


Or all over perfect, safe face tan..............



Keep your sunglasses for looking cool but on the beach wear your Occles for complete protection.



Following on from the Travel Goods Show 2016 in March  Occles are included in CNN Travel's  Hottest Products Guide. 

In May 2016, Occles eye wear received the 2016 Diamond Award  following an independent review as 'safe beauty product of the month' by www.safetyinbeauty.com 

We are shipping live with a warehouse in the US and in the UK & Europe.

  • FDA registered ?  Check.
  • UV tested/certified for light-blocking?  Check.
  • Made in Britain accredited in ISO 9001 Factory?  Check
  • On line retail stockists?  Check.
  • Successful delivery of perks as promised?  Check
  • Local, quick delivery of perks?   Check.
  • Continuing innovation& development?  Check
  • Health& anti-aging benefits?  Check


It's all in the detail...    

Manufactured in a quality controlled environment to the highest standards in the UK.

                                   


COMPLIES WITH- FDA 21 CFR 801.410

CAT 1  PPE89/686/EEC

EN 1SO 12312-1: 2013

                       


Made from hard-wearing, flexible plastic , Occles are designed to be worn around the neck while travelling, which keeps them convenient for those important moments of relaxation, to catch-up on  sleep, or to simply  just rest your eyes.



 The all-plastic construction does not cause any problem with security scanners-but you may get some curious looks from security staff wondering what you are  wearing! 




Simply choose your perk and add in some form of shipping at checkout.

All warehouse locations have stock of product so don't delay-we will ship as soon as you place your perk orders.

      


Remember to hit that share button and spread our campaign around your network to bolster our success.

Are you aware of the risk your eyes are exposed to flying at 30,000ft? Dermatologist
Mark Glashofer* has reported that UVA
rays can penetrate the window glass and burn skin and eyes
whilst travelling. It is recommended to wear both a UV certified eye mask and
sunscreen. One solution is British designed Occles Travel Eyewear, a must have
accessory to be included in your hand luggage for flight travel all year
round. The
design is set to revolutionise how we relax and get some shut eye during a
flight and whilst protecting our eyes
from UV damage. Dr Doris Day a New York dermatologist has been
quoted saying that UVA
Rays can pass through aeroplane windows and that UVA rays are stronger at altitude. Day said, “The fact is, flying at 30,000 feet [for 60 minutes] can be as
dangerous as 20 minutes in a tanning bed”.Occles
are a UV certified travel sleep mask providing protection from
UV light at altitude on a plane or to block out the intrusive reading light of
the passenger next to you.  

Say goodbye to
squinting and premature crows feet, this revolutionary eyewear will help  anti-age your eyes ,
keeping skin smooth and eyes protected from harmful UV damage. The 'no pressure' eyecups cover
and protect the peri-orbital
area of the skin around the eyes known to be more sensitive and
where age spots can sometimes appear first.
‘The human cost of eye damage means that new innovative solutions are needed to protect our eyes from the harmful effects of strong light. Occles are leading the way in their design and approach'

Dr. G. Mulholland,  Associate Director Innovation (2014)









Occles are the brainchild of couple, Hugh Robertson and Lynne McLeod. We first had the idea for Occles three years ago whilst lying on a beach in Greece. Struggling to rest our eyes in the strong sunlight, we looked around and noticed various methods being employed by our fellow holidaymakers to block out the sun’s glare. The most common seemed to be a towel over the head! 






We knew at that moment, there had to be a better way. 


Do you love the sun but not its glare? 
Does it cause you to frown, inducing those unwanted wrinkles
     lines? 
Does that glare prevent you from achieving that feeling of
     total relaxation, to zone out and re-charge?

A recent Mintel report posted  results that shows over 40% of people who spend time at the beach believe they look healthier with an even suntan on their face. Its actually hard work though due to the strength of the sun!!
The bridge-less design minimizes tan lines making them popular with sunbathers. A major plus is their 21st century unrivaled design and style which you will be happy to be seen wearing.
What look do you want?
Raccoon eyes?  
      
 



Or all over perfect, safe face tan..............




Keep your sunglasses for looking cool but on the beach wear your Occles for complete protection.






Following on from the Travel Goods Show 2016 in March  Occles are included in CNN Travel's  Hottest Products Guide. 
In May 2016, Occles eye wear received the 2016 Diamond Award  following an independent review as 'safe beauty product of the month' by www.safetyinbeauty.com 
We are shipping live with a warehouse in the US and in the UK & Europe.



FDA registered ?  Check.


UV tested/certified for light-blocking?  Check.

Made in Britain accredited in ISO 9001 Factory?  Check

On line retail stockists?  Check.

Successful delivery of perks as promised?  Check
Local, quick delivery of perks?   Check.
Continuing innovation& development?  Check
Health& anti-aging benefits?  Check



It's all in the detail...    



Manufactured in a quality controlled environment to the highest standards in the UK.

                                   

COMPLIES WITH- FDA 21 CFR 801.410
CAT 1  PPE89/686/EEC
EN 1SO 12312-1: 2013
                       






Made from hard-wearing, flexible plastic , Occles are designed to be worn around the neck while travelling, which keeps them convenient for those important moments of relaxation, to catch-up on  sleep, or to simply  just rest your eyes.





 The all-plastic construction does not cause any problem with security scanners-but you may get some curious looks from security staff wondering what you are  wearing! 






Simply choose your perk and add in some form of shipping at checkout.
All warehouse locations have stock of product so don't delay-we will ship as soon as you place your perk orders.


      





Remember to hit that share button and
spread our campaign around your network to bolster our success.

story:
My name is Nicholas Sheridan, Sr.  I consider myself to be just a regular guy on a mission to save lives. I am currently working as an Industrial Radiologist but recently found a new passion that interest me.  As a child, my grandfather would always speak of this something great I would do one day. Until now, I didn't know what that would be.  I am not ashamed of the hard work I have done in the past, but feel that it is time for me to enter into something that will help someone save their loved one's life if ever placed in the role I was placed on June 18, 2014.  My father, Serry Lee Taylor was overcome by an asthma attack at home. After contacting 911, I  continuously checked his pulse while waiting on first responders to arrive, it was during that time that I felt the most heart breaking thing I have ever felt in my life, my dad's pulse fade away.  The ambulance arrived shortly after, but soon pronounced him dead.

After this devastating event, I realized what my something great is. I saw my dad struggle to breathe and couldn't help. I felt my dad's pulse fade away and couldn't help. My goal in life now is to prevent the inability to act in as many people as I can reach.  I am establishing H.O.P.E  foundation as a non profit that will reach from coast to coast, high schools, universities,  community centers,  or wherever I can find an audience in order to instruct on emergency readiness. 
My goal is to mobilize multiple units who can instruct on proper procedures in new CPR techniques as well as rescue breathing instructions. 
I know this is a difficult task to take on alone that's why I am soliciting contributions and asking you to assist me in reaching as many people as possible with the message and movement of Helping Others Prepare for Emergencies (H.O.PE). I ask that you join my team by making contributions and sharing my cause with others. All contributions are greatly appreciated and will go on to save lives.
Thanks in advance.

story:
Cody Chapman from Audacity Athletics will be doing 1,000 Burpees to raise funds for Audacity to affiliate with CrossFit.


Why Are We Doing This?

Since the beginning Audacity Athletics has been obsessed with making people better! We know that in order to continue to add value for our current members as well as potential members affiliation with CrossFit HQ is vital. Affiliation will will increase the services that we can provide to our clients and widen the community that we can connect them with.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $5,000 to affiliate with CrossFit HQ.

In addition to the perks that come with various levels of donations everyone will be honored with a  "Donor Workout". The "Donor Workout" will be name after you and will be a workout that will require significant physical sacrifice from our members to honor your financial sacrifice. These workouts will be done throughout the year to honor your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign, use the sharing tools provided to make some noise.

Thank You in advance for your support, it makes us better!

story:
My sister, Ivette, has gone through a lot in her life. She has suffered greatly from a very young age when she became a mom at 17. Through all her struggles she has managed to always look out for her little sister, me. She has always been a fiercely protective and very loving sister and a dedicated, responsible and loving mother. It is little sister's turn to try and help her as much as I can and I implore you to help me help her through her present crisis. 

My sister, Ivette, recently suffered a stroke. It left her with debilitating paralysis on her left side which is improving greatly through physical therapy. Soon after the stroke, she developed a serious infection where she had to be hospitalized for several days. These two factors have led her to miss work for 3 weeks and she is unable to pay all her bills and medical expenses. On top of this, before the stroke, Ivette was a recent victim of crime where a man pulled a gun on her in her workplace. She has developed post trauma and the level of stress of her workplace may have led to her stroke. Ivette is making attempts at reclaiming her health, for example, she will start a new job next month. Also, she has started a lifestyle change that includes proper nutrition and exercise. 
She has asked for extensions on her utility bills. She is not sure how she will make the rent or make the car payment. She is unable to go to her weekly physical therapy appointments because she can no longer afford it. There are important medications that she needs to manage the aftereffects of the stroke and to help prevent any future strokes. The good people who are willing to help with a donation should know that all money contributed would go toward basic needs like medications, car payment, insurance, rent, utility bills, and pet food.
I love my sister very much. Please help a little sister help her big sister get through this crisis. Thank you, friends.

story:
Athletes love gear. For some, it’s carbon bicycle components. For others, it’s lightweight running shoes. We all can agree, however, that we need good clothing to do our thing. We know that the right clothes can make the difference between a brilliant day and a bad one. We aren’t talking about the mis-matched old stuff you use for training. We’re talking about game day—when it really matters: that’s when you break out your Sunday's finest. And yet after months of preparation for an event—whether it’s a 3-day fundraiser walk, 10k trail run or 100-mile gran fondo—we all reach for the free safety pins and poke holes in the expensive clothing we’ve been waiting to wear. We knew there had to be a better way.


Our objective was simple: to hold a number plate in place without damaging our clothing (and look good doing it). We wanted a design that was as simple as a button and as durable as steel. With over 40 years combined experience in cycling and running events and motivated by countless holes in our favorite jerseys, tank tops and shorts, our team began experimenting with alternatives. We tried various snaps, micro-velcro, double-sided tape and finally magnets. Once we started playing with rare-earth magnets, it was clear they would be at the core of our solution. Field testing at events began early in 2013, and soon we narrowed down the size and strength magnets that would offer the best performance and durability, lowest weight and easiest handling by fingers big and small.

Early RaceDot™ designs

In an effort to make the magnet on top of the number easier to handle, we decided to glue to it a clear acrylic dome. The natural magnifying property of the dome enhances any graphic under it. We stressed the aerodynamic factor and refused to settle for what was cheapest. We have found it pays not to listen when you hear, "it's not possible." Finally, we found über-aero, ultra low-profile domes. 

Next came the task of designing a durable, lightweight shell to keep the outside magnet, graphic and acrylic dome together, since glue alone would never hold up. This design had to allow the two magnets to lock together with a race number and fabric in between. After trying many different assemblies, the most effective one, as fate would have it, was the simplest one. 


Over the last 8 months, we have been sourcing materials and manufacturing as well as putting the prototypes through rigorous testing. RaceDots™ have not affected RFID, RTLS, ANT or any other wireless timing device signals. We have been sending prototypes to timing companies and have yet to have a single problem. 

We also tried different size and strength magnets, an array of domes—in fact pretty much every aspect you could factor into RaceDots™ has been carefully considered and tested. One question we received on a regular basis was, "Why not make it out of plastic?" At this point in time we feel strongly that there is too much plastic in the world as it is, and you simply would not get the quality, durability and attractive look of polished, nickel-plated copper (which is higher quality metal than a lot of jewelry being sold these days).


RaceDots™ Patent Pending Design locks the two magnets together





Having options is an important part of bringing any product to market. We know that matching gear makes you faster, so we researched colors on new running shoes, watches, bike frames, clothing, iPods and eye wear. Chances are we have something to match anything you have purchased this year or might purchase next year. 


Like most athletes, we find the lack of daylight not only depressing but a safety hazard as well. It doesn't have to be race day to snap on a reflective RaceDot™ for a some added visibility before the sun comes up. We've been snapping them on to our jackets, shorts, even beanies!


If you are part of an organized club or corporate team and you see value in branding healthy employees while they run, walk or ride, the Custom RaceDot™ is a perfect choice. Have a cycling team that wants matching RaceDots™? Perfect! Band everyone on your team together and support the CustomDots perk to the right. The minimum for custom dots is 200 dots - once we go full retail this is likely to go up (and there won't be a BluRay of that awesome cycling movie, Chasing Legends included).


To prove how strong RaceDots™ are, we couldn't afford a wind tunnel so we did the next best thing

When you support this campaign, shipping charges will be billed once the campaign is completed. We can ship anywhere FedEx goes. Below is the nuts and bolts behind RaceDots™ and our plan to rid the world of evil safety pins.

Risks and Challenges
We have reduced the variables to only a few. Regarding rules by your governing body of cycling: we are currently working with UCI and USAC and hope for approval of RaceDots at the highest level. There is only one mine in the U.S. producing rare-earth magnet materials, and they cater exclusively to the military. Almost every other rare-earth magnet that enters the U.S. comes from China (bummer, we know). Each shipment of magnets into the U.S. must pay a 10% of value customs fee, which helps explain why no one else has pursued this concept. Add to that tooling and material charges, and you start to see why we need Indiegogo! We will use the money raised on Indiegogo to submit our first order for a minimum of 20,000 RaceDots™. Any lower quantity, and there simply will be no profit. Here is a look at where the Indiegogo money will go go:

BikeRadar

BikeRumor


Manufacturing
We have experience sourcing from Asia, access to professional networks, and delivery ability with a vastly qualified manufacturer that specializes in magnetic products. We have also confirmed the price for producing our main run. The dots we will produced in the same factory that produced the prototypes. So we know they can do it and do it well.

Complexity of Order Fulfillment
Some Indiegogo projects have had issues fulfilling orders on time, and we are committed to not repeating this. We’ve kept the reward tiers as streamlined as possible to eliminate any confusion in fulfillment. We have researched all the fees and scheduling associated with shipping. Because magnets intensify when put together, large quantities cannot be shipped on a plane. We have set a realistic delivery date that still gets you off and running early in the 2014 season even if U.S. Customs decide to get troublesome. With this in mind, we want to match or beat our scheduled delivery date.

Product Adjustments
We have settled on our designs and do not plan on changing anything.

Customs
Indiegogo campaigns regularly fulfill orders worldwide without any issues, and we expect this to be the case with ours, too. However, we don’t pretend to have intimate knowledge of the entire world of import fees and taxes. We’ll work hard to avoid your rewards getting held up at U.S. Customs, but in the end we can’t 100% guarantee you won’t experience delays or be charged. There’s always a minute risk (just like stepping out your front door in the morning). Because the product can be mailed in letter-size envelopes, we do not foresee problems from shipping.

There will no doubt be some twists and turns in the road ahead, but with your help, we’ll all have less pins and pricks in our lives.

If you’d like to donate, any amount helps. Please scroll back up to the top of the page and choose a perk to support RaceDots™ on the right-hand side. Cheers and thank you for your support!!!

story:
Summary

  • Hello, my name is Savannah, and I am 22 years of age.
  • I was introduced to Camp Goodtimes when my family attended the Family Camp portion, during my little brother's illness.
  • This is when I fell in love with the caring, accepting and accommodating atmosphere. I hope to return to camp and help to recreate that atmosphere as a volunteer. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • The funds will be going to my transportation and accommodation for this volunteer position.
  • As you will be supporting myself and the kids, the perks will be fun and camp related!
  • If I do not reach my goal, I may have to pay the remainder myself. If I still do not have enough funds, I will donate the amount straight to the camp.

The Impact

  • This camp gives not just those who are suffering, but also their families a light and time of enjoyment.
  • This camp also gives the volunteers a happier sense of self that makes them want to do good with their lives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign!
  • Share this video!
  • Spread the word about Camp Goodtimes and all the good that it does!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Mission Statement

Isn't it clear? We want healthy babies and mamas, empowering experiences, families bonded together, safety, cleanliness, support. 

But somehow we want more than that as well. Can it be a thriving center where families begin? Where community is made? Where friends are found? Can it be a place where diversity is not just hoped for but expected and cherished? It must be a place where women are put first and they are respected and treated like amazing creatures. 

Have you ever watched a woman gestate, grow a baby in her belly and push it out? It is remarkable. 

Women have a superpower. They create life. In all ways, the San Francisco Birth Center will treat them as the superheroes that they are. 

There. That is our mission statement. 

What We Need 

We have come very far with volunteer labor and lots of blood, sweat, and tears. Now, we need to raise $12,000 in order to get the Birth Center off the ground. There are so many start-up costs for a new business.  We need to pay for:

  • The legal fees to incorporate. 
  • Our first month's rent, so that we can begin construction. 
  • The purchase of equipment so that our birth center will be ready to receive San Francisco's growing families.

The Impact

Health care costs, particularly the cost of maternity care, are increasing every year. Rates of interventions and cesarean births have reached unprecedented levels.  A number of studies over the last few decades have demonstrated that midwife-led birth centers are cost-effective and provide safe maternity care. San Francisco is a cutting edge city. A birth center here will have a national impact and can serve as a model for maternity care around the country.

Get Involved!

We have been so lucky to have an amazing group of talented and dedicated volunteers. If you want to be involved in any capacity, please let us know. In the meantime, please spread the word about our campaign to your network of friends. Please post and repost to all of your social media outlets.
story_txt:
Our Mission Statement
Isn't it clear? We want healthy babies and mamas, empowering experiences, families bonded together, safety, cleanliness, support. But somehow we want more than that as well. Can it be a thriving center where families begin? Where community is made? Where friends are found? Can it be a place where diversity is not just hoped for but expected and cherished? It must be a place where women are put first and they are respected and treated like amazing creatures. Have you ever watched a woman gestate, grow a baby in her belly and push it out? It is remarkable. Women have a superpower. They create life. In all ways, the San Francisco Birth Center will treat them as the superheroes that they are. There. That is our mission statement. What We Need We have come very far with volunteer labor and lots of blood, sweat, and tears. Now, we need to raise $12,000 in order to get the Birth Center off the ground. There are so many start-up costs for a new business.  We need to pay for:
The legal fees to incorporate. 
Our first month's rent, so that we can begin construction. 
The purchase of equipment so that our birth center will be ready to receive San Francisco's growing families.
The ImpactHealth care costs, particularly the cost of maternity care, are increasing every year. Rates of interventions and cesarean births have reached unprecedented levels.  A number of studies over the last few decades have demonstrated that midwife-led birth centers are cost-effective and provide safe maternity care. San Francisco is a cutting edge city. A birth center here will have a national impact and can serve as a model for maternity care around the country.Get Involved!We have been so lucky to have an amazing group of talented and dedicated volunteers. If you want to be involved in any capacity, please let us know. In the meantime, please spread the word about our campaign to your network of friends. Please post and repost to all of your social media outlets.

story:
Hello, my name is Thomas Fairman, and welcome to T-Water

What is it?

This project is an attempt to bring human beings the best drinking water possible.

What are you going to do?

My plan is to take tap water, purify it through distillation and activated carbon filtration, and then refortify it with rock salts, electrolytes, and Vitamin-C. This will be called T-Water Blue; it will be the standard form of T-Water, and it'll have the benefits of a sports drink and an immune booster in one, without any artificial colors or flavors.

In addition to T-Water Blue I will be creating two other types of T-Water

  • T-Water Red: designed to increase mental and physical acuity through vitamins B1, B2, and caffeine.
  • T-Water Green: designed to boost immune system function and physical recovery through vitamins B6, B12, and extra vitamin-C.

Why are you doing this?

1. I want to give people high quality water. Water is the most important compound in the human body, attributing to over half of human body weight. The water we drink has an even greater impact on us than food does, so it only makes sense that we should provide ourselves with the highest quality of drinking water possible. 

2. Bottled water sucks! Bottled water accounts for 1.5 million tons of plastic waste every year...that's enough plastic to rebuild the Eiffel Tower out of plastic every 3 days. (5,6) As if that wasn't enough, Aquafina, Dasani, and Arrowhead cost more per gallon than gasoline. On Arrowhead's website, it costs $49 a gallon to order bottled water on a monthly plan. (7) That is utterly absurd.

3. Tap water sucks! Contrary to popular belief, the tap is NOT a safe source of drinking water. There are chemicals, pharmaceuticals, and even tiny organisms in the stuff that comes out of the tap. Check it out: 

  • Sodium fluoride, used in tap water to prevent cavities, is lethal in 5-10g doses (that's about two teaspoons)...look at it this way: if you were to drink only from the tap your whole life, you would consume enough fluoride to kill 10 people. (1,2)
  • According to the Associated Press via the USA Today, pharmaceuticals "including antibiotics, anti-convulsants, mood stabilizers and sex hormones" have been detected in the tap water of at LEAST 41 MILLION AMERICANS. (3)
  • A New York resident H&E stained a sample of his tap water and found these:

    mosquito larvae eating copepods. Yum. (4)

I think you get the idea...we need higher quality sources of water.

Here's what I need to make this happen:

1. A distiller - After doing some research, I think the MH943SBS Glass Distiller from Megahome is the best fit for the beginning of this company. It pumps out 4 gallons a day, which isn't an enormous amount, but it's relatively inexpensive, lower in power consumption than most other models on the market, and quiet, so I won't wake up my roommates when I need to make some water. If I do need to increase my capacity for making water, I can purchase a second one or upgrade to something bigger later on. ($219)

2. Activated Carbon Filters - The Megahome distiller comes with activated carbon filters, so this won't be a cost factor until I need to buy replacements in about 6 months.

3. Stainless steel and Glass bottles - 

I will be selling T-Water in several different types of containers. 

  • 25 oz glass bottles - $1.35 apiece 
  • Customized stainless steel bottles -$3.60 apiece (for 50 bottles). T-Water logo laser-engraved on the side!
  • 1 gallon glass bottles - $2.33 apiece

4. Ingredients: 

  • Caffeine - one of these and one of these to test each out. The advanced caffeine supplement might not dissolve as well in water, but it has some extra compounds that will make T-Water Red even more potent. (~$18 with shipping)
  • Electrolyte packs - $17.39 each on Amazon, I'll purchase two of these to start off with. ($34.78 total)
  • Rock Salts - 2 pounds Hawaiian ($7.99/lb) and 1 pound Himalayan ($9.41/kg). Plus shipping will cost about $35.
  • Vitamin-C - I'll get two of these, for a total of $20.13 plus shipping
  • Vitamin B1 - $6.49
  • Vitamin B2 - $9.49
  • Vitamin B6 - $10.78
  • Vitamin B12 - $7.52

5. Mortar and Pestle - to grind up my ingredients for dissolution into the water. 13.95 + ~$6 shipping.

6. Labels - to print my nutrition facts, data, and logo on. 100 sheets of labels (I'll put two on each bottle) cost $18.95 plus $4.95 shipping ($23.90 total). Printing won't be an issue because I live on a college campus with printers galore.

That's as transparent as I can be with this funding for this project. Assuming that I start with 50 stainless steel bottles, 50 twenty-five oz glass bottles, and 10 one gallon bottles, my primary costs will come out to about $750 + tax + shipping perks + Indiegogo fees for a total of around $1000-1250. I'll want to crank out more than that though, so the more funding I receive, the more I can give!

Spread the word!

Thanks for supporting and learning about T-Water, it really means a lot to me. Even if you can't support this project with funding, spread the word and tell people the truth about the water they consume!

Use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Talk about what you've heard about water on Facebook! 

This isn't just about T-Water, it's important that people know what they are putting in their bodies. 

Check out:

My Blog: http://tossfair.wordpress.com

My Soundcloud: http://www.soundcloud.com/tosscloud

References:

Here's a reference list; if you have any other questions about any of the data I used in my presentation, please feel free to contact me: twatercompany@gmail.com

(1) Aigueperse, Jean; Paul Mollard, Didier Devilliers, Marius Chemla, Robert Faron, Renée Romano, Jean Pierre Cuer (2005), “Fluorine Compounds, Inorganic”, in Ullmann, Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Weinheim: Wiley-VCH

(2) California Department of Public Health. http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/Fluoridation.aspx and the following calculation: (.8MG/L X 1000ML/L X 3 L/DAY * 365 DAYS/YEAR * 78 YEARS = 68.328 G SODIUM FLUORIDE (ASSUMING A LETHAL DOSE PER PERSON OF 6.8328 GRAMS))

(3) http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/nation/2008-03-10-drugs-tap-water_N.htm

(4) http://gizmodo.com/5626497/you-swallow-invisible-shrimp-with-every-gulp-of-nyc-tap-water

(5) http://www.sierraclub.org/committees/cac/water/bottled_water/

(6) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eiffel_Tower

(7) http://www.beverageuniverse.com/dasani-water-20-oz-/, http://delivery.walmart.com/usd-estore/catalog/sectionpagecontainer.jsp?skuId=1025168&departmentid=1255027787041&aisleid=1255027789493&startValue=50, http://www.amazon.com/Aquafina-Pure-Water-16-9-fl/dp/B0042YSWLE, http://www.arrowheadhomedelivery.com/water-delivery.cfm

story:
My name is Kate Milliken. I was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis in 2006. One week into my diagnosis, someone introduced me to another woman who had lived with MS for thirty years.  I thought talking to her would help, but it didn't. She was bitter and I wanted to be hopeful.

I made a documentary about my first year with MS called katescounterpane.com; I made a choice to be emotionally honest through video, photos and text.  Kate's Counterpane launched in 2009 and I continue to get 2-3 phone calls a week from people newly diagnosed who are deeply grateful for its presence.  This has made me realize that people need a way to connect each other not only via sharing the daily experience of illness (the clinical) but by sharing the emotions behind the illness (the psychological).  This is how the Moodifier™ was born.

The Moodifier can be accessed on a desktop or smartphone and is designed for patients, caregivers and supporters.  It offers a way to tell your story via text, photos and videos and to categorize the emotional highs and lows.  By using it, other users can view someone's entire emotional journey in one look, making it easier to find someone who might be a positive connection.  

By contributing to my campaign, you are helping me build a version of this tool, to be found on mycounterpane.com.

This site will be a place where a newly diagnosed individual can find someone who offers context to all the scary "what ifs." It is a place where the longest sufferers of chronic illness may be given a renewed sense of purpose. It is a place where caregivers, whose lives have been forever changed by the illness of someone they love, have a platform to seek practical advice and share their own feelings.  It is a place is where patients and caregivers undergoing treatment can update friends and family on their progress. 

A counterpane is a patchwork quilt created from a variety of fabrics which, when sewn together, creates warmth and beauty as a whole.  My Counterpane is the experiential version of this quilt: A community that celebrates the virtual, remembers the real, and ultimately, counters pain with the knowledge of who we are, what we know, and how we feel.

The first counterpane at mycounterpane.com will be focused around MS.  As the site gains traction, other diseases will follow, broadening our focus and expanding our user base.  Your contribution is critically appreciated, as is the simple but tremendously helpful act of passing this link along to anyone you know who may be interested in what we're doing.  Also, if you'd like to receive the initial version of this site once built, please sign up for a notifcation at signup.mycounterpane.com- no spam, just an email introducing you to the tangible result of many generous people who have decided to help me launch my dream.

Gratefully,

Kate Milliken

story:
We believe running is a social sport, but it's often hard for runners to commit to scheduled training with others (flexibiltiy is part of the reason we run). It's also difficult for runners to branch out to expensive destination races without running the risk of being disappointed by the value they recieve. Let's face it, a destination race experience is like a vacation. When you go on vacation, you read reviews of hotels, restaurants and attractions. Why isn't there a good place to get race reviews?
 
We're developing an easy-to-use network that helps runners find their next race using ratings and reviews, AND connects those runners to other runners who are planning to participate in the same events. 
 

What we've already got

  • Challenges that motivate runners with real medals
  • Online system for logging and verifying race results against official results
  • Hundreds of race ratings and reviews entered by our challenge participants
  • Overnight relay teams that bring runners together across the United States
  • Generic training plans for varying distances and ability levels
  • Articles featuring training tips and highlighting other runners
  • 1 sponsorship deal

 

What we're working on

  • Thousands of race ratings and reviews
  • Interactive groups of runners participating in each race
  • iPhone & Android apps to share training and races
  • Meetups at major running events
  • Multiple sponsorship deals

 

What We Need

We've set a goal of $16,000 to fund the next phase of digitalrunning.com. Your contributions will help us grow to reach and serve the critical mass of users required to attract additional sponsors and advertisers. Your contributions will be used for Technology Infrastructure (web servers, database servers, bandwidth, backup, etc.), a Macbook (iPhone developer tools don't run on our PCs), Financial Aid for needy runners (bringing runners together doesn't just mean those who can afford it), and safety gear.

What you get

We're working hard to build the next phase of digitalrunning.com and your contributions will make that happen sooner. While we hope that you will find the ability to use digitalrunning.com in new ways a reward in and of itself, we're runners and we know that sometimes races are run solely for the T-Shirt. So, we've put together some nice rewards for those who believe in us enough to contribute at any level. 

How Does it Work?

Currently, digitalrunning.com is a free service. It is free to register an account, log your races and have them verified. Our bulk race discounts are available to all registered members. Our generic training plans are available to all readers. There is a fee to register for challenges and join our overnight relay teams.
 
In the same way, the next phase of digitalrunning.com will also be free to use. Any user can browse races, see race ratings, get race recommendations, join groups and interact with other participants online.

For example:

"Mary is a mom from Minnestoa. She enjoys running, but she's a back of the pack runner who likes the vibe of a big race and is motivated by a cool looking medal. Mary is looking for a winter race in a warm climate to escape the cold. She visits digitalrunning.com and browses the list of races, looking for a winter race in Florida, Arizona or Southern California that typically has more than 5000 participants and is rated highly for its medal.
 
Mary finds the Walt Disney World marathon on the list and joins the group of Walt Disney World marathon weekend participants on digitalrunning.com. She introduces herself and soon she's sharing training stories, jokes and words of support with the other members of the group. Eventually, the members of the group get to know each other so well that they make plans to meet up for lunch before the races.
 
After successfully completing the Walt Disney World marathon in January and logging her result on digitalrunning.com, Mary realizes that she can earn additional medals for her efforts. She pays $15 to sign up for the digitalrunning.com Interstate Challenge. Over the summer, Mary runs the Grandma's half-marathon near her home in Duluth. She logs her result on digitalrunning.com, where it is verified against the official race results. A week later, a shiny new Interstate Challenge medal arrives in the mail and Mary proudly hangs it on her medal rack."
 
We hope our challenges will continue to help people step out of their comfort zones to try new races. We hope the online communities that develop around those races will foster a lifetime love of running.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone will be able or willing to contribute money to our campaign. If you're looking for other ways to help, the best thing you can do is to share this campaign. Here are some ways to do that:

  • Tweet it to your followers
  • Share it on your Facebook wall
  • Share it in any relevant Facebook groups to which you belong
  • Email the campaign to friends who might be interested
  • Blog about it.
  • Talk about it everywhere you go.
Thanks for all your help!

We recognize that not everyone will be able or willing to contribute money to our campaign. If you're looking for other ways to help, the best thing you can do is to share this campaign. Here are some ways to do that:

Tweet it to your followers
Share it on your Facebook wall
Share it in any relevant Facebook groups to which you belong
Email the campaign to friends who might be interested
Blog about it.
Talk about it everywhere you go.

Thanks for all your help!

story:
About George

George is the godson of our very close friends and having met George for the first time at their wedding i felt it was time to do my bit, so here goes.

George Bertie Johnson is a 3 year old super star who has a very rare motility condition. This means that George can't eat or drink and is currently fed directly through his heart. George has spent his entire life in hospital where specialists are working on hopefully getting him better. Even though George suffers from constant pain every day, he is always smiling. Team George has been created so that YOU can be a part of the team which is fighting to get George better.

Team George

This charity has been set up with an aim to help further George's diagnosis and support his treatment with the ultimate goal of getting George better! We also want to raise awareness, information and support for other children with motility conditions like George.  For further information, please view the website www.wix.com/teamgeorge01/teamgeorge and facebook page www.facebook.com/pages/Team-George/198383353539966 and please spread the word about TEAM GEORGE!

The Challenge

On Friday 25th January 2013 i will be running the Standard Chartered Dubai 10km race.  As you know i am generally fit lad and used to enjoy snowboarding holidays at this time of year, however since moving to Dubai have not been able to continue this tradition.....so i thought why not combine the two?  As such i plan to run the 10km, in my full snowboarding gear, minus the board stupid!  So that means jacket, trousers, hat, goggles the whole nine yards!  The temperature as i type this in October remains around the 40 degrees mark so this will be no stroll around the block and as many of you know i like to sweat, so it could be interesting!

Show George the MONEY!

It is however nothing compared to the daily battle that little George goes through so please donate what you can!

Whether you want to help George to finally live a normal life or in fact would just like to see me suffer following the years of torment i have inflicted upon you all please give generously for this wonderful little lad and his family's relentless pursuit for a healthy life for their son. :)

Please note all donations appear in US Dollars.
Current exchange rates are:
1 GBP = 1.69 USD
1 EUR = 1.29 USD
1 AED = 0.27 USD

story:
WHO is Samuellla?

Samuella turned 9 years old this April and time is running out for her to have an operation that will greatly improve the quality of her life. Samuella has Spina Bifida and must have an operation before the age of 10.  At three days old, Samuella underwent surgery but the operation was not entirely successful. She suffers from a lack of any control over urination and bowel movements. She must wear diapers. She has difficulty walking. Samuella is bright and a good student. She has a fighting spirit and wants to believe that she can have the same dreams as every young girl: that she will grow up to be strong and healthy and find love and have her own family. 

Samuella lives in Burundi with her family - her mom, Chantal and her dad, Clement, her grandmother, Josephine, and her brothers. There are no surgeons skilled to perform this operation in Burundi. Burundi is a poor country and there is no healthcare. Samuella and her mom must travel from Burundi to the Artemis Hospital in Delhi, India. The cost to travel, the hospital fees, the medication, the cost of the consultations and the surgeon's fees will come to $15,000 USD. 

WHO are We?

We are her family and friends. Some of us are in Burundi and some of us are in Canada. We are doing our best to raise the money for Samuella's treatment. But we need your help.

HOW can you help?

You can help us reach our goal of $15,000. A gift of $5, $10 or $25 would make a tremendous difference. ALL of the money raised will go towards Samuella's treatment. If the worst happens and we do not raise enough money for the operation before Samuella's 10th birthday, all of the money will go towards her on-going health care issues.

Please find it in your heart to help us help our beloved Samuella. If you are unable to give, please tell your friends and family about Samuella - that's helping too!

story:
Short Summary

The Center 4 Nutrition in Cap-Haition

Cap Haitien is a city of approximately 1 million people on the north coast of the island- nation of Haiti. This is the second largest city in the country. One of the biggest issues that most families face in this city is malnourished kids growing up without food to eat. The main cause of this problem is due to the high unemployment rate, as well as single parented homes, mostly women. The Center 4 Nutrition is helping families cope with these problems, with a children center in downtown Cap-Haitian that receives kids Monday through Friday where we give them two meals a day. Their parents drop them off at the center at 8 am and pick them up at 2 pm, giving them a chance at going to school or in search of employment. We are not an orphanage because we believe strongly in the building up of families. We have been working with these types of issues in Cap-Haitian for over 15 years.

With malnutrition being such a big issue in Cap-Haitian, we feel very proud of the work we have done in the past 15 years. Many of the young people in Cap-Haitian who are now in High School and under were kids who have pass through our program and now are at normal body weight and have been successful in life.

It is known that the kids in our program would not have received the care that they received from us if it were not for our program. We are the only Nutrition program in Cap geared to poor people to receive food and care free of charge.

Here’s where we need your help: we currently are having some problems with the area in which we care for these kids. So we have three spot projects that we need your help in improving the conditions in which we serve these kids. (1) We have a leaky roof in the area where our kids play and have lunch that we would like to recover. This is going to cost us $2,500.00 USD. (2) We would like to fix the toilets and bathrooms for the kids, this is the area that the kids take baths and have their diapers changed from time to time. This area is going to cost us $2,500.00 USD to fix. (3) We need a new gas stove to cook the daily meals. In Haiti, electricity is not something that most of the country has often, it is very sporadic. Therefore most people use burning charcoal for cooking (this is historically the most preferred by the Haitians). But we are a program that believes in saving the environment, which is why we rather use gas stoves, but currently our gas stove is in need of changing, and this will cost us $3,000.00 USD. We need your help to better help these underprivileged kids.

Our goal is to fix the leaky roof, bathrooms of these kids, and purchasing a new gas stove by August of 2013 with your help to better serve the malnourished kids of Cap-Haitian.

Your support: funding our program will help us a great deal, but if you are not able to financially support please spread the word to others and share this link to everyone you know, we also appreciate your prayers and concerns. Thank you.

story:
I am not the kind of person to ask for help- but in this case I have decided it is time to make an exception. This is something I have been waiting for for a very long time... Binding has caused me a lot of health problems (staph on my chest, pneumonia, and a couple of broken ribs) as well as making already existing health conditions more painful. I would love very much to to be able to breathe at night next to my partner, and to not feel it necessary to sleep in a compression shirt.

I am Sage, and currently I am attempting to raise funds to have a chest recontouring. This is an incredibly gender affirming surgery that also is a little out of most peoples budget. Basically this entails the removal of my breasts tissue and shaping of the chest to look more masculine. 

I have been on testosterone for six months, and have been researching surgeons and their prices since I was 15. I am now 24. Unfortunately I have been unable to find surgeons that have payment options, especially ones that have realistic payment plans. There are also foundations that occasionally help low income trans* kids with their surgery costs, but unfortunately have a tendency to pit people with the same problems against eachother, requiring answers to essay questions, in hopes of coming out the victor, and claiming their prize as a new man. 

Below is what I had written for one said foundation:

I am Sage. I have not gone by my birth name in literally a decade, and it still makes me uncomfortable to hear, even when it is being used to address someone else. I grew up with a pretty progressive mother who was excited when I came out as queer at thirteen, but is a lot less enthusiastic about my recent transition. I have been on Testosterone for six months, using a vial provided by my neighbor who could no longer be on his because of his health insurance. I eventually heard about NCNM in Portland (just in the knick of time) and got my own vial after borrowing money.
My family has never really had money, and I believe this may be part of the reason my mother is less excited for me to be happy about my transition than I am. She knows surgery is not inexpensive, and knows some things can go seriously wrong.
My entire life I have suffered terrible dysphoria because of my chest. I was cursed with a 32" DDD chest that I had to hear called a "blessing" my entire life. I have bound with multiple bras, duct tape, ace bandages, and finally real binders, though nothing seems to be able to compress my chest enough to pass. As I grow facial hair I pass more and more. My voice has dropped considerably, and I am so grateful, though I feel these things only make the dysphoria worse. As I watch the rest of my body become my true self, I am still bound to a visibly female body.
I would love more than anything to be able to feel my bare chest pressed against one of my lovers.

This is something most people have never really had to think about unless they have a trans* loved one, but that is very much a real problem. Something as simple as one surgery has the potential to rid a person of dysphoria entirely, eliminating the need for things like anti-depressants. Unfortunately, having top surgery costs about three times what it would cost someone to get breast implants.

I am here today to ask for help paying for this surgery, as working a minimum wage job and living in Seattle does not allow me to save at all. 

Your donations would be going towards:

Consultation.

An experienced surgeon.

Operating room fees.

Travel.

Aftercare and follow up.

Medication. 

 

Any extra funds would be donated to another trans* kid in need of surgery, or hormone replacement therapy. I believe it is incredibly important "Pay it forward" when it comes to Trans* issues. Recently there has been a lot of media coverage sorrounding the LGBTQ community, but rarely is the "T" addressed. Maybe lack of knowledge, or lack of visability are the reasons things such as Hormone Replacement Therapy, or top surgery arent covered by insurance. My sincerest hope is to feel like the human I know I am. To finally feel like a whole human, and to not feel totally out of place in my own body. 

If you are unable to donate, please consider sharing this page with others! Spread the word!

 

Thank you so much! <3

story:
Sivananda Prison Outreach Program

The Project is comprised of the following aspects:

  1. Sending Yoga books to prisoners
  2. Letter correspondence with prisoners
  3. Teaching Yoga in prisons – Hatha Yoga, Yoga philosophy, meditation
  4. Organizing day-long programs in prisons
  5. Making personal visits to prisoners
  6. Raising funds, mainly for book distribution, $5,000-$10,000 per year (please see box below for donation information.)

History

In 1996, Prison Life magazine published an article written by an inmate describing the inspiration and joy the "Complete Illustrated Book of Yoga" (CIBY) by Swami Vishnudevananda brought him.  A book review mentioned that the book was available to all prisoners at no cost.  Within weeks a deluge of letters from inmates arrived at the Sivananda AshramYoga Ranch, upstate New York, requesting copies of the book. 

Letter correspondence with the prisoners began immediately, as did a fundraising program to meet the growing requests for books. Heartfelt letters of gratitude from prisoners proved the initial success of the Project, gave them a sense of “belonging”, enabling them to express their feelings and aspirations, and gave them a safe place to ask questions and have their doubts cleared.

Yoga classes began in 1998 at two local New York prisons. The program succeeded immediately, uplifting and inspiring inmates.


Book Distribution

Our biggest activity continues to be distribution of the CIBY and other publications by Swami Vishnu and Swami Sivananda.  To date the Prison Project has mailed well over 4500 books. 

Fundraising

The genuine sympathy of well-wishers has kept the program alive. Even $14 can buy one book.

Inspiring Correspondence

Although most prisoner correspondence relates to book requests, many letters come from inmates who are serious spiritual practitioners, who receive advice and guidance.

Insights

During the past 14 years, we have gained valuable insight into the prison system, which unfortunately does not live up to the true meaning of “correctional facility.” We believe in teaching prisoners a new way of thinking that empowers them to lead cleaner, more peaceful lives through Yoga in its many forms.

Although USA prison libraries contain many religious books, there are very few on Yoga and Eastern philosophy.

Donations

100% of all donations go to Prison Project activities such as purchasing books and other Yoga items, correspondence expenses, occasional visits to prisoners, and costs involved in teaching in prisons. There are no salaries to be paid or any administration costs, and all donations are tax-deductible. Your generous donations are much appreciated, and can make a great difference to an inmate locked up for years on end.

The USA prison system - statistics

The United States has the highest prison population rate in the world, 756 per 100,000 of the national population (2008). At yearend 2008, the total incarcerated population equaled 2,424,279 inmates. 
(Ref: http://drugwarfacts.org/cms/?q=node/62). The average cost to house a prisoner is approx. $55/day, which amounts to about $20,000/year. Inmates in solitary confinement can cost $60,000/year. 

States are spending more money on prisons than education. Over the course of the last 20 years, the amount of money spent on prisons was increased by 570% while that spent on elementary and secondary education was increased by only 33%. (Ref: http://www.heartsandminds.org/prisons/facts.htm).

story:
Our Story

My name is Antonia Misitano. I met my partner Ryan at the Police Academy almost 5 years ago. We became best friends first and when we became a couple I knew what it meant to be completely happy. Ryan is hilarious and always made me laugh. He is the love of my life, the kind of person people just want to be around. We were completing our country tenure in a remote town of our state's north when Ryan was bitten by a mosquito carrying a deadly disease called Murray Valley Encephalitis. My whole world shattered around me. We went from being a young couple with all of our dreams and hopes in front of us to absolute devastation. When I was taken to a small room next door to the Intensive Care Unit in Perth where Ryan lay a few feet away in an induced coma I could hardly breathe. When I was told by the doctors that there was a high likelihood that Ryan would die I felt as though my mind and body was breaking. I thought I was going to die on the spot from pure heartache. I still cant believe this has happened.

 

Ryan fell ill 12 April 2011. Till this day he is still unable to walk, or stand or sit independently, cannot feed himself and cannot speak except for a word or two a day if we're lucky. When I ask Ryan if he remembers significant moments in our life, like our first kiss or the plans we had, like building our first home together, our future children's names or the trip to Italy we were saving for once we finished our time in the country; he doesnâ€™t remember any of it. My heart breaks every day, how can this be happening. We were so happy, we were working so hard for the past two years in one of the least popular Police Stations in the state to further our careers and build the foundation of our life for something like this to happen just four months away from completing our tenure and going home to Perth.

 

I am Ryan's full time carer now. I have taken a year leave without pay from the job we both love to nurse Ryan back to health. Everything you need to do to take care of yourself on a daily basis I need to do for Ryan. I cannot accept that this is now our life. I cannot let Ryan down and I must do anything and everything humanly possible to get Ryan back to the person I fell in love with.

 

But is comes at considerable cost. I have found one of the leading hospitals in rehabilitation in the world, at the Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago (RIC). This is our last hope at getting Ryan the absolute best recovery possible. I need to do this for Ryan, for us. I am 24 years old. Ryan is 29. This cannot be it for the rest of our lives.

 

For the level of care Ryan requires the monthly stay at RIC is approximately $150,000.00

 

We have funding efforts in place here in Perth but it is on a small scale considering the amount we need. Not having reached even a monthâ€™s deposit. Realistically Ryan needs at least 6-12 months to gain a benefit from RIC. I know this is an astronomic amount to ask for but Ryan's needs this, I need this, I need him back.  Even if we donâ€™t reach our goal every cent will go into however many days I can get Ryan at RIC. This money will only be used for Ryan's stay at RIC, nothing else.

 

Please help one of our community's finest to get back to the amazing person he is. Please help us get our life back.


*Created by Antonia Misitano thru Ryan Marron's Facebook page*
