story:
Willow Cannan, our 3-year-old baby girl, was diagnosed in May 2016 with an ultra-rare and deadly genetic disorder known as Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency (MSD), which is a Lysosomal  Storage Disease. Only 30+ people in the world suffer with this degenerative disease, with many not living past the age of 10, since it targets the Central Nervous system, Lungs, Eyes, and many other major organs. MSD builds up proteins in the lysosomes, making it extremely difficult for the patient's cells, and therefore body, to work.

But for the first time ever, a team of scientists and physicians are on the cusp of a miracle break through that would save our daughter and the other few children suffering from this dreadful disease. The only way to make this happen is by raising enough funds to privately finance the trial runs.

 

 

Willow's Journey

 

Our youngest daughter Willow was born on August 21, 2013 at 8.5 pounds, following a very normal pregnancy and C-section. Soon after, we began to notice that her weight and height weren't increasing by much, leaving Willow in the 0% percentile on the growth chart. Even now, at 3 years old, Willow only weighs 25 pounds and hasn't gained any weight in the last year. Although she was small, she played and developed, we didn't know anything was wrong at first.

At 18 months old, Willow began to crawl and walk, which was a bit later than our two older daughters. While attending daycare daily, her runny nose and ear infections grew constant but were attributed to being around and playing with other sick children all day. Willow is non-verbal, and has never talked, which began to spark minor theories within our family: either the ear infections were inflaming her adenoids, which would block her from hearing well, or she just never felt the need to communicate since her two older sisters would speak on her behalf (just like all older siblings tend to do).

At 23 months old (Summer '15), Willow visited a speech therapist who immediately noticed that she had a both a tongue tie and a lip tie. Hoping that a simple surgery could resolve her speech issues, we traveled to a dental specialist for a surgery consultation but were told that further tests should be conducted before resorting to the surgery.

At this same time, Willow's skin became very dry, resulting in 'cradle cap' and severely dry skin on her front and back. A local dermatologist prescribed her medical-grade shampoo, and we continue to jot down each of Willow's symptoms, not knowing if these diagnoses were connected or simply coincidental.

At 29 months old (January '16), Willow's pediatrician referred us to an endocrinologist and a pediatric neurologist for further assessment. The endocrinologist examined her blood for hormonal imbalances or anything else that could be affecting her body, but all tests essentially came back normal. We then met with the neurologist (Dr. Lee) next, assuming he'd be reviewing scans of Willow's brain for signs of tumors, but he instead insisted that we look deeper into genetic testing after hearing about the numerous symptoms she's been experiencing.

In the last year, we have learned more about genetics than we ever thoughts possible. In short, every human body is made up of cells, which contain our individually unique DNA makeup. Our DNA is essentially a recipe book, made up of 20,000 genes, or pages in the book. Every single human has at least 5 pages containing misspellings or errors, and in most people, the 5-or-so incorrect pages aren't enough to cause bodily issues. However, some pages might be missing entirely (called deletions), which triggers a new recipe for disaster in a small percentage of people.

With the dedication and knowledge of Dr. Lee, we were able to identify that Willow had a deletion of one her genetic pages. Without this finding, we may have never figured out the next step to saving our baby girl.

Following months of intrusive testing, Willow's screening declared her positive as a 'carrier' of Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency (MSD). After being reassured by Dr. Lee that Willow being a carrier didn't mean she was diagnosed with MSD. She could just simply be a carrier, passed down through family genetics. Willow's blood was drawn again and we were forced to wait the longest 4 weeks of our lives to see if she actually had MSD.

At 33 months old (May '16), we received the confirmation from Dr. Lee that Willow did in fact have MSD. We will never forget that phone call that changed our lives forever.

Since MSD was such a rare occurrence, it proved difficult for us to find a Geneticist who had the proper experience (or at least dealt with one previous MSD patient). We finally landed an appointment with Dr. Kirmse at the University of Mississippi Medical Center, which meant a lot since he had previously worked with two other MSD children, both who never left the hospital.

While waiting for our upcoming appointment with Dr. Kirmse, we were introduced to a friend of a friend who had recently lost their 8 year old daughter to MSD. How coincidental that someone within our network was struggling with the same disease even though there are only about 30 known cases globally. From there, we were introduced to a private group meant for families dealing with this tragic disease, which led us to a father of an MSD child in Ireland. This changed everything because the father was already communicating with researchers and scientists in Italy who could potentially mutate the incorrect, or deleted, gene pages if enough funding was provided. The Irish father had already raised 500,000 Euros to rid this disease from the planet.

FINALLY, THERE WAS HOPE.

We flew to Cambridge, UK in the summer of 2016 to meet with scientists from across the world.  They showed us the science is there, they just need funding and time.  Back at home Willow's 14 year old sister, learned of Gene Therapy through science.  "Why can't they just do that for Willow?"  

 

 

 

Our friends and family helped us create the campaign "Warriors for Willow" and our South Mississippi Community has rallied around us raising funds through fundraisers and private donations.  Our community support gave us hope that maybe we can fund the research to save Willow and the other children with MSD.  

 

What Exactly is

Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency (MSD)?

 

Short Answer:

Children with Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency, or MSD, are born with a mutation of the SUMF1 gene, which means the body does not create Sulfatase enzymes and is unable to break down and recycle natural cellular waste. This results in the loss of all body function and the disease is ultimately fatal.

 

 

Long Answer (Scientific):

Willow’s disease, MSD, is caused by a defective SUMF1 gene, and as explained above, this gene normally acts to activate enzymes in the body called “Sulfatases.”  Without functional Sulfatases, toxic material builds up in the lysosomes. There are many other diseases that are caused by a single missing Sulfatase (17 to be exact), including 'MPS I-VII' and 'Metachromatic Leukodystrophy'.  Since all Sulfatases are activated by the SUMF1 gene, SUMF1 gene therapy would not only help treat MSD, but help enhance treatment of these other diseases as well.  Scientists have proven the primary role of the SUMF1 gene in the treatment of several of the diseases mentioned above, which could altogether help save over 100,000 (MPS alone occurs in 1/25,000 births) children worldwide.

 

 

Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency (MSD) is a condition that mainly affects the brain, skin, and skeleton. Because the signs and symptoms of MSD vary widely, researchers have split the condition into three types: Neonatal, Late-infantile, and Juvenile.

1) The 'Neonatal Type' is the most severe form, with signs and symptoms appearing soon after birth.

2) The 'Late-Infantile type' is the most common form of Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency and is characterized by normal cognitive development in early childhood followed by a progressive loss of mental abilities and movement (psychomotor regression) due to Leukodystrophy or other brain abnormalities.

3) The 'Juvenile Type' is the rarest form of Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency. Signs and symptoms of the 'Juvenile Type' appear in mid to late childhood. Affected individuals have normal early cognitive development but then experience psychomotor regression; however, the regression in the 'Juvenile Type' usually occurs at a slower rate than in the 'Late-Infantile Type'.

 

 

How Can We Find a Cure?

 

There are several young MSD children that can be treated, causing the disease to be stopped and lives to be saved.  We are starting a patient group called the 'United MSD Foundation' and a patient registry is being developed as well, since we are also actively trying to find more patients.  Every doctor I talk to knows of a child somewhere who we can reach out to, but that still doesn't change the fact that we just had no solutions or options before now.

As of now, there isn't a known cure for MSD, so our only chance to help Willow and other patients worldwide is to research and utilize 'Gene Therapy'.

 

 

Funding the Cure

 

Before launching this Indiegogo campaign, 'Warriors for Willow' had previously raised almost $50,000 of our current $1,000,000 funding goal. Every dollar counts and will help us take the necessary actions to find a cure in time.

 

 

Hitting our funding goal would allow us to complete the following (and extremely important) objectives:

 ★ Identify the gene therapy experts who can develop a treatment.

★ Run clinical trials to understand whether existing treatments for similar diseases can treat MSD.

★ Explore chaperone therapy with drugs in clinical trials for other diseases.

★Join together with other families affected by MSD to coordinate our efforts to find treatments.

 

 

Time

As we speak, Willow has started regression.  She was already developmentally delayed and non-verbal.  Now she has trouble walking and she is losing her balance.  Her legs, ankles and feet are starting to lose muscle tone.  Her breathing as become labored and we've added a Pulmanologist to the ever growing team of specialists.  

The future symptoms Willow will face are horrifying.  Over the next few years she will become immobile and the pain she will endure because of the nerve cells dying will be excruciating.  This is what scares us the most, the pain our little girl will undergo.

Time is not on our side, most children start to regress between 3-5 years of age.  Any cure that we find will not reverse the effects of this disease, only stop in its tracks.  

We understand that the cure we seek to fund may not be in time for Willow, but we will not stop until other parents and families and children do not endure the terrible pain this condition brings.

All proceeds will go to the United MSD Foundation which is an IRS approved 501c3.  Contributions are tax deductible.  This is part of the Mississippi Gulf Coast Resort Classic Birdies for Charity event.

  

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any support you can give.  If .5% of the people on facebook gave $5.00 we would reach our goal.  No amount is too small.

If you can not give please share our story.  We may find other people able to help, we may reach other families with the same condition that didn't have hope.  

Thank you.
story_txt:
Willow Cannan, our 3-year-old baby girl, was diagnosed in May 2016 with an ultra-rare and deadly genetic disorder known as Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency (MSD), which is a Lysosomal  Storage Disease. Only 30+ people in the world suffer with this degenerative disease, with many not living past the age of 10, since it targets the Central Nervous system, Lungs, Eyes, and many other major organs. MSD builds up proteins in the lysosomes, making it extremely difficult for the patient's cells, and therefore body, to work.
But for the first time ever, a team of scientists and physicians are on the cusp of a miracle break through that would save our daughter and the other few children suffering from this dreadful disease. The only way to make this happen is by raising enough funds to privately finance the trial runs.
 

 
Willow's Journey
 
Our youngest daughter Willow was born on August 21, 2013 at 8.5 pounds, following a very normal pregnancy and C-section. Soon after, we began to notice that her weight and height weren't increasing by much, leaving Willow in the 0% percentile on the growth chart. Even now, at 3 years old, Willow only weighs 25 pounds and hasn't gained any weight in the last year. Although she was small, she played and developed, we didn't know anything was wrong at first.
At 18 months old, Willow began to crawl and walk, which was a bit later than our two older daughters. While attending daycare daily, her runny nose and ear infections grew constant but were attributed to being around and playing with other sick children all day. Willow is non-verbal, and has never talked, which began to spark minor theories within our family: either the ear infections were inflaming her adenoids, which would block her from hearing well, or she just never felt the need to communicate since her two older sisters would speak on her behalf (just like all older siblings tend to do).
At 23 months old (Summer '15), Willow visited a speech therapist who immediately noticed that she had a both a tongue tie and a lip tie. Hoping that a simple surgery could resolve her speech issues, we traveled to a dental specialist for a surgery consultation but were told that further tests should be conducted before resorting to the surgery.
At this same time, Willow's skin became very dry, resulting in 'cradle cap' and severely dry skin on her front and back. A local dermatologist prescribed her medical-grade shampoo, and we continue to jot down each of Willow's symptoms, not knowing if these diagnoses were connected or simply coincidental.
At 29 months old (January '16), Willow's pediatrician referred us to an endocrinologist and a pediatric neurologist for further assessment. The endocrinologist examined her blood for hormonal imbalances or anything else that could be affecting her body, but all tests essentially came back normal. We then met with the neurologist (Dr. Lee) next, assuming he'd be reviewing scans of Willow's brain for signs of tumors, but he instead insisted that we look deeper into genetic testing after hearing about the numerous symptoms she's been experiencing.
In the last year, we have learned more about genetics than we ever thoughts possible. In short, every human body is made up of cells, which contain our individually unique DNA makeup. Our DNA is essentially a recipe book, made up of 20,000 genes, or pages in the book. Every single human has at least 5 pages containing misspellings or errors, and in most people, the 5-or-so incorrect pages aren't enough to cause bodily issues. However, some pages might be missing entirely (called deletions), which triggers a new recipe for disaster in a small percentage of people.
With the dedication and knowledge of Dr. Lee, we were able to identify that Willow had a deletion of one her genetic pages. Without this finding, we may have never figured out the next step to saving our baby girl.
Following months of intrusive testing, Willow's screening declared her positive as a 'carrier' of Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency (MSD). After being reassured by Dr. Lee that Willow being a carrier didn't mean she was diagnosed with MSD. She could just simply be a carrier, passed down through family genetics. Willow's blood was drawn again and we were forced to wait the longest 4 weeks of our lives to see if she actually had MSD.
At 33 months old (May '16), we received the confirmation from Dr. Lee that Willow did in fact have MSD. We will never forget that phone call that changed our lives forever.
Since MSD was such a rare occurrence, it proved difficult for us to find a Geneticist who had the proper experience (or at least dealt with one previous MSD patient). We finally landed an appointment with Dr. Kirmse at the University of Mississippi Medical Center, which meant a lot since he had previously worked with two other MSD children, both who never left the hospital.
While waiting for our upcoming appointment with Dr. Kirmse, we were introduced to a friend of a friend who had recently lost their 8 year old daughter to MSD. How coincidental that someone within our network was struggling with the same disease even though there are only about 30 known cases globally. From there, we were introduced to a private group meant for families dealing with this tragic disease, which led us to a father of an MSD child in Ireland. This changed everything because the father was already communicating with researchers and scientists in Italy who could potentially mutate the incorrect, or deleted, gene pages if enough funding was provided. The Irish father had already raised 500,000 Euros to rid this disease from the planet.
FINALLY, THERE WAS HOPE.
We flew to Cambridge, UK in the summer of 2016 to meet with scientists from across the world.  They showed us the science is there, they just need funding and time.  Back at home Willow's 14 year old sister, learned of Gene Therapy through science.  "Why can't they just do that for Willow?"  
 
 

 
Our friends and family helped us create the campaign "Warriors for Willow" and our South Mississippi Community has rallied around us raising funds through fundraisers and private donations.  Our community support gave us hope that maybe we can fund the research to save Willow and the other children with MSD.

Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency (MSD)?
 
Short Answer:
Children with Multiple Sulfatase Deficiency, or MSD, are born with a mutation of the SUMF1 gene, which means the body does not create Sulfatase enzymes and is unable to break down and recycle natural cellular waste. This results in the loss of all body function and the disease is ultimately fatal.

story:
We are looking for donations to help Cindy get back her quality of life. $1 can help make a difference!

We are asking for your help my wife Cindy, mother of three, get the life saving procedjure she needs to be around a long time

During her first pregnancy in 1991 Cindy was diagnosed with gestational diabetes, which in some cases will just go away after pregnancy. In her case it did not, the diabetes remained and developed into type II diabetes. Since then it has been a constant struggle for her to keep her weight down. She has dieted, exercised, and tried every different type weight loss. Cindy continued to struggle with the diabetes and weight through two more pregnancies, managing her sugar levels thru insulin use.

Year after year her natural insulin levels decreased, doctors have had her on every medication that has come out, several which had major side effects, including heart problems and weight gain. All the time the doctors are telling her to lose weight the medications they are giving her are causing her to gain weight.

Cindy has always tried not to let this condition keep her from raising her family and remaining active through kids sports, being a super soccer mom, and team mom for 15 years! She always keeps up with all the kids’ activities. As well as working full time as an Assistant CPA doing corporate taxes & payroll.

In 2009, she was told that a new study showed that gastric bypass surgery can not only help her loose the weight she has been fighting for years, but also lower or completely remove her dependency in insulin, and could quite possibly cure her type II diabetes. We were all very excited about this news!

The first thing we did is sign up for a seminar with the KC Bariatric Center, and they felt Cindy was a great candidate for the surgery and gave us several different options. At that time we had very good insurance with Coventry. We went through all the steps filled out all the forms and submitted to the insurance company to get it pre approved. After about a 3 week wait we received a letter from Coventry stating that the procedure was not covered, because my employer had choose to remove that coverage from our policy.  After several months and multiple attempts to get my company to reinstate that portion of coverage, we gave up and started a savings fund to get her surgery.

That’s when the unthinkable happened, June 2010

I came home from work and Cindy was sitting in a chair in the corner staring off into space, I went over to her and asked what was wrong and when she answered she was not making any sense, she was slurring her words and wasn’t sure where she was or what was wrong, she was completely confused and scared.  So I rushed her to the emergency room, it turns out at 46 year old she had a stroke. They immediately hospitalized her in ICU for 3 days then moving her to their stroke center for another 7 days. The stroke mostly affected her memory and some of her motor skills. She had trouble remembering events and doing simple arithmetic, along with terrible mood swings. Between all the doctors & hospital bills along with treatments, we found our savings disappeared quickly. I didn't care my only concern was getting Cindy better.

Thus began our next challenge which made the others pale in comparison, getting Cindy back to herself.

It has been a long road since June 2010, many changes. Shortly after Cindy’s stroke I became injured on the job, and was promptly let go. This left us with no insurance and with Cindy’s medical conditions, impossible for us to get her any insurance, at least any we could afford and would cover any pre-existing conditions.  We did manage to get her on Social Security Disability, which has helped. But to our surprise SSD has a two and a half year period before they cover any medical with Medicare. The one thing she needs the most she can’t get. Even the state programs were no help, since she was getting SSD, she didn't quailfy for state medicare. This left us having to cover any medical straight out of pocket.

Over the past 2 years Cindy has made great improvements, she is able to get around pretty well, but does require a cane to keep her balance, she suffers from migraine headaches from the stroke. But surprisingly, she keeps in good spirits. She is still battling her diabetes and weight, but with her disabilities from her stroke she is not able to exercise and stay as active as she could before her stroke.

Cindy has gotten to a point in her recovery where if she was able to lose the extra weight and get the diabetes under control she would be able to get back to a normal life, where she could get out and spend more time with our son, and remove some of the stress the weight has put on her knees and back.

We are asking for donations to fund the Gastric Bypass Surgery & recovery expeneses along with her continuing health care needs. We can't help that think if she had gotten the surgery that it might have prevented Cindy's Stroke.

Our goal is to get Cindy back to a healthly weight and to control the diabetes so she can live a long and heathly life.

If you’ve gotten this far reading about Cindy’s Story I want to thank you for at least reading it, and thank you even more if you decide to help by donate to our cause to help Cindy get her life back, every little bit helps!

Thank You!

story:
Ink is Hip - Fund for Penelope’s Medical Expenses

Donations to Ink is Hip will be used for double hip surgery and rehabilitation expenses for Penelope, Owner and Queen Bee Tattoo Artist at Chameleon Ink Tattoo & Body Piercing. Penelope, loved and respected by many, is well known in the Bellingham, Washington tattoo community.

“Those who know Penelope might describe her personality as somewhere between outgoing and outrageous. When people meet her they seldom forget her.”

Penelope is young for someone who requires hip replacement surgery. Her active lifestyle has been greatly affected over the last two years as deterioration of both her hip joints has become more severe.  She seldom leaves home, as she can do only a modest amount of moving around, and is frequently in pain.  Our goal is to help Penelope to recover from her surgery, so she can get around on her own, and live a more fulfilling life.  Ultimately, we would like to see her tattoo once again.

Our goal is to raise $14,000 by September 30, 2012. We ask you to contribute whatever you can afford, from $5 to $500 or more.  You can donate as often as you like.  

Remember that dream tattoo you’ve always wanted? When you donate to Ink is Hip you can receive a Tattoo Gift Certificate to cover the cost, and help us reach our goal.  At every giving level, you will receive select Perks as a token of our appreciation for your contribution. Receive from over $2,500 in donated gifts, like Tattoo and Body Piercing Gift Certificates, t-shirts, tattoo photography books, body jewelry and other tattoo related merchandise.  

We want to thank area business owners, tattoo shop owners, tattoo artists and body piercing technicians, as well as Chameleon Ink’s staff, for their donations of cash, gifts, and other in-kind services.

Bellingham Tattoo Shops owners and most artists know one another. Despite competition, people in our tattoo community care that we all live healthy and happy lives; you might call it a brotherhood of artists. We have seen how these people have responded to crisis to help one another. Now, we are asking for help beyond our close circle of friends, to include others who can identify with with Penelope’s circumstances.

It’s easy to contribute….simply go to the campaign page on www.indiegogo.com ~  Ink is Hip       www.chameleoninktattoo.com  ●   www.facebook.com/chameleonink  ●  www.twitter.com/ChameleonInk

Penelope started her tattoo apprenticeship in 1996 after working in the hair industry for many years.  After her baptism of ink, she continued working at Bellingham shops perfecting her skills. Since 1999 she has operated her own studio, Wicked Witch Tattoo in Birch Bay, Washington. Today, she manages staff at Chameleon Ink Tattoo & Body Piercing in Bellingham, Washington, establishing a reputation for the finest quality work in the region.

Have a great idea to help us reach our goal, or an in-kind contribution? We would love to hear from you!

You can email us at chameleonink@live.com

Thank you for your help!

Have a great idea to help us reach our goal, or an in-kind contribution? We would love to hear from you! 
You can email us at chameleonink@live.com
Thank you for your help!

story:
Introduction

First we want to say thank you and welcome to all of our BBB supporters! My name is Kevin Barringer. My business partner, Fernando Ornelas, and I need your help to raise $375,000, to open a our own Functional Training (Think CrossFit) Body Boxing Fitness Center. We need the money to lease, renovate and equip a new kick butt training facility as well as cover the operating/marketing expenses for the first year of operation.

Here are some examples of the workout facility we want to build for Los Angeles:

  • Similar Fitness Center 1 No Boxing Gym
  • Similar Fitness Center 2 No Boxing Gym
  • Similar Fitness Center 3 No Boxing Gym
  • Boxing Gym #1
  • Boxing Gym #2

About BBB!

Body Boxing Bootcamp was created to be something totally original and different from the traditional modes of fitness workouts or other boot camps!

Body Boxing focuses on sculpting the entire body thru a combination of various types of fitness training such as Boxing/Thai Kick Boxing, Resistance Training (rubber bands and light weight lifting), Plyometrics (jumping and quick movement drills), Calisthenics (using one's own body weight), Obstacle Courses, Circuit Training, Parachute Running, and anything else we can dream up for the day! 

We do this in a very unique way by breaking down each one-hour class into 12-15 min intense workout sections (Warm up & Abs, Strength & Conditioning, Speed & Agility, Boxing/Thai Kick Boxing), which is great for keeping workouts fresh and fun so that clients never get bored and are always challenged. 

Body Boxing Bootcamp services everyone including beginners, advanced fitness enthusiast, overweight kids, baby boomers as well as many celebrities living in Bel Air, Beverly Hills, Park La Brea,  Hollywood, West Hollywood, West Los Angeles, and Mid Wilshire Area of Southern California (CA).

        Donate and Receive Valuable Perks as Well as a Great Return on Your                                                                     Investment!

In return for helping us raise money for our new Fitness Center you will receive cool BBB workout apparel, a number of our patented Bootcamp classes and option to launch your own personal training business using our BBB Fitness Center model and business plan. Not to forget the great feeling you will receive by knowing that you've helped someone achieve a worthwhile goal.

Benefits of Joining Our Body Boxing Bootcamps

Common benefits discovered by beginner Bootcamp students are loss of weight and body fat combined with increased self-confidence after committing to a course. Advanced students find the routines challenging and fun and are always pushed to new heights they never thought possible!


BBB Offers 3 Different Workouts

Body Boxing Bootcamp

Booty Boxing Bootcamp

Boogie Boxing Bootcamp


The BBB Staff has 30 Years of Fitness Experience

Combined we have a total of 30 years of experience working in the physical fitness industry.  We got into the industry not as a career move, but as a lifestyle choice to improve our physical health and well-being.  Being that we were overweight children carrying over into our early adulthood, we turned to fitness training and boxing as a way to lose weight, build confidence and gain control over our physical lives.

In order to help adults as well as children achieve their fitness goals and gain self confidence, we started Body Boxing Bootcamp in 2008 and developed it into a successful business with over 60 customers, 75% of which have been with us from the very start.  We now want to expand our Body Boxing operations and increase our marketing reach by leveraging a physical, mortar-and-brick Bootcamp location. 

 


Building a BBB Fitness Center has many Benefits

A centralized Body Boxing facility will allow our members to take their training to the next level! In addition, our members will have access to locker rooms affording them more time to enjoy the full benefits of a BBB class without having to dash home before going to work! It will provide secure parking lots as well as protection from inclement weather, a current problem of hosting classes in an outdoor environment.

A Body Boxing Bootcamp Workout Center will give us a home base for our operations and boot camp classes. It will also provide our business with a much better marketing opportunity to increase our BBB's brand visibility, and lure customers away from competing fitness centers. Curious customers will now be able to stop by our new fitness center to visit with staff members and/or take a "free" trial class before signing up for our more affordable 3-month and 6-month bootcamp workout packages.

What the Community Will Receive

A quick review of our perks/rewards will reveal that we are more than willing to give something back to the community that supports us.  As we expand, we will have plenty of room for many new personal trainers including many of our competitors that will be welcome to workout in our new training facility. 

For donors in Los Angeles, we are offering some great deals on Body Boxing workout packages complete with a satisfaction guarantee.


Banks Won't Give Loans to Small Businesses

Although we have invested a significant amount of our own time and money into our business and have developed a loyal customer base, we have been turned down by numerous banks when seeking a small business loan because we do not have any assets to borrow against.  As many small businesses have done, we have turned our fate over to indiegogo’s crowdfunding platform as it is our only means of expanding our operations and providing a better workout environment and opportunities for our members.

U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics: Demand for Personal Trainers will Increase by                                                          31.7%

Based on the research reports included at the bottom of this page, it is crystal clear that the fitness center industry offers a distinctive value-added business proposition. Staying healthy and lean, and looking and feeling one’s best, as well as managing stress and gaining self confidence are values that Americans prize highly.

"Fitness industry jobs are expected to grow for a number of reasons. First, businesses and insurance companies are offering incentives for employees to join health clubs,” said Matt Dotson, an economist for the Bureau of Labor Statistics. “Also, as the baby boomers age, they’re encouraged to exercise in order to counteract the effects of aging.”

According to Dotson, personal training and instructor jobs are the occupations driving the majority of increase in the fitness industry and those jobs are expected to grow by 31.7 percent through the year 2020.

BBB Business Plan

For donors who live outside of Los Angeles, we will provide a white paper or DVD on how to get into the fitness business. BBB will train you and provide all the equipment necessary to setup a similar Body Boxing facility in your home town. 

In a sense, donors will have access to a very low cost-of-entry to get into the Body Boxing personal fitness business without paying the fees associated with a typical franchise business. Our goal is to teach anyone how to become a personal trainer, while perfecting our business development strategies and marketing rollout programs to ensure that future BBB fitness centers will have a better than average success rate. 


Other Ways to Donate include Posting Our Story to You Social Media Circles

If you believe in our BBB business model but do not have sufficient funds to donate money, please do your part by sharing our story with your friends, family and business colleagues via social media, especially if they have an interest in starting their own personal training business.

Our press kit provides some very interesting fitness industry research facts, expert/industry analyst quotes and growth projections that detail why the time is right to get into the body boxing fitness business.

Please share this information with your social networking circles via posts, blogs, tweets, and/or email and include this link: 

                             http://igg.me/at/Body-Boxing-Bootcamp/x/1907888

If you have room, please include the #3bbootcamp hash tag so we can keep track of our social media mentions.

Members of the Press

If you are a reporter, please call Robert Hoskins, Front Page PR, at (512) 627-6622.  He has a full electronic press kit, press releases, photos, and numerous fitness research reports that are full of cool facts and figures. He is very responsive and will be glad to setup a quick 10-minute phone interview.

Press Releases:

BBB Bootcamp Offers 50% Discount on Body, Booty, Boxing Workout Indiegogo Gift Cards That Make Perfect Gifts for Birthdays, Holidays and 2014 New Year's Resolutions to Start Working Out

BBB Bootcamp Adds a SmartPhone Workout App to Crowdfunding Campaign as a Fundraising Perk to Help Raise Money to Build New Boxing Fitness Center in Hollywood, CA

Body Boxing Bootcamp Launches Indiegogo Fitness Crowdfunding Campaign to Finance Their State-of-the-Art Boot Camp Workout Center for Clients and Personal Trainers in Los Angeles

Fitness Industry White Papers:

If you are really interested in getting into the personal training business, you should read through the following white papers and research studies:

  • Fitness Industries Pump Up Revenue - IBISWorld Research
  • Business Case for Starting a Personal Fitness Training Center
  • #1 Fitness Trend is Growth of Experienced Fitness Professional Jobs
  • Fitness Growth Opportunities Generated by Current Focus on Healthy Living
  • Fitness and Wellness Intertwine:  A Major Industry Rises

These fitness research studies provide extensive research statistics, industry analyst quotes and fitness industry growth projections why the time is right to get into the fitness industry in order to meet the growing demand for our body boxing fitness services. Our business model is already successful and we are ready to move up to the next level.

Recent Media Coverage:
Broadway World - BBB Bootcamp Adds SmartPhone Workout App to Build New Boxing Fitness Center in Hollywood
Crowdfunding Press Center - Body Boxing Bootcamp Launches Indiegogo Fitness Crowdfunding Campaign to Finance their State-of-the-Art Boot Camp Workout Center for Clients and Personal Trainers in Los Angeles
Billboard Magazine - Kevin Barringer Works Out Sylvia Rhone, CEO Of Vested in Culture
One Nation News - Body Boxing Bootcamp launches Indiegogo fitness crowdfunding campaign 
Los Angeles Daily News - BBB Bootcamp Launches Indiegogo Campaign to Fun New Body Boxing Fitness Center
Yahoo! News - Body Boxing Bootcamp Launches Indiegogo Fitness Crowdfunding Campaign

story:
Our story

Before the ages of steam and internal combustion engines, sailing boats powered by winds of nature ruled the seas. In times when roaring engines and smelly exhaust gasses are no longer welcome, it is time to return to this tradition.

Sailing is one of the most exciting and at the same time relaxing activities there is, but somehow it has been taken away from most of us. Mainly because of the high cost of boats and difficulty in mastering sailing itself. With Catri 25 this is no longer a problem!

Based on our designer's and team member's Aldis Eglajs 40 years experience of boat building, we have changed the construction of our yacht so that it can be used by both - pros, who crave speed and high performance, and individuals looking for some “me time” or a pleasant day with friends or family.

The revolutionary Catri 25 will be a serious alternative to consider even for motor boat enthusiasts - the speed, stability, safety and comfort are almost on par. The best part - you can travel for miles without spending a dime, making noise, or polluting the water. This is especially important in case of shallow waters, where propellers cause microclimat changes leading to death of fish and other flora and fauna. In the age when environmental protection is the personal responsibility of every individual - Catri 25 will be the water craft of choise for all those who care. Even more, with innovative releasing system invented by Aldis Eglajs capsizing on Catri is impossible, and this is most important point of safety! Our next step is to develop bigger high speed Catri trimarans to provide even more possibilities for comfortable and safe long distance travels for larger groups.

How is it done? 

Catri 25 uses the hydrofoil technology with a patented twist of our own, that has been developed based on extensive research, mathematical modelling and decades of experience. All patents, issued in this field in the last years, have to do with moving hydrofoil stabilization mechanisms, whereas our patented Catri Foiler solution simply attaches the “feather” at the end of the “arrow”, thus making all kinds of regulating mechanisms irrelevant and achieving unprecedented stability, safety and speed of the craft.

In our tests we have found the right combination of all the components and created a trimaran that is stable, easy to sail, and has the potential of being the fastest boat in its class. Catri 25 is a 25 foot long trimaran on underwater wings which have been calculated to be able to lift this birdie 100% above the surface of water. It`s almost as if you would be flying just above the waterline. 

Why is Catri 25 so awesome?

  • It could be the fastest boat in its class 
  • It is extremely stable & safe  even at sea and during gusty winds 
  • Easy to operate and steer 
  • Can be folded and transported conveniently on a slightly adapted trailer (see the picture below) 
  • It is spacious – can easily accommodate a team of 3-4 members for long trips Participate in races or use it for cruises.

In the past 10 months, driven by our passion and trust in our technology, we invested our own resources in manufacturing the main hull, outriggers, beam, wings, mast, and other parts of the craft. We have set up a shipyard and created molds for different boat components in order to make our sea bird available not only for professionals, but also for middle class sailing individuals. Our team has proven their loyalty and devotion for Catri project - their enthusiasm has been one of the main driving forces of this project from day one. 

Sadly - the amount of finacial resources necessary for getting this bird into water is out of our reach, since prototyping and design improvements always make slight corrections in projects of this type and scale. 

Luckily - this is where YOU come in! 

 

What can I do to launch Catri & what I'll get? 

We are almost at the finish line of our project – the estimated time necessary to reach our goal – a fully operational Catri 25 trimaran ready to break records, is 2 months after raising funds. What we need is a final push in amount of €43 000. So to answer the question above:

  • pledge
  • Share 
  • Promote 
  • Discuss 
  • Ask us questions 
  • Do anything that comes to your mind and could help us all get there! 

 

 

What does my pledge cover? 

For the last stage of our project we still need to: 

  • Manufacture remaining metal components - €11 400 
  • Purchase additional equipment (ropes, winches, etc.) - €13 200 
  • Sew sails - €10 900
  • Assemble the whole thing - €7 500 
  • Enjoy the beauty and performance of Catri 25 

Total expenses: €43 000 

 

 

Additional information and questions: 

  • More information about the project, technicalities and hydrofoil problem/solution can be found on our website
  • Do not hesitate to ask questions here on Indiegogo or
  • Contact us via our website

THANKS TO ALL OF YOU !

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Holly. I am 27 and have had type 1 diabetes for 16 years. I'm trying to get the new Medtronic Minimed 530G with Enlite. It is an insulin pump/continuous glucose monitoring sensor system that is the first step toward an artificial pancreas for diabetics.

What We Need & What You Get

The pump without the sensors costs over $7000. If I get a pump without the sensor, it will still cost me at least $1000 for my copay plus supplies. I am hoping to raise enough to get the new pump, but if I don't, the funds will go toward paying my copay for the older pump and supplies. Anything that doesn't go toward getting a pump and supplies will be donated to the American Diabetes Association and the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation.

The Impact

This pump will prevent me from going into diabetic shock. The sensor alerts the pump when blood sugars fall below 90 and if the alarm isn't responded to, the pump will temporarily suspend insulin delivery until the blood sugar is back to a healthy level. My blood sugars are very difficult to control and the pump will help immensely.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this, even if you can't donate. I need this pump and I can't afford it on my own. I'm hoping for the kindness of others to help me. Thank you for taking the time to read this and a huge thanks to anyone who could help or share.

story:
WHO AM I and HOW DID THIS GET STARTED?

My name is Colleen King, and I'm a single mom.  As if that weren't a hard enough job, children in this day and age are growing up in a technology-saturated world.  Yet supervision of that world is limited, especially with the current types of parental controls, where you have to download a program to one computer, and then be on that actual device to change any of the settings. 

I took my 10 year-old son to a convention for a popular online game he plays, and spoke to several parents who, like me, wondered how to best protect our children from internet dangers, as well as device overuse.  When we got home from that trip, we were tired and slept in late.  I woke in the morning to find that my son had gotten up really early and had already been online gaming for 4 hours!  That's when the idea for Wolf Monitor came to me, and I even incorporated the wolf theme because that is my son's favorite animal.  

WHAT IF:

  • whenever he tried to log onto our laptop, the computer would SEND A NOTIFICATION to my smartphone letting me know he wants to get on the computer?
  • I had the ability to ACCEPT OR DENY HIS REQUEST with a simple click from my smartphone? 
  • it were possible to RESPOND with a personal message "No, it's too early, go back to bed." "Yes, you can play (name of online game) for an hour, and then you have to do your homework." or whatever? 

Then I thought about more things I'd like to be able to do...

WHAT IF:

  • I could BLOCK ACCESS to certain sites or apps that pose a potential threat? 
  • somehow, a filter would see certain KEYWORDS as unsafe and block content as needed?
  • I could keep track of not only HOW MUCH TIME he's on any of his devices, but what apps or websites he's USING MOST?
  • parents with several kids could  KEEP TRACK OF YOUR PACK from one easy to use interface/service?
  • all of this parental control could be accessed FROM ANY DEVICE WITH WIFI and I could monitor ANY DEVICE, like our laptop or his smartphone?  

So, I reached out to a development team to see if my idea was possible, and Wolf Monitor was created, BY PARENTS FOR PARENTS!

Basic Membership in the Wolf Monitor service would be only $14.95 per month, a small amount to pay to keep your kids safe online, and using their devices for a reasonable amount of time each day.  Here are some examples of the features currently in development.

"Wolf Monitor allows parents to not only monitor all activity on their child's supported devices, but it gives them the ability to control what their kids can access on those devices in real-time.  If a child wants to use an application that their parents have blocked, for any reason, our application will facilitate the communication from their device to their child's device to unblock the application for a specified period of time, and ensure that the time limits are enforced.  Parents will no longer have to change the parental control settings, type in a password, be in the room, use a different account, or even be home to quickly give them access to an application.  Granting access is quick and easy from your mobile device.

Our real-time reporting allows parents to see trends over the life of their account and know what applications their children are accessing.  What are they spending most of their time on?

Our aim as far as content filtering (on supported devices) is to provide a service to process all HTTP (Internet) traffic to and from monitored devices for the user accounts that are set-up for monitoring.  Standard filters will be put in place, but additional filters can be applied by parents.  If a parent wants to block a web address or keywords, Wolf Monitor will enforce that restriction.

PC Monitoring is broken down by account.  Accounts that are not set up as a "Monitored Account" on the system are ignored.  Only activity within a monitored child's account will be tracked.

Other features and settings surround these, but there are too many to list here, and many of them are listed in the video."

Joshua Foulk

Chief Technical Officer

Wolf Monitoring Systems LLC



We are also developing additional features to add to the basic service, some of which may be for a small additional fee each month, such as app blocking, number blocking for chat or phone calls, GPS tracking, or even a super value-added feature of advanced Facebook monitoring that would help monitor and prevent online bullying.  

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this important breakthrough in parental controls possible for parents everywhere, we need your help to fund the creation and promotion of Wolf Monitor.

We have set a goal of $35,000 for this project. Those funds would cover:

  • Development Team Fees for coding and development of our web-based service, its interface, the apps for devices and smartphones, a member database, and all other aspects of the design of the service.  (This service will be completely secure and unhackable to provide members with the highest possible security and piece of mind.)
  • Website Development
  • Legal Fees for Licensing, Trademarking, etc.
  • State and Federal fees for basic business startup.
  • Promotional materials.
  • Marketing opportunities, such as technology conventions, gaming conventions, etc.
  • Advertising.
  • Misc Fees as they arise.

If we raise funds beyond our goal, our Development Team could continue developing the additional features listed above, as well as others, and we could also acquire office space to continue the success and development of Wolf Monitoring Systems LLC.  Even if we don't reach our goal, funds will still go towards the development of this much-needed service to protect kids and teens.

Our wonderful supporters get GREAT PERKS!!!  

***In the perk description above, service is listed as expected to release in April.  We are working hard to get it completed and tested as fast as we can, so let's say it will be ready by May, and if it's available for full release sooner, that's all the better! :)***

The Impact

In this ever-expanding digital age, we as parents have the RESPONSIBILITY TO PROTECT our kids from all the new dangers that keep popping up everywhere, whether it be the latest photo-taking app, private texting app, or skype-linked online game server.  Just as the whole pack of wolves work together to raise their young, we can work together to keep kids safe!

  • This service is something that every parent whose child loves using their devices can benefit from.  
  • Parents who have the ability to instantly monitor their child's device usage provide their kids with much needed ACCOUNTABILITY for their actions.  This helps children to increase their productivity and keeps them on track and in check with their goals.
  • My desire is to help every parent be aware of the internet and app dangers that their kids face, and to equip them to face that danger with fangs bared to protect their precious pups!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can’t help!

  • HELP get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • USE the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word so we can reach our goals!

story:
Do You Have the Nerve2Cure?

 

Diabetic foot pain or peripheral neuropathy causes terrible pain for millions of people. You probably know someone who suffers with this excruciating disease. It might be a parent, grandparent, brother, sister or a close friend. Maybe it’s you!

TronaLife Neuropathy Pain Cream can help their pain without any side effects. 

Dan Lunt, President/CEO of TronaLife, knows what it’s like to see a loved one suffer with neuropathy. Two sisters and his mother-in-law all deal with this painful condition. Some say it feels like a thousand needles sticking into the soles of their feet. Others compare it to having a blow-torch held to their feet.

So Dan went looking for a solution to help his family members. 

Natural product soothes pain & enhances healing.

While looking for an answer, Dan met a chemist, Pete Fuller, who had done a lot of work for NASA and had developed a unique (patent pending) formula consisting of natural herb and mineral elements that enhances sub-cutaneous circulation when applied to the skin.

The potential applications were exciting!

Together with Pete and another chemist who specializes in homeopathic formulations, Dan was able to produce a soothing and healing lotion that not only relieves pain but enhances healing by improving blood circulation in the area of application.

Subsequently, hundreds of testers have reported significant relief from their peripheral neuropathy pain with the added benefit of healthier skin and no reported side effects. TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream worked like a miracle and Dan's family members finally had the relief they had been praying for.

TronaLife NRC relieves the pain with no side effects.

Dan has produced several relatively small batches of TronaLife NRC for testing purposes and for friends and family who were desperate for some relief. Through word-of-mouth, demand for TronaLife has been growing. People with PN from causes other than diabetes reasoned that if it worked for diabetic PN, why not for PN from chemo-therapy, or from surgeries? As more people tried it, the potential for relief continued to grow. It has been very gratifying to see people who have suffered for years, suddenly find relief. 

 

Read what is being said about TronaLife NRC:

I have been evaluating the efficacy of TronaLife’s formula in my clinic over the past 18 months, and have found it to be effective for promoting the healing of wounds and reducing the discomfort of peripheral neuropathy. TronaLife’s base formula includes natural mineral and homeopathic ingredients proven to reduce pain and inflammation while gently promoting dilation of the small blood vessels, improving circulation and enhancing the delivery of nutrients to and the elimination of waste from cells. The results have been remarkable and include enhanced healing, less pain and better health. -Sherman B. Johnson, MD., Advanced Wound Care and Hyperbaric Healing Systems, Taylorsville, UT

Before trying the TronaLife neuropathy relief cream, my feet and legs would swell so bad by mid-afternoon, I’d have to elevate my legs. Just to touch them would hurt. Since I’ve been using TronaLife, the swelling in my feet and legs is gone and I’m able to touch my legs without pain. - Vera, Sandy, UT

I have neuropathy in my feet as a result of diabetes. The pain is with me constantly and makes it uncomfortable to walk or even wear shoes, but the worst pain comes at night when I try to go to sleep. Sometimes the burning sensation is so severe that even though I know it can’t be so, I find myself lifting the sheets to look at my feet simply to reassure myself that they are not literally on fire. Since I started using the TronaLife Cream, my pain has virtually gone away. It is so nice to get a good night’s sleep again! - Doug L, Sandy, UT

I am a diabetic with peripheral neuropathy in my feet and hands. Some days my feet and hands are so numb I can barely walk or even pick up objects. I started to use TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream on my feet. As I put the cream on my feet, I would use my hands to do so. As a result, not only has the numbness in my feet gone away, but also the numbness in my hands. I can now walk much better and I am able to pick up small items that use to be hard to even hold. - Arolyn V. Salt Lake City, UT

FINALLY SOME ACTUAL RELIEF!!! Just sent through my 2nd order after experiencing some relief after 7 YEARS of CONSTANT PAIN (blow torch burning, exacto knife sharp pain & electric shocks from nerves)…..the 1st and ONLY product to ACTUALLY DO WHAT WAS PROMISED!!! I WILL be discussing Tronalife with my Primary MD & my Endocronologist at my next visits in March!! THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!! - Donna Wanke, West Bend, WI 

I have diabetes and experienced tingling along with a genetic foot condition of muscle tightness in my heels which causes extreme pain when walking. Wearing any shoe for more than a few hours and then constantly having to massage my feet during the day to even be able to walk to my car was my normal, until being introduced to TronaLife Neuropathy Cream. I can confidently walk in any shoe without pain and have been able to continue my goal of running a half marathon with my husband! Thanks TronaLife. - Breanne J. Salt Lake City, UT 

 Everyone wants TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream.

It is estimated that over 19 million people in the U.S. suffer from peripheral neuropathy. The largest percentage is caused by diabetes - a disease that is growing at an alarming rate. The big picture is one of suffering at a monumental level.

How can you calculate the cost of so many people in pain and unable to function at full capacity?

Knowing how much it can help, Dan has worked hard to produce more product and get the word out. "It is wonderful," he says, "to be able to help people who suffer from the excruciating pain of diabetic nerve pain," but he would like to do more.  

Without your help, we can’t produce enough to help everyone.

 

To produce TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream at a price that is affordable for people, we need to manufacture the cream in larger lots. Everything about the product including bottles, labels, caps and contents becomes less expensive in higher quantities. But this is an expense that is incurred on the front end.

On the other hand, with sufficient inventory, not only can we meet existing demand but we can also promote TronaLife with confidence to many more people who need the relief but are unaware that this product exists.

"If we have enough money, we can stop the suffering for literally tens of thousands of suffering people.”

 

Help us to relieve the pain for thousands who suffer from peripheral neuropathy. TronaLife's Neuropathy Relief Cream provides relief without awful side effects!

 

$20,000 can reduce the suffering of thousands of good people.

We need $20,000 to manufacture enough TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream to fill the orders, get the word out to more people and help those family members and friends we love get relief from their constant pain.

And, of course, if we can raise even more, we can help even more.

What Your Donations will Be Used For?

It is expensive to manufacture and market enough TronaLife NRC to help thousands of sufferers. Here is what we will do with your support:

  • Product manufacturing, including:
    • Updated bottles and labels
    • Packaging for retail applications
    • Sufficient quantities to keep prices low and meet demand
  • Marketing - we have to get the word out

Additionally, not only during this campaign but on an ongoing basis, we will donate a generous portion of our revenues to diabetes research.

Diabetes: Getting to the Root of the Problem.

While peripheral neuropathy can have many causes, the leading cause is diabetes. As long as diabetes remains a growing problem, the problem with peripheral neuropathy will grow as well. 

"Frankly," Dan says, "a growing problem might be good for our business but it is a horrible drain on society and on the individuals who suffer. Our hope is that someday soon, a cure for diabetes can be found that will eliminate a major part of this problem."

"With that in mind, we are donating a generous amount from each sale of our product to the American Diabetes Association and the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation to be used to help find a cure."

 

To Show Our Appreciation to You:

Your support means more to us than you will ever know. To show our appreciation we want to give you some gifts. It is the least we can do.

 

$10 Gift

For a gift of $10 we will give you a heart-felt thank you from Dan Lunt, our CEO, and list you as a donor on our website (if desired). 

 

$25 Gift

For a gift of $25 we will give you one bottle of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream, a personalized hand written note from Dan, and list you as a donor on our website (if desired).

$45 Gift

For a gift of $45 we will give you the nifty cell phone holder you see below, one bottle of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream, a personal hand written thank you from Dan, the CEO, and 5 TronaLife wrist-bands you can give to your family and friends. They will help spread the word that there is relief for those who have neuropathy, with no awful side effects. We will also recognize you as a donor on our website (if desired).

 

 

 

 A $45 Gift

For $45 we will give you 2 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream to share with someone who has painful neuropathy, a personal thank from Dan, recognition on our website (if desired), and a stylish wrist-band.

 

$75 Dollars

For $75 we will give you a back pack, 2 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream to give to those you love, 5 wrist-bands to spread the word that there is now relief from their pain, recognition on our website (if desired), and the personalized note from Dan expressing his deepest thank you.

 

 

Your $100 Gift

For your $100 support we will send you a handy cell phone holder, 3 bottles of TronaLife Relief Cream, a nifty cinch-bag back pack, 5 wrist-bands, and a personalized note from Dan.

 

 

$150 Gift

4 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream. If you feel amazingly generous and give us a $150 gift, we will  send you a very cool zombie action figure (these are really popular right now), the back pack, 5 wrist bands, and a cell phone holder, plus a personalized VIDEO thank you from Dan, the CEO.

 

Kids will love the Zombie action figure.

 $250 Gift to the First 25 donations

If you can find your way to share $250 with us, you will get one of only 25 cool looking professional security carry-on cases with wheels. There are only 25 so the first 25 donors to give at this level get one. When they’re gone, they’re gone.

 

 

 

We will also send you 6 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream that you can either use for yourself or give to suffering friends and family, the zombie action figure, the back pack, 5 wrist bands, and a cell phone holder.

 

$500 Gift

For a $500 gift, we will make you a member of TronaLife’s Elite Customer Advisory board. We will also send you 12 bottles of TronaLife Relief Cream, 10 wrist-bands, the zombie action figure, the back pack, and a cell phone holder. As a member of the Advisory board, you will be included in at least one annual online board meeting and regular status updates. Dan will even call you personally to thank you and to discuss important matters involving TronaLife's strategic direction. 

 

So far, we have been able to help hundreds of diabetic neuropathy sufferers, but that is as far as we can go without your help. Now it is up to you to bring much needed pain relief to thousands who are suffering. 

Together we will change the world by providing life changing pain relief to the thousands who suffer now - your friends and loved ones who can’t go to the store or the movies or any number of other life activities due to debilitating pain. Nothing can make a bigger difference than relief from terrible pain. You can help them. 

 

 $20,000 will help thousands of sufferers and jump start the TronaLife company. The gifts above are just a small token of our appreciation. Will you help?

Thank you for your generous support and for proving that you have the Nerve2Cure.

It is expensive to manufacture and market enough TronaLife NRC to help thousands of sufferers. Here is what we will do with your support:

Product manufacturing, including:

Updated bottles and labels
Packaging for retail applications
Sufficient quantities to keep prices low and meet demand


Marketing - we have to get the word out
Additionally, not only during this campaign but on an ongoing basis, we will donate a generous portion of our revenues to diabetes research.
Diabetes: Getting to the Root of the Problem.
While peripheral neuropathy can have many causes, the leading cause is diabetes. As long as diabetes remains a growing problem, the problem with peripheral neuropathy will grow as well. 
"Frankly," Dan says, "a growing problem might be good for our business but it is a horrible drain on society and on the individuals who suffer. Our hope is that someday soon, a cure for diabetes can be found that will eliminate a major part of this problem."
"With that in mind, we are donating a generous amount from each sale of our product to the American Diabetes Association and the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation to be used to help find a cure."
 
To Show Our Appreciation to You:
Your support means more to us than you will ever know. To show our appreciation we want to give you some gifts. It is the least we can do.
 
$10 Gift
For a gift of $10 we will give you a heart-felt thank you from Dan Lunt, our CEO, and list you as a donor on our website (if desired). 
 
$25 Gift
For a gift of $25 we will give you one bottle of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream, a personalized hand written note from Dan, and list you as a donor on our website (if desired).

$45 Gift
For a gift of $45 we will give you the nifty cell phone holder you see below, one bottle of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream, a personal hand written thank you from Dan, the CEO, and 5 TronaLife wrist-bands you can give to your family and friends. They will help spread the word that there is relief for those who have neuropathy, with no awful side effects. We will also recognize you as a donor on our website (if desired).
 
 
 
 A $45 Gift
For $45 we will give you 2 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream to share with someone who has painful neuropathy, a personal thank from Dan, recognition on our website (if desired), and a stylish wrist-band.
 
$75 Dollars
For $75 we will give you a back pack, 2 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream to give to those you love, 5 wrist-bands to spread the word that there is now relief from their pain, recognition on our website (if desired), and the personalized note from Dan expressing his deepest thank you.
 
 
Your $100 Gift
For your $100 support we will send you a handy cell phone holder, 3 bottles of TronaLife Relief Cream, a nifty cinch-bag back pack, 5 wrist-bands, and a personalized note from Dan.
 

 
$150 Gift
4 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream. If you feel amazingly generous and give us a $150 gift, we will  send you a very cool zombie action figure (these are really popular right now), the back pack, 5 wrist bands, and a cell phone holder, plus a personalized VIDEO thank you from Dan, the CEO.
 

Kids will love the Zombie action figure.
 $250 Gift to the First 25 donations
If you can find your way to share $250 with us, you will get one of only 25 cool looking professional security carry-on cases with wheels. There are only 25 so the first 25 donors to give at this level get one. When they’re gone, they’re gone.
 
 
 
We will also send you 6 bottles of TronaLife Neuropathy Relief Cream that you can either use for yourself or give to suffering friends and family, the zombie action figure, the back pack, 5 wrist bands, and a cell phone holder.
 
$500 Gift
For a $500 gift, we will make you a member of TronaLife’s Elite Customer Advisory board. We will also send you 12 bottles of TronaLife Relief Cream, 10 wrist-bands, the zombie action figure, the back pack, and a cell phone holder. As a member of the Advisory board, you will be included in at least one annual online board meeting and regular status updates. Dan will even call you personally to thank you and to discuss important matters involving TronaLife's strategic direction. 
 
So far, we have been able to help hundreds of diabetic neuropathy sufferers, but that is as far as we can go without your help. Now it is up to you to bring much needed pain relief to thousands who are suffering. 
Together we will change the world by providing life changing pain relief to the thousands who suffer now - your friends and loved ones who can’t go to the store or the movies or any number of other life activities due to debilitating pain. Nothing can make a bigger difference than relief from terrible pain. You can help them. 
 
 $20,000 will help thousands of sufferers and jump start the TronaLife company. The gifts above are just a small token of our appreciation. Will you help?
Thank you for your generous support and for proving that you have the Nerve2Cure.

story:
Their Story

Kelcie is my sister and Larry is her fiancé. On March 10, 2010 Larry showed me the ring he was getting kelcie to propose to her with in Disneyland that following week. That night, he got hit by a drunk driver and experienced a severe traumatic brain injury that he continues to recover from today. 

He was in a coma for months with Kelcie by his side. She gave up everything to work with him and to help him get better. She even began working at the facility he went to so she could spend as much time with Larry as possible. 

Now 3 years later, Larry continues to get better and was finally able to propose to Kelcie! He didn't get the chance to propose to her the way he had intended to, but we now have the chance to give this amazing couple the wedding and honeymoon of their dreams at their favorite place on earth, Disneyland. 

Due to the accident, Kelcie and Larry are unable to afford a wedding of any kind and would never imagine that getting married in Disneyland would be possible, but with your help we can make this fairy tale dream a reality! 


Now that we've made our goal!

Thank you all so so much for helping make Kelcie and Larry's dreams come true!  Now that we have reached the goal, we wanted to make sure everyone knew what would be done with any extra donations!

Larry continues to get all the therapy he can afford so that he can make a full recovery. Kelcie and Larry would love to get him even more speech and physical therapy along with any equipment that could make his recovery that much more successful! 

Thank you so much for your support thus far, and please continue to support them so they can truly have their happily ever after!

Here's a message from Kelcie and Larry!

"All I can say is WOW! When Mckenzie showed me the video and page for Larry and I, never in my wildest dreams did I imagine that we would reach our goal in just 11 days! I can't believe it! I am so thankful for all the wonderful people in our life! And thankful for all the people we know and all the people we don't know who took the time to watch the video and contribute to our dream wedding! I can't believe that Larry and I will be celebrating the happiest day of our lives in the happiest place on earth! 
People have been asking what we would do if we surpassed our goal! I couldn't have imagined it before but here we are! Larry still continues to receive any therapy we can get and will continue after the wedding too! If we had extra money we would put it towards Larry's recovery! We are always looking for the best therapy out there to help Larry to keep getting better! 
Thank you all for sharing our story and helping our dream come true! It's so overwhelming and wonderful, and we are beyond thankful! 
Love to each and every one of you, Kelc and Larr"


The Dream

Kelcie and Larry have a lot in common, but their most shared passion is their undying love for everything that is Disney. Getting married in Disneyland would be one of the most amazing experiences they've ever had, especially after everything they've been through together.

Unfortunately, this is of no little expense! Larry's many supporters including his family and ours would love to make this happen, but we simply do not have the funds necessary. This is where you come in!

Help us help Kelcie and Larry get married in Disneyland because they are a real life example of a fairy tale and of true love. 


The Costs

Getting married in Disneyland will cost Kelcie and Larry upwards of $15,000. The honeymoon, flights, and room expenses will cost upwards of $5,000. 

Total, their Disneyland wedding/honeymoon will cost around $20,000.

With their inspiring story and your help I think we can make their dreams come true.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, just spreading the word to everyone you know is just as valuable! Share the video or their Indiegogo profile on Facebook, twitter, or by good old fashioned email!

Thank you in advance for your help. You truly have no idea how much this will be appreciated and remembered by so many people, especially Kelcie and Larry.

story:
Month 2 and 3 Support

With a small contribution from you I can reach my goal of competing in my first professional athletic competition.   Thanks to the initial support of WOD Nation and the others during the first month we are making progress.


Follow My Video Diary Here
https://www.youtube.com/user/oldmanincrossfit 


My name is Rob Thorell, I am now 37, which in comparison to those who compete in Crossfit competitions, I am old.  However, I am also persistent, determined and hard working who will do everything possible to meet a goal I set.  And in this case I really really want to beat guys a decade younger than me which is going to require some help.

An early supporter WOD Nation provided the initial funding and is now backing me with promotion efforts but we can't do it alone.

I woke up one day late last year with pains in areas I didn't know I had which likely was due to my working out.  At that point I realized I probably only have a few good years of abuse left in my joints before I would have to scale back a bit.  Not one to go out slowly I decided to enter in the Spartan Trifecta race of which I have now completed the Sprint and the Super in the top 25% with the final 15 mile/8 hour Beast left in September. 

It occurred to me that if I was keeping myself in shape for the races then it would be possible for me to compete in a Crossfit competition if I got a little more serious and some help.  

I intend to compete in the The Crush Games August 22nd.  And I intend on qualifying and will do everything I can to make it to the finals on the 24th. 

The Help My Old Body Needs

In order to have a serious chance at qualifying in the summer Crossfit games and at my age and only 3 months to prepare without injury I've hired or signed up for the following:

  • Sports Injury Doctor - Brian "the needle"   In 2 weeks his acupuncture has already eliminated most of the pain in my shoulder and gave me a clean bill of health to train.   He has discounted our visits by 40% and I estimate 12 sessions are needed to stay healthy through the rigorous training. 
  • CrossFit trainer - A bad ass willing to take on the challenge of transforming an old man. Thanks to Coach Adrian Gongora, a regional qualifier, Raid games and Wodapalooza winner.  He has discounted his monthly fee for full programming and weekly 1 on 1 sessions. 
  • Supplements - With the rigours of training and the high intensity in the Florida heat getting the proper supplements are a must.  Pre/Post/Protein/BCAAs/Creatine/etc  
  • Diet - I need to slim down while keeping my energy up so I am going to select a food service like Primal Organic of Miami as the base with shakes and meal supplements. 
  • Registration - Cost to enter the competition  
  • Everything else...  ? 

While I will gladly accept any assistance I am only trying to raise enough money through sponsorship opportunities to cover about half of the costs of the training.  I want to be invested in this endeavour as well. 

Something For you while helping me

In addition to helping an aging guy achieve something that is typically left for kids half my age I would like to help you.  As a professional marketer and serial entrepreneur I will promote you and/or your products with weekly blogs, video blogs, instagram posts, tweets and mentions on facebook :

  • Reach my Facebook and my teams Facebook Friends (over 4000 like minded people)
  • Over 2000 Instagram followers
  • And promote your products with my story...  

Tell the world that you helped an older man go from casual crossfitter to crossfit competitor in only 90 days!
