story:
About Us

Our organization, Liberian Emergency and Disaster Relief Fund (LEADER Fund) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit tax exempt organization registered in the state of Maryland, United States of America in August 2007. The mission of the organization is to assist Liberians who are primarily affected by disasters and provide support in disaster or emergency situations.  Since the recent outbreak of Ebola in Liberia, Liberians have coalesced under the umberella of the LEADER Fund to establish a movement named Diaspora Liberians Ebola Crisis Response Campaign (DLECRC). The sole purpose of DLECRC is to partner with the Government of the Republic of Liberia and other organizations to augment the response to KICK OUT EBOLA FROM LIBERIA. DLECRC has selected key areas of concentration in the fight against Ebola, namely:

1.  Social mobilization: Health communication messaging that addresses denial, fear, and lack of knowledge about Ebola among healthcare workers and in the general population.

2.  Sufficiency of Medical supplies and other items such as Personal Protection Equipment, stethoscopes, beddings etc. (which this specific fundraising target speaks to)

3.  Aid to Victims of Ebola who have to be quarantined for 21 days.

4.  Addressing the psychological effect of Ebola.

Here Is What We Need From You

We need significant funding to achieve our goals above but we have taken a milestone and deliverable approach to attack this problem in bite-sizes.  At present, we need to purchase these specific items to air cargo to Liberia as urgently as possible:

Hand Sanitizers and Clorox Wipes

Clorox tablets

N95 Duckbilled Mask

Hood with eye opening and surgical mask attached (call me if you need details)

Gloves, Surgical, 7

Gloves, Surgical, 7.5

Gloves, Surgical, 8

Gloves, High Risk

Exam Gloves

Goggles

Rubber Gloves, Elbow needs L, XL, M 

Caps, Surgical, Disposable

Body Bags, Child ( Needs to be Bio hazard and waterproof) 

Scrubs, L

Scrubs, XL

Blood Pressure Cuffs

Thermometer, Infrared, Thermofocus

Isolation Gowns

Underpads, Bed

Lactated Ringer, 1000 ML 

Promethazine hydrochloride, 25 mg (1000/box)

Paracetomol, 500 mg

Ceftriaxone, 1 g

Artemether, 20 mg

Catheter, IV, 18g x 1.3" (50/box)

Catheter, IV, 22g x .9" (50/box)

Catheter, IV, 24g x 3/4" (50/box)

Malaria Rapid Tests

Infusion Giving Set, 21G x 1.5"

Syringe, hypodermic, 10 ml (100/box)

Syringe, Disposable, without Needle, 10ml Luer Slip Tip (100/Box)

Needles, 18G, 1" (50/box)

Needles, 21G (48/box)

Needles, 22G x 1.5" (100/box)

Needles, 25G x 1.5" (100/box)

Needles, Butterfly, 19G (30/box)


    The Impact

    Ebola is a viral hemorrhagic disease that has a historical 90% fatality rate for those who contract the disease.  Fortunately for us in Liberia, our fatality rate is closer to 65%.  If we can intervene in the early stages of the disease, we believe that lives can be saved.  If health care workers are properly protected and are using the right equipment and supplies, more lives can be saved.  Our healthcare workers are on the front line and are seriously at risk.  We need all the protective equipment and hygiene supplies we can get to ensure proper barrier nursing.

    Risks & Challenges

    Our country is severely challenged at the moment and risks an economic collapse.  Foreign non-governmental organizations are pulling out, foreign companies and severely reducing staff, airlines are discontinuing flights to Liberia, and Liberians who have the opportunity to leave are finding their way out.  If we don't accelerate our fundraising and stem this outbreak, we may not be able to achieve the goal of the movement.   We need your help!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us by signing and encouraging your family and friends to sign our petition asking the Obama Administration to help KICK OUT EBOLA from Liberia at http://wh.gov/lehwI.  If our petition gets 100,000 signatures by August 27, 2014, the White House will review it and respond!  

      If you want to directly assist us, you can volunteer at http://www.leaderf.org/Volunteer.html.

      Thank you for taking the time to read our appeal!

story:
Child birth is one of the most wonderful yet dangerous life events for many women. However, in the worlds poorer countries, such as Ethiopia, the precious gift of life comes at a much greater risk.

With a lack of funding, only a mere 6% of births are under the supervision of qualified personnel compared to almost 100% in Western Europe. This is reflected by an astonishingly high maternal mortality occurring in almost 1 in 100 births, and a staggering infant mortality of 4 in 100!
Women's Hope International commits to improve the maternal health around the world through good obstetric care. Their goal is to provide safer deliveries, not only reducing mortality rates but also preventing long term damage due to traumatic births.
Despite all their efforts, there are still many unsupervised births. As such many mothers are left with devastating complications, requiring surgery. Sister Rita Schiffer, the Medical Director at the Attat Hospital, Ethiopia, is a specialist surgeon in vesico- and rectovaginal fistula repair. These are common complications after unmanaged traumatic childbirth in which hole in the vaginal cavity extend into the bladder or rectum having a massive impact on these young mothers' lives.
My name is Chris Hudson. I am an Advanced Nurse Practitioner and ex-Midwife with 20 years of experience in triaging minor injury and illnesses. In September I have volunteered to work for a month in the Attat Hospital. During this time, I will be involved with supporting women in childbirth and the care of the local community.
I have personally financed my travel and living cost for the trip so the money I am looking to raise will be going to the Attat Hospital and will go towards the following:
  • Medications to treat TB, leprosy, malaria, and general infections
  • Surgical cost for assisted deliveries, such as caesareans (roughly £80!)
  • Medical supplies, such as drips, gloves, sutures, ect...
  • Child birthing kits for the local villages
I really appreciate any help that you can give. We cannot choose where we are born, and to those that are less fortunate a little can go a long way.
Follow me to see what is being done with the money you donate
http://www.chrishudsoninethiopia.blogspot.com
Thank you
Chris

During this time, I will be involved with supporting women in childbirth and the care of the local community.I have personally financed my travel and living cost for the trip so the money I am looking to raise will be going to the Attat Hospital and will go towards the following:

Medications to treat TB, leprosy, malaria, and general infections
Surgical cost for assisted deliveries, such as caesareans (roughly £80!)
Medical supplies, such as drips, gloves, sutures, ect...
Child birthing kits for the local villages

I really appreciate any help that you can give. We cannot choose where we are born, and to those that are less fortunate a little can go a long way.
Follow me to see what is being done with the money you donatehttp://www.chrishudsoninethiopia.blogspot.comThank youChris

story:
Therapy through riding for disabled children and adults

We are a group of friends (all horse lovers) who are in the process of setting up a non-profit organisation and a club to bring together children and adults (whether disabled or not) and introduce them to the therapeutic ability of horses and animals (pet therapy). 

This project is actually just the first step in achieving a higher goal and that is to create a therapeutic centre for children and adults with special needs and to introduce them to horses and animals. 

In our facilities we aim to bring everyone together, including the animals, to interact in a pleasant and motivational environment.

We have been lucky in that land from one of our supporters has been given to us long term for a nominal rent. Over the last year we have begun work and have turned an overgrown area into a welcoming environment and have almost completed construction of our stables. However, more work is needed. We have started our arena and as spring is approaching we need to have it completed soon. With your help, we hope to welcome our first members around Easter. The arena is our utmost priority at this time as this is where the children and adults will be able to interact with their pony or horse. 


We need your help

We need help to finish our arena and get it covered to enable year round activities, whether it is riding or even playing games or doing sports. 

As we are trying to keep our carbon footprint as low as possible, recycled and natural materials will be used wherever possible. We are in the process of acquiring used telephone poles to bank up the arena to level the surface. The telephone poles will also be used to support the roof. We will also be needing various grades of gravel (ranging from large stones to fine gravel) for the various layers of the arena.

Also the area will be fenced off to stop any accidental straying (whether of the two or four footed kind!) into the arena during a session. Again, recycled materials (crossbeams) will be used.

Although recycled items are more cost effective, the sheer amount that we will need raises our costs. Estimates that we have are:

Telephone poles (15 tonnes x 56 euros a tonne) 840 euros

Crossbeams (4 tonnes x 100 euros a tonne) 400 euros

Transport for the above: (200 x 2) 400 euros

Gravel: 1000 euros

Transport: 500 euros

Roof and roofing materials, lighting: 2700 euros

Heavy equipment (JCB) (2 days x 300) 600 euros

Work:  300 euros (the majority of the work will be of no charge)

Misc costs 460 euros.


A small token of our appreciation

As we are not producing a product that is transferrable, all our supporters will receive at least a thank you email or letter and apart from the humble perks we offer, all supporters (if they so wish) will have their names on a page on our website that is dedicated to our supporters. (Our webpage is under construction and link will be uploaded once complete).

However, if you are in Greece or plan on visiting Greece you are very welcome to come visit us and see our work as we are very close to Patras.

Some information about Patras and surrounding areas if you decide to visit:  

Patras is Greece's third largest urban area and the regional capital of Western Greece, in northern Peloponnese, 215 km west of Athens. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patras

Patras is a key tourist region, being situated at reasonable distances between these famous archeological sites of Greece:

Olympia, a sanctuary of ancient Greece where the Olympic Games were initiated http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympia,_Greece

Delphi, the site of the Delphic oracle, the most important oracle in the classical Greek world, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delphi

Nafplio, the capital of the First Hellenic Republic, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nafplio


If our goal is not reached, whatever funding is achieved will still go towards the arena but work will have to stop once funds run out.


Your Impact - financial or otherwise

During this period of severe crisis in Greece which has affected many people, young and old, (depression has risen acutely amongst people, predominately young), with your help we will be able to give the opportunity to children from all walks of life to come into contact with horses and their therapeutic ability. We also welcome any child or adult who is interested in being with and learning about horses and riding.

Children with special needs in particular will be able to benefit from contact with the horse and if they are able to ride, from the movement of the horse. 

With our non-profit organization and club we will be able to subsidise sessions for families or individuals in a low income bracket.

Even if you can't help financially, we would appreciate if you could help spread the word about our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

The Only Comb you will EVER enjoy using! 

Friends and Family, you all know that I have been working on this project for a while.  But due to my recent brain surgery, I was sidelined.  But now I am happy to say, “Praise GOD, Praise GOD, Praise GOD”…. I am Back.….But I need YOUR HELP!  PLEASE CLICK ON THE GALLERY TO SEE VIDEOS!

Along with my professional hairstylist partners, we are developing a line of products that can benefit every household.  I am starting out with the Coloring Fusion Combs and Gel Fusion Combs.  These combs are the 1st and only universal combs that serve many purposes.  Imagine coloring your hair without the mess, - or oiling or detangling your hair with ease. Sounds crazy, right? Well, these combs can do that – and more!  No more messy coloring or messy hands from oil.  No more tangled hair! If your friends travel, they will no longer have to worry about purchasing 3oz shampoo & conditioner bottles.  Because of the Fusion Combs, they can now store both solutions in the comb without mixing them.  Friends, my first phase of combs dispensed the gels and conditioners with ease. But now I need to complete the next phase of designs that enables you to control very thin liquids without dripping.  In addition, this will enable me to start meeting the needs of retail stores.  Family, please tell/encourage everyone you know to get involved with this campaign.  OH, and remember, I also have a line for pets!  So, even people with pets can benefit from this product.

What We Need & What You Get

Famliy, I need to raise $50,000 to pay for the three (3) injections molds along with the first phase of inventory.  To date, we have raise $120,000 with the beta models that are fully functional and ready to use.  Once you, and your friends participate in this campain, we have set several perks to show my deepest and most sincere Thank you. 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can not help financially.  Please take the "30 Day Challenge"  What is the "30 Day Challenge"?  Well, for a total of 30 consecutive calendar days, I challenge you to share this campaign with at least 3 people a day.  If you can't contribute financially, spread the word!  Can you do this for me vocally????
  • Also, you can use the Indie GO GO share tools to help spread the word! 
    • !

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our e-book team is busy photographying recipes and formatting them for our e-book.   If you like kids and creating a book for them and for people interested in developing a Real Kids Real Food "How To" manual for them, don't hesitate to email  me at betsy.bragg6@gmail.com.

We've started another campaign to help fund Real Kids Real Food's 40 Polaris Electric bike valued at $2,499.99, buy raffle tickets for a Polaris electric bike (value $2,499.99) and tickets to the Sept. 13th Healthy Living Expo featuring Dr. Brian Clement, go to

http://igg.me/at/SupportRealKidsRealFood/x

We are also busy writing grant proposals to raise money

You can certainly help make Real Kids Real Food possible for the coming year.


What We Are

Real Kids Real Food’s goal is to eliminate childhood obesity, chronic disease and malnutrition through after-school programs that promote healthy food choices and lifestyle changes, including:

  • Gardening and harvesting 
  • Hands-on food preparation of delicious recipes
  • Learning about eating right & staying active

We are now work on fully funding the 2014-2015 Real Kids Real Food program to positively impact the community. 

Why It Matters

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, obesity has more than doubled in children and quadrupled in adolescents in the past 30 years.

 

  • Children 6-11         1980:  7%       2012:   20%

  • Children 12-19       1980:  5%      2012:   18% 

In 2012, more than one third of children and adolescents were overweight or obese.  70% of obese youth had at least one risk factor for cardiovascular disease.  Obese adolescents are more prone to pre-diabetes. 

Your contribution to this project will enable to run this program, Real Kids Real Food, for the financial year of 2014-2015 in addition to distribute our e-book. This will make a difference in the lives of thousands of children by preventing and reversing obesity, chronic disease and malnutrition.

Where the Money Goes

The money raised through your pledges will help fund:

  • Hands on Food Preparation of healthy delicious recipes.
  • Learning about nutrition and a healthy lifestyle.
  • Preventing Chronic diseases.
  • Engaging kids in physical fitness.
  • Providing parent education and involvement.
  • Enabling community service projects through the kids. 
  • Field trips to local farms. 
  • Planting and Harvesting our own garden of fruits and vegetables.

What You Get

Book will include:

  • 3 Ten Week Lesson Plans
  • 30  Recipes
  • Safety Tips
  • Quick and Easy Exercises
  • Tips for Parents
  • How to launch this program in your community
  • Appendices

Founding of Real Kids Real Food

 My passion for healing the world one person at a time began with my own recovery from crippling arthritis and substance abuse through the living food lifestyle.  

The Real Kids Real Food program began at the Martin Luther King School, located in Dorchester, MA.

My adult classes, since 2008, are based on my book “Eat to Thrive-10 Weeks to Lifelong healthy habits and healthy living”.   In these classes I address health issues and introduce a healthy lifestyle as well as train staff for Real Kids Real Food.

Meet the Team


For additional information on our quest for a healthier future, please refer to our website: http://www.optimumhealthsolution.org/2013/wordpress/real-kids-real-food/mystic_learning_center/

story:
AUGMENT YOUR WORLD

What comes after the computer?

Tarc is a transistor-free, battery-free, screen-free, and software-free futuristic computing device. It naturally augments your ability to think and interact with reality. Holding the device in your hand can clarify your goals, uncover new solutions to old problems, brainstorm new ideas, manage stress better, augment meditation and prayer, and much more, all within your own level of expertise.

Tarc is an advanced device that connects your DNA to the universe and creates a field of electromagnetic energy within which you can improve yourself. And because it contains no battery, you can use it anytime you want and for as long as you want. There's no terrestrial network and no connection fee, you are free to use Tarc anywhere.

(And no agency can spy on you, which is a bonus.)

Improve the way you think and interact with the world with the science of Tarc.

This is where magic and science finally come together. Rather than invent another fancy computing device to measure the rate of growth of your fingernails, I decided to invent a device that would replace the computer. It was ambitious. But I am a fan of ambition.

The Age of the Transistor is over. It's time to move on.

The next-gen Tarc

This futuristic computing device is the first of its kind. It modulates and magnifies thought waves to connect you to the universe (reality, nature, god). Tarc is based on a transistor-free architecture, it emits no harmful electromagnetic waves and is powered by the energy in your body.

Tarc augments your mental abilities and your access to ideas and information. Meditation, brainstorming, solving problems, thinking through solutions, creative projects, prayer, introspection, soul searching, healing, magical thinking... anything that involves thinking this device can help.

Transistor-free computing

Today we all use tablet PCs and smartphones. But these are built with millions of transistors. They require batteries, emit harmful electromagnetic radiation, and come with monthly fees. Imagine a mobile computing device that has no transistors, no battery and no monthly fees. Meet the next-gen Tarc. In development now for 6 years, and proven to work in the hands of others, this device connects you to reality. The reality field is made up of endless information. 

By accessing the library of reality, you gain access to new ideas, new solutions, perhaps even revelations, and you gain insight into things, including things having to do with yourself and your goals in life. Solving problems.

Call it Reality Surfing.

If Tarc is the computer. Then you are the software.

Where I’m going

The first-generation Tarc was launched last year. I’d like to take the Tarc device to the next level and make available an advanced scientific device unlike ever before.

This is year 6 for me and I’m pleased with Tarc. It works. While the computing device amplifies and modulates thought waves, what it’s been doing is providing users access to the available information in the universal fields of energy. Yes, whenever you think you are tapping into different fields of energy. Whether you are trying to figure out what to do with your life or whether you are finishing your next art masterpiece, thinking and reality fields are always involved.

I want to develop a device that is comparable is quality to modern technological devices, except without the technology because let's face it, they can only put so many transistors on the head of a pin.

Transistor-free computing

A transistor-free device with no electronics or battery. The device has a copper casing and is powered by the energy in your body. Its secret crystalline architecture amplifies and redirects thought energy. And you are the software.

Electromagnetic fields surround the human body. Using the available bioelectricity in your body, Tarc device allows you to become an observer-participant to reality (universe).

I need funds to take the device to the next level. Additional funds would go to design, production, and (possibly) packaging and marketing materials.

I want to focus my energy on an improved design, a better architecture and materials. I demonstrated that I could vastly improve on the original design, a small pod (see image above) with a small amount of funding. I’m happy to build a small batch of powerful devices with new funding.

About the inventor

Paris Tosen—A prolific independent author and reality pioneer (www.tosen.ca) with a number of breakthroughs in alternative thinking. Tosen’s books include “Reality Science” and “God is DNA.” He invented the Tarc device to provide more people with an easier way to access the reality field (aka universe, god, nature, source).

I can’t do it alone. That’s why Indiegogo is a great platform for a lone inventor like me with a provocative technology. I’d like for early adopters to be trend-setters and to share their experiences, and to gain the benefits.

Hold the device in your hand, concentrate your thoughts, and watch the magic happen.

It’s difficult to introduce transistor-free devices to a larger audience. I’m confident that there are enough of you out there who are ready and eager to augment their world. All of us are doing it each day when we brainstorm, contemplate, worry, visualize, and use the power of intention, attraction, and revelation. These things are all bettered with Tarc, making you a better version of yourself.

It’s been a challenging project and I want to make this advanced technology available to more people. This type of technology is not for everyone. It doesn't take very much to learn how to use it. Just place it between your fingers or in your palm and experience the benefits of Tarc.

Transistor-free devices are the future!

The future of computing starts at just $8. Support the future.

story:
I lost 128 lbs in 15 months

 

On August 3rd 2010 i weighed 327 lbs. On that day I started my work out routine, but really my journey started a long time ago.

14 years ago I lost my son. I lost him to the complexity of divorde and the unfortunate hurt feelings that happened as a result. I didn't want to be an embarrassment, so it was easier for me to stay away from him. I thought since my weight was embarrassing to me so it must be embarrassing to him as well. What i didn't know was that the more I stayed away from him the bigger i got. Distancing myself from him was the cause of my depression. To ease my aching heart I ate. The more I ate, the bigger i got, the more depressed i became. To quote a famous movie, "It's a Vicious Circle". I was in a downward spiral. There was only one place for me to go, Rock Bottom. In reality i was trying to kill myself with out actually doing it. I was literally eating myself to an early grave.

A miracle brought me back from the brink of self-destruction. I call it a miracle, most other people call it Facebook. Over 2 years ago i reconnected with my son through Facebook and wouldn't you know it... he didn't care how big i was. Try this on for size, HE WANTED TO SEE ME! Here was the little boy i had left behind almost 13 years earlier and he wanted to see me and know me. Now he was a grown man, and a damn fine man too.

I wanted to be the kind of man my son could be proud of. I knew i needed to change. On August 3rd 2010, I walked in to the gym for the first time. I weighed 327 lbs, I had a goal to get below 200 lbs and i knew it was going to be a long hard road. I wanted to do it the old fashioned way, diet and exercise. At this time i didn't know if i was going to be able to do it. But I had to try.

I started with my diet. I cut out all the soda and reduced my food intake. I didn't stop eating what I wanted, I just ate less of it. I started slow with my exercise regimen. It was 10 minutes on an elliptical machine, 5 days a week. I knew you couldn't take a fat guy and just throw him on the track and get him running.

The day came to meet the man that my son had become. I flew out to see him the the weekend of August 27th, 2011. I had already taken my first tentative steps on my journey. That weekend with my son inspired me to get to the finish line. He is a man, a better man than i ever was and one that i hope to be one day.

When i got home I went back to the gym. The more I went to the gym the more confident I became. I began increasing 5 minutes every week. I was also increasing the level on the elliptical every couple of weeks. In April of 2011 I noticed that i had reached a plateau; I needed to change what i was doing. Keep in mind, by tis time, I was working out on the elliptical for an hour; but I needed to change my routine. So, I started using a stair master. It took me an hour to find a level that wouldn't kill me but would give me a solid workout. That was level 7, which was about 4 miles of stairs.

I also knew that i needed to greatly reduce my caloric intake. I was working 40 or more hours a week and working out 5 or 6 days a week. I didn't have time to prepare meals for my lunch at work. I decided to go with a pre-made meal. I tried every low calorie TV dinner i could find. Healthy choice, Smart ones and Lean Cuisine to name a few. Ultimately i went with Lean cuisine. It was the only one i could find that was tasty. I knew that these pre made meals weren't the best way to go. I knew i was putting in alot of sodium. but the one thing i did know it was going to be the easiest way to track my calorie intake.

By this time i was eating 1200 - 1500 calories a day and going to gym 5-6 days a week. Everyday at the gym I was burning 3000 - 4000 calories a day. The pounds started melting off.

I was seeing progress on the scale every week, that was all the motivation I needed. But it was also amazing getting comments from coworkers and friends. I wanted to prove to myself and everyone out there, that i could do something amazing on my own. I didn't need surgery or a crazy diet. I followed one simple rule: burn more calories than you take in. Being an inspiration to peope helped as well, I didn't want to let them down. People were (and still are) always coming up to me and saying that i inspired them to go for a walk or go to the gym. I honestly never thought I had that in me.

On the morning of Novemer 24th 2011 I weighed in at 199 lbs. I had reached my goal!

             A Half Marathon? Are You kidding?

The first week of December 2010 I jokingly told a coworker that if i got to my goal weight by December 3rd 2011, I would run the Las Vegas half marathon on December 4th 2011. The more weight I lost the more possible it seemed, so i really started taking it seriously. In August 2011 i started running, and then i fell in love with running. I got an email about 2 months before the half marathon was to take place telling me that there was only 500 spots open and they where going to sell out. I had to make a decision, I was still 25 lbs away from my goal weight and I was on the plateau from hell. My weight wasn't going anywhere. I said "screw it I am going to register for the half marathon," and wouldn't you know it, the weight started melting off of me again. I reached my goal weight on Thanksgiving morning. I was mentally and physically ready for the next adventure of my life.

On December 4th 2011 I ran the Las Vegas half marathon in 2 hours and 36 minutes. I replay the moment I crossed the finish line in my head over and over again. I was so emotional, I just couldn't believe that i went from 327 lbs to running a half marathon in 15 months. I didn't care how bad my muscles or my feet hurt, it felt like I was walking on a cloud.

It took a long time, but I finally recovered from my first half marathon. It was getting close to the New Year, and everyone was coming up with their resolutions for 2012. I thought losing 128 lbs in 2011 was amazing, so i had to come up with something bigger. I needed something that would, hopefully, motivate and inspire everyone. I needed something that would keep me motivated for the next year. I wouldn't have the scale giving me motivation anymore, because now I was in the maintaining phase. I knew that I wanted to run more half marathons. I had become addicted, it wasn't the running part by itself that was addicting. It was the fact that i did it with so many people. So I came up with 12 half marathons in 2012, it sounded catch and i made it my goal for 2012.

I am 9 races into my goal, and i would have thought that my body would have gave up on me by now, and that would be the reason why i wouldn't be able to reach my goal. But in reality it has put such a financial strain on me that i have ran out of money. I am so close to reaching my goal that I can taste it. I only have 3 races to go.

So in short, that is why i came to this site. To ask you all for some help. Two out of the three races i have left i need to travel too. The 12th and final race of this year is in Las Vegas, my home town. so i don't need to travel to that race. but the entry fee is really steep.

I want to thank you all for taking the time to read this, and i hope you feel inspired enough to get out there and excercise, and donate so i can get out there and finish this goal.

story:
[ENGLISH WILL FOLLOW...]

Fondé le 18 novembre 2011, l'organisation du Grand Défi des Héros du coeur constitue une aventure humaine qui, cette année, maintenant à sa 4e édition, mobilisera quelque 100 cyclistes de 25 communautés-écoles du Nouveau-Brunswick afin d'amasser des fonds pour venir en aide aux enfants défavorisés de nos régions. Notre mission: Prévenir la maladie et célébrer la santé de tous.

Pour bien résumer l'initiative en question:

  • Un tour de vélo de 1200km en 5 jours autour du Nouveau-Brunswick (Bouctouche - Fredericton - Edmundston - Campbellton - Caraquet - Bouctouche)
  • Un groupe de près de 100 cyclistes formé de participants âgés de 12 ans à 65 ans (élèves, enseignants, membres des communautés...) Une initiative sans précédant au Canada!
  • Les fonds amassés contribuent directement à venir en aide à des familles défavorisées pour leur permettre d'offrir aux jeunes l'occasion de pratiquer des activités sportives et vivre une vie saine et active sans contraintes financières.


Notre objectif, nos motivations et l'impact de votre contribution

L'objectif de cette levée de fonds est de récolter 1$ pour chacun des 1200 kilomètres qui seront parcourus lors du Grand Défi. Puisque la présente campagne se déroule sur une période d'un mois, cela signifie une moyenne de 40$ de dons par jour, ce qui s'avère très réaliste!                                    

Les données d'une étude publiée dans la revue de l'Association médicale canadienne sont alarmantes. L'obésité a triplé au Canada entre 1985 et 2011 et les taux les plus sérieux (l'obésité de type 2 et 3) sont les plus élevés au Nouveau-Brunswick en comparaison aux autres provinces canadiennes. L'étude révèle que d'ici 5 ans, un Canadien sur cinq sera obèse. On rapporte que le Nouveau-Brunswick possèderait le plus haut taux d'obésité morbide au pays et que si la tendance se maintient, le nombre de personnes obèses dans la province pourrait continué d'augmenter au cours des 5 prochaines années, si bien que par 2019, entre 25 à 30% des Néo-Brunswickois seront obèses!

Voici une occasion pour vous de faire une différence! Suite à la campagne, les dons que vous aurez effectués seront distribués à l'ensemble des intitutions scolaires participantes pour donner une chance égale à tous les enfants de pouvoir cultiver le plaisir de bouger et ainsi vivre une vie saine et active! Ceci contribuera à améliorer le sort des communautés du Nouveau-Brunswick sur la question de l'obésité et des mauvaises habitudes de vie. De plus, en effectuant un don minimum de 25$, 50$ ou 100$, vous aurez l'option de demander d'obtenir une récompense en souvenir de votre geste:

  • 25$ : Autocollant des Héros du coeur
  • 50$ : Photo souvenir des cyclistes de l'édition de cette année, ainsi qu'un aimant à frigo portant le logo officiel des Héros du coeur.
  • 100$ : T-shirt des Héros du coeur que vous pourrez porter fièrement


Aidez-nous à faire connaître les Héros du coeur

Nous vous invitons à partager cette campagne de levée de fonds avec votre entourage, votre famille et vos amis de près et de loin. N'hésitez pas à utiliser les outils de partage fournis par Indiegogo! Cela nous permettra d'atteindre l'objectif fixé et, qui sait mieux encore, peut-être même de le dépasser et ainsi pouvoir contribuer plus significativement au bien-être et à la vie saine des gens de notre belle province pour des générations à venir! Mettons l'accent sur la prévention de la santé pour tous et célébrons nos réussites au Nouveau-Brunswick! Vous pourrez être fières et fiers d'avoir pu contribuer à une campagne novatrice et une expérience jeunesse sans précédant au Canada! :)

Si vous êtes intéressés d'en apprendre davantage sur la cause des Héros du coeur et notre organisation, nous vous invitons à visiter les liens suivants. N'oubliez pas surtout de cliquer "J'aime/Like" sur notre page Facebook!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Herosducoeur/ 

Site web: http://www.carnetwebds11.ca/herosducoeur/ 

***************************************************************************

Founded the 18th of November 2011, the organization of Le Grand Défi des Héros du cœur is a human adventure which, now at its 4th edition this year, will mobilize close to 100 cyclists from 25 school communities in New Brunswick with the goal of collecting funds to help deprived children of our regions. Our mission: Prevent sickness and celebrate health for all.

To clearly summarize the initiative:

  • A 1200km bike tour around New Brunswick in 5 days (Bouctouche - Fredericton - Edmundston - Campbellton - Caraquet - Bouctouche)
  • A group of close to 100 cyclists made up of 12 to 65 years old participants (students, teachers, community members...) An unprecedented event in Canada!
  • The collected funds will contribute directly to deprived families to allow kids to practice sports and live a healthy and active life without financial limitations.


Our goal, our motivations and the impact of your donation

The goal of this campaign is to collect $1 for each of the 1200 kilometers that will be biked during the Grand Défi. Because this campaign unfolds over a period of a month, this means an average donation of $40 per day, which is surely realistic!

Data from a study published in the Canadian Medical Association Journal is alarming. Obesity has tripled in Canada between 1985 and 2011 and the more serious types (2 and 3) are at a highest rate in New Brunswick in comparison with the rest of the canadian provinces. This study reveals that in 5 years, one in five Canadians will be obese. New Brunswick have the highest rate of lethal obesity in the country and if this trend keeps up, the number of obese people in the province could continue to raise over the next 5 years so that by 2019, between 25 and 30% of New Brunswickers will be obese!

Here’s a chance for you to make a difference! After the campaign deadline is reached, your donations will be distributed to participating schools so that children have an equal chance at cultivating the enjoyment of doing physical activities and can live a healthy and active life! This will contribute to the amelioration of the future of New Brunswick communities in terms of improving their obesity levels and general lifestyle. Furthermore, by making a minimum donation of $25, $50 or $100, you have the option of asking for one of the following rewards:

  • $25 : Héros du cœur logo sticker
  • $50 : Thank you picture with this year's cyclists group, as well as a fridge magnet with the Héros du cœur logo
  • $100 : T-shirt of Héros du cœur that you’ll be able to proudly wear


Help us spread the word about Héros du coeur

We invite you to share this campaign with your contacts, family and friends, close of far. Don’t hesitate to use the Indiegogo sharing tools! This will make it possible for us to reach our goal and maybe even better, surpass it!  You’ll contribute significantly to the well-being and healthy life of the people of our great province for generations to come! Let’s make prevention a health priority for all and celebrate our successes in New Brunswick! You’ll be proud of having contributed to an innovative campaign and an unprecedented youth experience in Canada! :)

If you are interested in learning more about the Héros du coeur cause and our organization, we invite you to visit the following links. Don’t forget to click "Like" on our Facebook page!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Herosducoeur/ 

Website: http://www.carnetwebds11.ca/herosducoeur/

story:
Hi all,

My name is Paula Knight and I am a 41 year old married mother of two  adult daughters and I live  in the beautiful town of Toowoomba in South East Queensland, Australia.

I am currently half way through my university degree of a Bachelor of Science and loving every minute of it as it has been a life long dream. Approximately 12 months ago I suffered with a bout of Myocarditis (an infection in the heart muscle) which left me ill for quite some time. Having recovered from this, I was left with chronic tiredness and other symptoms to the point I thought I may have to give up university for good.

After more tests failed to indicate what was happening to me, my doctor suggested that I may be suffering from Sleep Apnea (pauses in breathing during sleep) and sent me off for testing. The results were yes, I had severe sleep apnea. I have been placed on a rental CPAP(continuous positive airway pressure) machine on a two month trial. Which at the end of the trial you must purchase your own machine at the cost of  $2500.

I have had the rental CPAP machine for two weeks and I feel amazing already. It is like waking up out of a fog. I have better memory recall, my high blood pressure is better and my chronic tiredness is all but gone. I am symptom free. It really has been miraculous.

Being a university student and having a husband with a permanent disability finances have been tight, as most people can relate to these days. What it boils down to is  that I simply cannot afford to purchase this CPAP machine myself at the end of the two month trial but also cannot do with out it to be able to function everyday and continue at university. It really is a terrible predicament to be in.

I am asking for help because I have run out of options, this is my last ditch effort to be able to remain at university, finish my degree and then gain employment to support my family as we are a single income family.

Any assistance you can offer to me and my family would be most appreciated.

I thank you in advance.
story_txt:

My name is Paula Knight and I am a 41 year old married mother of two  adult daughters and I live  in the beautiful town of Toowoomba in South East Queensland, Australia.
I am currently half way through my university degree of a Bachelor of Science and loving every minute of it as it has been a life long dream. Approximately 12 months ago I suffered with a bout of Myocarditis (an infection in the heart muscle) which left me ill for quite some time. Having recovered from this, I was left with chronic tiredness and other symptoms to the point I thought I may have to give up university for good.
After more tests failed to indicate what was happening to me, my doctor suggested that I may be suffering from Sleep Apnea (pauses in breathing during sleep) and sent me off for testing. The results were yes, I had severe sleep apnea. I have been placed on a rental CPAP(continuous positive airway pressure) machine on a two month trial. Which at the end of the trial you must purchase your own machine at the cost of  $2500. 
I have had the rental CPAP machine for two weeks and I feel amazing already. It is like waking up out of a fog. I have better memory recall, my high blood pressure is better and my chronic tiredness is all but gone. I am symptom free. It really has been miraculous.
Being a university student and having a husband with a permanent disability finances have been tight, as most people can relate to these days. What it boils down to is  that I simply cannot afford to purchase this CPAP machine myself at the end of the two month trial but also cannot do with out it to be able to function everyday and continue at university. I thank you in advance.

i am struggling to make sure he has everything he will need

i was hurt by a lot of people because i refused to get an abortion

 

if you can help me make sure he will have  a good life and education i appreciate any help i just want him to have a good life because he's a miracle to me and changed my life around.

story:
Short Summary

Have Heart is a company started by Ed Edge, with the sole purpose of improving people's quality of life by improving their health. We also empower people by giving them the proper knowledge required for healthy lifestyles.

This campaign is solely to fund the 50 summer classes in the Richmond Public Housing Developments. All classes are 100% free for the residents and are held in the neighborhoods themselves.

Classes include: Zumba, Yoga, Pilates, Nutrition & Cooking, and Boot Camp


What Your funding Provides:

There are no administrative costs with Have Heart so all of the money goes towards hiring the best instructors and the equipment used. We also provide many of our clients with pedometers and water bottles to insure healthy lifestyles outside of the weekly classes.


The Impact!

Each of our classes happen on either once or twice a week in each neighborhood. classes range from 15-75, so with this campaign alone we are able to help over 1,000 Richmond residents get healthy, that would otherwise have no access to fitness instruction.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute today, that is totally fine, perhaps you know someone that can! Please get the word out about the profound impact and importance of this project. Ed Edge currently gives 80% of his income to this company but that still isn't enough to fund all of the classes. With your assistance, we can spread the love even farther.

story:
Short Summary

SIBEN (501c) non-profit has been around since 2004.  SIBEN is the only regional non-profit organization IMPROVING PREMATURE NEWBORN CARE and REDUCING FATALITY RATES IN LATINAMERICA. On an annual bases SIBEN  touches the lives of hundreds of thousands of premature babies by training and developing more than 5,000 nurses and doctors across 19 IberoAmerican countries. 

We are a team of passionate and well renamed doctors and nurses with a simple mission: IMPROVE NEWBORN CARE IN LATINAMERICA.

This is our first crowd-fundraising initiative bringing everybody together around our cause. Please join us in these journey of improving new born care in LatinAmerica.

Many babies have gone through intensive newborn care and survived, today young adults enjoying life. We call them and their families HEROES of SIBEN!

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to continue to educate and improve newborn care skills and equipment. SIBEN guarantees that: 

  • 90% of the Crowdsouring funds will be allocated to improve new born care. There are operational costs that need to be covered.
  • For every $80USD a doctor or nurse serving high mortality regions will be trained and educated for 3 whole days on techniques to help reduce newborn mortality rates.
  • Train 5 to 10 nurses/doctors in the U.S.A to deploy knowledge back in their home countries.
  • Full scholarships and funds for research and education will be awarded.
  • If funding permits  e-learning platforms will be optimized and expanded.
  • As we see how much we are crowd founding we will communicating other things you are all helping us to achieve (Example: SIBEN operates with NO full time employees - the opportunity for funding an administrative team and other roles help us improve annual planning and executions)

The Impact

  • HELP IMPROVE NEONATAL CARE: 3,100 babies need neonatal care daily in LatinAmerica
  • HELP US REDUCE MORTALITY RATES: 15 Newborns die per hour 
  • HELP US TRAIN +2500 DOCTORS & NURSES ACROSS LATIN AMERICA IN OUR  ANNUAL CONFERENCE IN SEPTEMBER 2015

WE CAN ALL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND IGNITE A NEW ONE

Risks & Challenges

For the first time we are giving the opportunity to individuals, family and friends, and anyone who want to support and improve the care of premature babies to support the cause. SIBEN relies on the people, it’s love for the mission and those who want to support it.

Our risk: The lack of resources can put at risk our mission and hence impact newborns.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with everyone. Every dollar counts. Together we can improve premature newborn care in latinamerican countries by closing the knowledge and education gaps.

If you want to help us differently please contact us via email or our website.

story:
` 

Please help support our online fundraiser for my amazing friend Shawn Miyahara’s cancer treatments and travel expenses as she fights a rare form of Non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma. Any and all donations will be very much appreciated.

Shawn is 27 and was diagnosed with a very rare form of Non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma in July. Her treatments are not fully covered by her insurance and her form of cancer requires travel to MD Anderson in Houston (about 8 hour drive). All donations will go directly to Shawn for her ever rising medical bills and/or travel expenses. I have volunteers that are going to shave their heads for each $250 we raise up to $1000 hence the name Shave4Shawn. 

My husband and I met Shawn when she was a personal trainer at our gym in addition to her day job. She encouraged and inspired so many people through her sweet and thoughtful nature. She always went above and beyond to help people reach their personal goals, including myself (which is why I am more than willing to shave my head for her). Shawn and her husband Michael are also very active within their church in Owasso (lifechurch.tv). Michael plays in the band every Sunday, and Shawn volunteers her time to help out whenever needed.

Over the last couple years we have become very good friends with Shawn and Michael. They have been there for us through hard times and we would love to return the favor. We want Shawn to get any and all treatments she requires to heal and stay the vibrant, active young woman we all know and love. We are asking for your help in reaching this goal. We currently have no idea what the figure is that she will end up needing, but her new chemo will cost about $30,000 per treatment and she will be needing anywhere from 4 to 6 treatments. Right now her insurance is not covering it. Thank you for taking the time to read about our campaign and THANK YOU to everyone who donates. Every little bit helps and may God bless you for your support. Even if you can’t make a monetary donation please tell everyone about our campaign! Pray for her, share on Facebook, word of mouth, or any other way to let everyone know about this wonderful, young woman who deserves to have so much more time with us.

story:
Team #DanCAN


Triathlon is my passion, my focus, my life. Balancing the cost of Triathlon with my recent post-graduate student debt whilst living in one of the most expensive cities in the world (London, England) has proven difficult to manage, and I need your help.

With your support, you will help me prove to the world that achieving your dreams in sport is possible, no matter what your circumstances.

Late this summer, I would like to compete in Ironman Majorca, Ironman 70.3 Muskoka, Canada and the International Triathlon Games in Edmonton, Canada. The cost to do so adds up to £2,500 (roughly $4,000 CAN).

In exchange for your monetary support, I will happily offer the following: 

  • Placement on my Team Canada kit
  • Endless support on my active social media
  • Endorse you on my blog – The Digital Scoop
  • Lead group/company runs/ training sessions
  • Place your name on my training gear, so you're with me every step of the way. 


Background 


I’ve always had a passion and drive to be the best in sports; with childhood dreams of being the next Wayne Gretzky in ice hockey, or the next Steven Redgrave during my undergraduate varsity-rowing career. I was never happy with being second best. 

As the 2014 triathlon racing season approaches I am in pursuit of a World Championship spot in the Iron and half Ironman distances.

I started competing in Triathlon three years ago. Within these years I have completed an Ironman distance race, several half Ironman distance races and qualified to compete for Team Canada at the 2013 International Triathlon Games. Representing my country has been my biggest achievement in sport to date, and I am lucky enough to have qualified again.

For once, I feel I am getting close to the unfamiliar grounds of bridging the athletic “black hole” of being a ‘good athlete’ to being an ‘elite athlete’. The only thing slowing me down now - cost. Unfortunately, triathlon is not the most financially accessible sport. 


My Plea


The accolades and podiums that I’ve earned to date have only been achievable with help from many along the way. From reduced coaching fees, to borrowing race wheels, to family and friends’ emotional support, it is these people I have to thank as they have helped me get to where I am today.

I am proud with my achievements in Triathlon especially given my limited disposable income. All this time, I have been training with 4-year-old used cycling shoes, I have never had a proper bike fit and I race in used runners. I wouldn’t change a thing about my experience, but just think where I could go with a little extra monetary help!

story:
Short Summary

Our three-person management team is passionate to healthy food and we truly believe in honest products. A year ago we finally found the solution to make pizzas totally gluten free. Local government challenged us and did the tests in the independent laboratory one confirmed that our product is healthy food. The association of celiac disease is promoting our products as the only fast food in the country that is safe for the people with gluten intolerance. We have 2600 loyal customers and almost 5000 followers on Facebook.

Currently we are operating only in Estonia but our ambition is to expand internationally. Unfortunately banks consider this too risky business (too much mission-based) and they are not ready to finance our plans. So far we have managed our own. We have set up the central kitchen to ensure the pure and stable preparation of the dough and other ingredients. We have invested in to electric cars for the eco-friendly delivery and lot more. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have two major challenges ahead. 

  • Develop our central kitchen - we need more and better equipments to prepare healthy pizza dough. As a result of missing gluten the dough is very difficult to process. Each piece must be moulded by hand and it takes a lot of time. We plan to invest into special press to mould the pizza basis. In addition we need to invest in high capacity refrigerator and packaging systems. All this will cost 20000 euros.
  • Export - we have decided to not expand by opening pizzerias in abroad. Maybe one day but in the beginning this is too challenging. Instead we prepare unique healthy pizza dough for the pizzerias in different countries and providing the training for them how to make healthy pizza. Initial costs to export is around 10000 euros (this includes the certification in 1 country). 
  • It's your chance to contribute in our mission. Let's work together against the poisoning people with the crappy food. Probably one day we are capable to deliver our products to your home country too.

The Impact

Once again three main values what we are standing for:

  • Only organic ingredients
  • No GMO food
  • No gluten
The psychiatric Dr. Markku Karma from Finland has told that among his cases 75% of mental disorders are caused of the gluten.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute money wise then we appreciate your contribution in sharing our mission on your social networks or just spread the word. Indiegogo has convenient sharing tools too!

story:
Introducing:  

by: 


A BETTER BATTER. Get your "reps" in and develop muscle memory for that "perfect swing". Also, use the "pitching grid" to hone your pitching skills. Practice by yourself, uninterrupted where and when you choose. Take charge of your training and have fun doing it!

Save up to $600 during this campaign and receive free shipping to the continental U.S., and Canada. Worldwide shipping available with AirRep paying the first $125! Contact us for details.


Help AirRep Raise Funds to Give The

BatterUp to Youth Ball Teams

AirRep has teamed up with Business Cares, a non-profit organization, to donate up to 3500 BatterUp systems to youth baseball/softball teams.  Contributions from the first seven perks at the right will be used to help us do this. We appreciate any donation toward this cause. AirRep and Business Cares want to give back to the youth ball community and, with your help we can do it!




Donations to this Campaign Will Be used for these Final Enhancements

  • improved battery life.

  • integrated electronics for a sleeker a more robust design.

  • improved portability, set-up and take down time

  • make the system softball compatitable 

  • create an "APP- enabled" unit  which will allow for:

    • one-button control via our remote or on a Bluetooth-enabled device (smartphone, etc.)

    • controlling the height of the ball toss

    • controlling the frequency of the tossess

    • Create profiles on Bluetooth enabled devices in order to have repetitive / cycle practice routines

    • monitoring / keep track of their practice time and hits




By:

By:

story:
Here’s the deal…

My name is Roy Zukoff, I am a sophomore at The George Washington University in Washington DC.  Today I am raising money for a marathon campaign run by the organization Shalva (http://www.run4shalva.org/en/index.php), which focuses on aiding children with special needs. 


Shalva was founded in 1990 by Kalman and Maki Samuels . Due to their experience of raising a special needs child and their understanding of the difficulty other families have with this they created the organization. 


Today, SHALVA has over 500 participants with special needs ranging from infants to young adults. SHALVA offers these individuals specially tailored programs and continuous therapies seven days a week. Through these unique programs, children with Down syndrome and others with special needs are better able to integrate into the community and feel more accepted.


Pairing with the organization I will accept the challenge of training for the Jerusalem Marathon with nine other team members also from GWU. I am running in the marathon for the direct in order for SHALVA’s Down Syndrome children to directly benefit. Having a cousin with special needs, I understand how far these donations go and what the impact of even $20 makes on a child’s life.


What I Need From You and What You Get

First off, you get to feel good about yourself. I need $3,000 before March 6th, when I will be flying to Israel to participate in the Jerusalem half marathon. The money that we are raising will be going directly to SHALVA, who will then use the money for therapies, programs and treatments. These programs are not only necessary for  these children, but also extremely important for their families.


If I do not meet this goal by the deadline the funds will still go to SHALVA, but I will not be able to participate in the Jerusalem marathon as there is a minimum of $3,000 required in order to run. Jerusalem is a unique and diverse city that I have grown to love over the years. It would be an honor to be involved in an activity that enables me to strengthen the community of such a special place.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page and get the word out about this great campaign to help children with Down syndrome. You could also sign up to run with my team members and me!

My name is Roy Zukoff, I am a sophomore
at The George Washington University in Washington DC.  Today I am raising money for a marathon
campaign run by the organization Shalva (http://www.run4shalva.org/en/index.php), which focuses on aiding
children with special needs. Shalva was founded in 1990 by Kalman and Maki
Samuels . Due to their experience of raising a special needs
child and their understanding of the difficulty other families have with this they created the organization. Today, SHALVA
has over 500 participants with special needs ranging from infants to young
adults. SHALVA offers these individuals specially tailored programs and
continuous therapies seven days a week. Through these unique programs, children
with Down syndrome and others with special needs are better able to integrate into
the community and feel more accepted. 
Pairing with the organization I will accept
the challenge of training for the Jerusalem Marathon with nine other team
members also from GWU. I am running in the marathon for the direct in order for
SHALVA’s Down Syndrome children to directly benefit. Having a cousin with
special needs, I understand how far these donations go and what the impact of even
$20 makes on a child’s life. 
What I Need From You and What You Get 
First off, you get to feel good about yourself. I need
$3,000 before March 6th, when I will be flying to Israel to
participate in the Jerusalem half marathon. The money that we are raising will
be going directly to SHALVA, who will then use the money for therapies,
programs and treatments. These programs are not only necessary for  these children, but also extremely important for their families. 
If I do not meet this goal by the deadline the funds will
still go to SHALVA, but I will not be able to participate in the Jerusalem
marathon as there is a minimum of $3,000 required in order to run. Jerusalem
is a unique and diverse city that I have grown to love over the years. It would
be an honor to be involved in an activity that enables me to strengthen the
community of such a special place.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this page and get the word
out about this great campaign to help children with Down syndrome. You could also
sign up to run with my team members and me!

story:
Update:

18/03/15.

From, The 'HEPCATS TEAM'.

'We at, HEPCATS, have been around, busy, tho sick most of us, long term.

We came together 3 years ago & have been working hard, preparing for our National launch.

At times We have been so ill it has seemed almost impossible to continue.

Our own style of Positive Support has kept us going & continued to keep HEPCATS alive.

We spang up from another Positive Support Network, set up 5 years ago, on Facebook. 

Now.

WE are ready to begin helping the very Patient Patients, we have wanted to Positively Support!  :-).


Please help make all our hard work blossom, through your own Positive Support for our Campaign. 


Share, contribute, or maybe, simply think about HepC compassionately.


Please remember it's a virus, which can be caught in a multitude of ways.

Your help, Positive Support & kind thoughts WILL make this Service a reality.


With this, your help we aim, to start with assisting others to get to appts in a, 'fit for purpose' & timely, fashion. by accompanying them.


Then, we aim to provide 'advice & 'Advocacy', (if we CAN)...

Political, Health Services & LA'S permitting. 

Let's hope so! :-).


Update: Thursday 12/03/2015.

Now HEPCATS has a film to add to our Campaign page.

Time, sweat &  amazing skills went into creating this professionally produced film.

It's a film of 1 of our Co Founders talking about their journey with HepC.

We at HEPCATS would like to thank the 'Film Dude' :-)., who so kindly worked on this for us.

Also 2 Eminent Orgs in the UK, who gave us permission to use some of the material produced for them, by the same Ppl plus 1 other.

TY from HEPCATS. :-).

You can watch this film from Friday 13/03/2015.

Update!!! ... Saturday 14/03/15.

Apologies for the delay in the uploading of our film.

A slight toe injury :-). has unfortunately laid up one of our Co founders, temporarily. It's on the way tonight.

We are Patient patients after all. :-).

Thanks to all our supporters, contributors and; the oh so kind donations so far.

15% funded after 2 weeks. :-).

TY.

Keep following & 'Positively Supporting' us Please.

HEPCATS.

We need this money to bring a 3 year project to fruition. We aim to Positively Support these Patient Patients through this journey with HCV, from testing to treatment and the difficult time in between the 2.

We, at HEPCATS, have lost far too many colleagues, peers and friends to this Virus.

We intend to offer Buddying (to appts etc), a point of contact for Positive Support and hopefully advocacy, climate permitting.

Please join the HEPCATS Campaign now.

Contribute £1, if you can or buy any of the Perks, added occasionally.

story:
Short Summary

 To liaised with the Liberian Taskforce and the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare to ascertain as to what is actually needed in terms of support or help from the Liberian Diaspora; considering that there are International Non Governmental Organisations  already helping in Liberia;

To set up relief fund for victims of the Ebola virus that would provide needed assistance to family members, and incentives to encourage people that have been in contact with victims or infested individuals to go forward for testing;

To provide educational materials and support that would help minimise further spread of the virus 

What We Need & What You Get

UK LIBERIA EBOLA TASK FORCE

To all Liberians and Friends of Liberians – please help us to get these urgent supplies to Liberia. We need these within the next two weeks as they need to be sent by air.

·  Tychem full body coverall QC127T YL (Dupont or Lakeland brand)  size L&XL (must be this brand)

·  Gowns – surgical and isolation

·  Gloves – examination and surgical all sizes

·  Hazardous waste bag

·  Face mask N95

·  Face mask – disposable

·  Face shields – reusable and disposable

·  Eye shields

·  Plastic Shoe covers

·  Aprons – plastic reusable and disposable

·  Sanitizer/Antibacterial hand wash and gel

·  Plastic boots/Wellies

·  Surgical caps – disposable

·  Disinfectant

·  Body bags – adult and children

·  Scrubs – size L&XL

·  Blood pressure cuffs – adult and children

·  Thermometer – digital/infrared

·  Antibacterial soap

·  Hypodermic Syringe – 10ml, Luer Slip

·  Syringe – disposal (without needle) 10ml

·  Cathether – IV (18g, 22g,and 24g)

·  Needles – (15g, 21g, 22g, 25g and butterfly 19g)

·  Oral rehydration fluids

·  Infusion giving set

·  Sprayer

·  Respirator

·  Scissors

·  Bandage

·  Vitamin C, Zinc 240mg

·  Paracetamol 500 mg

·  Multivitamin with Iron

·  Vitamin A

Other Ways You Can Help
To drop off donations from around the UK, 
please contact the following:
Manchester - Lena Thomas Marshall 
Sheffield - Joseph Walker/ Fidel Absoloot Budy 
Derby - Daniel Zeegbuo 
Birmingham - Dr George Flahn and Velma Troko 
Northampton - Mohamed Sonnie
Milton Keynes - Elizabeth Kollie Jallah 
Nottingham - Aritha Dorblae 
Luton - Durrelle Dennis-Kuku 
Great Yarmouth/Suffolk - Robena Lewis Vincent
London - Evelyn Duke-Desheild and Robena Lewis Vincent
Scotland - Mr Jerry Boweh

story:
Short Summary

Zack Shatto is a healthy 23-year-old with the world on his shoulders.  He balances being a full-time father and boyfriend, a full-time job as a low-voltage technician, and full-time schooling.  On Friday, Sept. 26th, he had an accident at a local skating rink during a free-skate session with family.   He fractured both his radius and ulna bones in his right wrist region.  The orthopedic doctor notified him that he will need surgery to repair the damage to his radius.  Without the surgery, he will face an array of problems: deformity, decreased range of motion, decreased hand/wrist strength, and constant pain.  

He has no insurance, and by the time the paperwork is processed, it will be too late to get the surgery.  The hospital is asking for a large sum of money upfront before they'll even book his surgery appointment.  While the doctor's are willing to do payment plans with him and his family, it remains a challenge to pay those now that he is unable to work as many hours as he used to.

What We Need

What your contributions will go to:

  • Initial funds will go to paying the hospital bill for 24 hr monitoring and room use.
  • Excess funds will go towards the orthopedic doctor and anesthesiologist bills.
  • If our entire goal is not met, we will still use these funds to pay down already incurred medical bills due to his accident.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that finances are tight for most people now, and not everyone can afford to donate money.  For those who cannot assist financially, you can help by telling others about this campaign.  Even if you were able to donate, please spread the word, so we can have a better chance at meeting this goal.

story:
Summary

I am Van Svenson.  For many years I’ve been part of the Porsche Club of America’s amateur racing series in a 944. I’ve had several successful seasons, including the 2014 season were I took second place in the national 944 Cup championship.  I’m ready to build on these successes and transition into pro racing.  I have my sights set on the Pirelli World Challenge, a televised series that focuses on late-model production cars.

I want to build a team, that you are part of, to bring amateur racing to the big leagues.  With your help I can successfully campaign a car and show the motorsports world what a team effort can accomplish.

Pirelli World Challenge runs races across the United States with two primary classes: GT for current-production sports cars; and TC for smaller current-production cars.

My focus is on the six-races featuring the TC class, which includes hatchbacks, sedans and smaller sports cars.  The operating expense of the smaller cars are less, and the six TC races will require less travel commitment than the eleven-race GT schedule.

My usual racing budget won't cover everything - just about half.  That's why I'm launching this campaign!  With your contribution and my contribution, we can actually go pro racing.

Off to a good start!

In the first 24 hours of the campaign, support has be tremendous!  Here's a big Thank You to those people:


The first round of rewards have been made and sent out to all current contributors! Do you want a Hack Racing decal, too? Make a contribution today!


And here's how I make the Hack Racing magnets!


Tee-shirts will be on the way soon!  Make a contribution by 12/10/14 to receive it by Christmas!  They make an excellent gift.  (In case you can't figure out the puzzle, it's "Racing with heart" - the nice way to give it all you've got!)


What I Needed

Luckily, I do not need money for entry fees - that was my 944 Cup Championship prize!  But, to utilize those free entries, there is a whole lot more that I do need.

Although I need an eligible car, the largest expense by far is actually the transportation.  The car needs to be transported/trailered to races across the country, and the driver (me) and crew (possibly you?) also need to travel and spend several nights on the road for each race.  The smallest segment is for the consumables - the tires, brakes, gas, oil, spare parts, etc.

Here is a breakdown of what I think is needed for a season in the TCB class:


My goals

In addition to winning races and becoming a Pirelli World Challenge champion, I want to provide a way for you, my sponsors, to be involved and participate in world-class racing.  That participation might just be knowing your support helped make it happen; that participation might be watching your team kick some ass on TV or YouTube; that participation might be attending a race in person and providing crew support! 

This is an excellent way to get your name or brand on TV and in front of a national audience.  It's like owning an NFL team, just a little smaller (and cheaper!)  For large sponsors, the car can become a moving billboard that will be seen around the world.  Contact me for the grande enchilada package, which includes driver interviews and displaying the car at your business between race weekends for more promotion.

If my fundraising goal isn't met, it doesn't mean that everything is off the table - it just means I'll have to scale down the endeavor.  Perhaps only do a few races on the schedule or rent-a-ride.

My Track Record

Let me tell you a little more about myself.  After buying my first 944 in 1996 and autocrossing for a year, I decided to try a HPDE (high performance driver's ed) at a race track.  I was hooked right away and spent every available weekend at the track progressing through the ranks.  A look at some of my achievements:

  • 2002 - rookie race at Lime Rock in a 944 Turbo S
  • 2005-2014 - Chief Driving Instructor for the Hudson Champlain PCA region
  • In the last 10 years - 74 race starts, 45 podium finishes, 18 class wins
  • In 2014 - 12 race starts, 9 podium finishes, 7 class wins
  • 2014 - 944 Cup National second place champion

What is Team Hack Racing?

Team "Hack Racing" started out as a light-hearted moniker for some of my Porsche friends and I to poke fun at our limited resources. The team spirit is exemplified in the logo - a blow torch and hacksaw - which represents our resolve to use whatever tools are necessary to get the job done and get on track.  But it has real meaning as I contemplate joining a pro series - I will be a little fish among the "big dogs" in terms of resources.  However, make no mistake, I'm not short on ingenuity, drive or talent - I'm ready to take them by storm in proper Hack Racing fashion!

Learn more about Hack Racing here.


More About Pirelli Word Challenge

The Pirelli World Challenge has been organizing pro-racing events for over 25 years.  It provides a sprint race format (no pit-stops, no driver changes) which are typically 40 minutes long.  There are two primary groups: the first contains the GT and GTS cars, which are typically current-production sports cars like the Audi R8, Bentley Continental GT, Cadillac CTS-V, Chevrolet Corvette, Dodge Viper, Ferrari 458, McLaren MP4-12C, Nissan GT-R, Porsche 911 GT3, Ford Mustang Boss 302, BMW M3, etc.  The second group contains the TC, TCA and TCB cars, which are typically smaller sedan and hatchback current-production cars, such as the Honda Civic/Fit, Mazda MX5/3/2, Minicooper, Scion FRS, VW Jetta, Chevrolet Sonic, Ford Fiesta, Fiat 500, etc.

The current 2015 race schedule is:

  • Circuit of The Americas (Austin, Texas) March 6-8
  • St. Petersburg (St. Petersburg, Florida) March 27-29 (GT/GTS only)
  • Long Beach (Long Beach, California) April 17-19 (GT/GTS only)
  • Barber Motorsports Park (Birmingham, Alabama) April 24-26 (GT/GTS only)
  • Canadian Tire Motorsport Park (Bowmanville, Ontario) May 15-17
  • Detroit Belle Isle Grand Prix (Detroit, Michigan) May 29-31 (GT/GTS only)
  • Road America (Elkhart Lake, Wisconsin) June 26-28
  • Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course (Lexington, Ohio) July 31-Aug. 2
  • Miller Motorsports Park (Tooele, Utah) Aug. 21-23
  • Sonoma Raceway (Sonoma, California) Aug. 28-30 (GT/GTS only)
  • Mazda Raceway Laguna Seca (Monterey, California) Sept. 11-13
For more information about Pirelli World Challenge, visit: http://www.world-challenge.com

Risks & Challenges

Obviously there are no guarantees in motorsports.  The unexpected can happen; cars can get totaled in the first practice session of a weekend; and, despite the extensive safety equipment, accidents can sometimes cause injuries.

I will, however, always act with my very best judgement to achieve the very best outcome for the team - whether that is an individual race win, a championship title, or even the best product placement for the visual brand.

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary contributions are not the only way to provide sponsorship.  While there will be a multitude of expenses, there are still non-monetary ways to contribute to the cause:

  • Spread the word about my campaign - email your friends, share it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
  • Make an introduction for me if you think there is another sponsor that will be a good fit
  • Attend races as a fan - just your presence is a way to show support
  • Volunteer your time to help as crew at a race near you
  • Offer travel or lodging support
  • Offer parts or labor to prepare the race car
  • Offer kind thoughts and appreciation to my wife whose patience and understanding has gone a long way to make my current (and future) racing career possible

Are you ready to be part of a pro racing team?  Let's make this happen!
