   Are you ready to be part of a pro racing team?  Let's make this happen!

story:
Why Elated Vegan Coaching?

Do you want to lose weight, be healthy, go vegan, or all three? Do you care about animals and want to live a life that is more ethical and compassionate? My name is Karen Johnson and I am here to help you make your goals come true! My approach to vegan coaching is a combination of healthy eating, exercise that is fun, stress-free living and vegan education. It is my life's purpose to help you be a healthy and joyful vegan. 

A nutrient-dense plant-based diet offers you radiant health: you will feel great and look younger, you will wake up every morning with more energy and you are very likely to reverse any chronic illnesses you are experiencing. 

You will discover a whole new way of being when you live in alignment with your true inner values!

Great News! In recognition of me being a woman seeking to empower other women to live joyful, fulfilled lives, Indiegogo will match $1 with every $25 you donate on "International Women's Day" Saturday 8 March 2014!

What Elated Vegan Coaching Offers You

You will be investing in your own health and discovering your true inner values when you sponsor my studies. What you get:

  • three 50-minute sessions a month 
  • your session can be in person, over the telephone or via email journaling 
  • weekly challenges or practical tasks 
  • 7-day meal plan designed to help you reach your goals
  • delicious vegan recipes that are easy to make
  • helpful kitchen, cooking and shopping tips  
  • my full support when you e-mail me weekly updates on your progress 
  • you become an Elated Member with access to the Elated Community Pages 
  • you can rest assured that all of our sessions will remain completely confidential.

This is your journey and you decide where you want to go and how fast or slowly you want to progress. I am just here to help you get there.

Make a Commitment To Your New Life Today!

Do you want to get started right away? You are welcome to get in touch with me to schedule a free 20‑minute session and find out more about your Elated Life Coaching. 

Your Contributions Will Fund My Certification

Please help fund my studies in order for me to be the most effective coach I can be. My study goals are as follows:

  1. Life Coach Certificate — International Instruction of Coaching Studies. I have already received the certificates which have equipped me with a theoretical understanding of how to be a coach and help people determine and achieve their life and health goals. Loan outstanding $939
  2. Nutritional Education Trainer Certificate — Dr Fuhrman’s Nutritional Education Institute. A revolutionary program that helps people lose weight fast while gaining abundant health on a nutrient-dense, plant-based diet. This course will equip me to help people implement nutritional science into their daily lives to achieve their health and weight goals. I have already enrolled and received a generous donation for half of the course. Loan outstanding $742
  3. Certificate in Plant-Based Nutrition — Cornell University T Colin Foundation. The author of The China Study has designed a powerful science-based approach to nutrition that can dramatically reduce your risk of cancer, diabetes, heart disease, and obesity and improve your quality of life. $1,260
  4. Life Coach Certification — New Insights Life Coach Training offers the rigorous and practical certification that I need to help you bring about lasting change in your life. I want to help you be all that you can be! $1,740
  5. Cost of new website, software and marketing expenses to date $2,233

I know that I can make a difference in many people's lives and these qualifications will help me be more effective. I am so motivated to get going that I have already enrolled. So I desperately need your help to cover at least the first 2 options which I have already committed to: $1,681. 

I am relying on your help to please make it happen!

Why Elated?

When I started Elated in 2007, I was looking for a name that conveyed two concepts: 1) being a vegan is a joyful experience and 2) as consumers we have the power to save the lives of animals through conscientious food choices. So discovering that 'Enhancing the Lives of Animals Through Ethical Decisions’ produces the acronym ‘ELATED’ was a gift from the land of impossible-dreams-come-true!

For me, living a vegan lifestyle resonates with my core inner truth. The fact that all I need to do is stop eating animals and I will gain abundant health, help heal the planet and save the lives of between 80 and 400 animals every year... It is an opportunity I simply cannot refuse. The result? Peace of mind and an ever-lasting feeling of Elation. 

That is how I want you to feel: Elated!

Other Ways You Can Be An Elated Supporter

Do you believe in the work Elated does, but don't have the cash to spare? There are a few ways you can help:

  • Do you buy image credits? Simply click on any of Elated's images first or use these affilitate links: 123RF or iStock or Dreamstime and you will help me earn a referral commission. 
  • Please Like', 'Share' and 'Comment' on Elated's Facebook posts when you do like them! That helps get the message out and reduce the advertising fees.
  • Visit my Elated Vegan Amazon Store for a large selection of vegan books, DVD's, cosmetics, food, supplements and sports nutrition and I will receive a small commission.
  • Are you a whizz in the vegan kitchen. Join Elated's team of gifted foodie bloggers by contributing your recipes to the site.

Thank you!

Do you want to get started right away? You are welcome to get in touch with me to schedule a free 20‑minute session and find out more about your Elated Vegan Coaching. 

I look forward to meeting you!

Warm regards 
Karen Johnson

story:
Listen up Grateful Americans!

In just a few short weeks Chris and his fellow Marines will be returning home from a tour in war torn Afghanistan. We are looking to raise money to provide a venue and plenty of food, beverages and activities for the marines, families and guests alike. Anyone who knows Chris or anyone simply wanting to show the support of a grateful nation are welcome to attend. This will be an amazingly good time and with your generous donations can only ensure the best welcome home party possible.

What we need:

We estimate needing $800, which will go to renting a facility (likely the Elks Lodge.) The need for a facility ensures plenty of room for guests and parking. Additionally, proceeds will be utilized to provide plenty of hamburgers, hotdogs, snacks and drinks for all in attendence. If money permits we will look into hiring a local band to play.

The impact:

By donating, you ensure that the reunion of a great Marine with family and friends is an ejoyable experience with lots of fun, food and laughter. By taking donations we are taking the burden off of family and friends to front money for the event.

I would like to personally thank everyone for taking the time to view this page. I would also like to thank all military members past and present for your service.

story:
On August 11th Charlie ran the Falmouth Road Race and collapsed due to heat exhaustion. He was rushed to Falmouth Hospital where they worked on lowering his body temperature and supporting his other body systems with a breathing tube and sedative medication. Due to the shock from the heat stroke he developed a blood clotting disorder DIC and a muscle breakdown disorder Rhabdomyolysis. His kidneys began to shut down as well. We had him med-flighted to Tufts Medical Center MICU where he received blood products and continuous dialysis. However, after a few days Charlie's liver began to fail and the Doctors were concerned he may need a transplant. We med-flighted him to Lahey Clinic and began the listing process for a liver. Luckily, after 3 days, Charlie's own liver function began improving and he was able to be transferred back to Tufts without transplant. Throughout this whole time we were concerned because Charlie was not waking up despite him being off sedative medication for quite some time.

On Friday, August 31st Charlie began to wake up on his own and his breathing tube was removed. The first thing he asked for was to "see his girls." Saturday, Christie and Charlie watched Borat and he even cracked a few jokes. However, later that day we had a major set-back. Charlie cardiac arrested due to an unknown cause. The doctors think he may have had a blood clot which shot to his lungs and his was started on blood thinning medication. Luckily, nurses were right at his bedside within seconds and CPR was performed quickly. A CAT scan did not show any acute issues and Charlie's body temperature was lowered with a machine for 24 hours to preserve brain function. He was sedated, intubated and closely monitored once again.

Charlie is currently at the Spaulding Rehab in Cambridge.  He has remained on Dialysis treatments every M-W-F (3 times per week.) Many of his measurable medical numbers continue to improve a bit each week, however he still has a long way to go before his kidneys recover to an acceptable level.  He still continues to struggle with a wide variety of medical issues.
He has physical therapy 5-6 times per week for about 1 hour. The PT & OT includes range-of-motion exercises, sitting upright in a mobile chair for 2-3 hrs, stretching of muscles & joints, sight-sound work, as well as a variety of tracking, touch & other sensory activities.
He has been off of the ventilator for the past 5 days. This milestone will increase his PT options.
The overall challenges with his condition remain with his limited state of consciousness.  We receive occasional facial expressions/responses from Charlie, such as purposeful blinking and mouth movements, etc... 
 
Spaulding Rehab is doing an excellent job in caring for Charlie and working on the wide variety of his needs. We continue to utilize the services of an outside Nursing agency from 9pm - 6am to supplement & help watch over him when a family member is not there throughout the evening.  Charlie also responds really well to accupuncture, so we have been bringing in the on-staff accupuncturist 1-2 times per week.
 
The entire Papazian family continues to feel and appreciate all your love, prayers and care for Charlie and us all.  We continue to marvel at the support of our Family/Relatives, Friends.  You all have provided so much Love, Support & Kindness.  Your visits, cards, emails, calls, texts, and prayers have been amazing and inspirational.

The doctors do not have a predictor of the time or to the extent that Charlie may recover.  Unfortunately, for those of us living in different parts of the world, pooling financial resources can be difficult. 

Charlie has been an inspiration and now it’s time we return that favor.

We have set up this Indiegogo account to raise funds to aid the Papazian family.  We hope to make life easier during this difficult time (be that medical bills, child care or holiday gifts for his daughter Molly).

All proceeds will directly benefit Chuck and his family.

For updates on his condition, please login here: http://www.carepages.com/carepages/252429/invitations/1814790/35b6762ea25741655a24cf8cb9f31e4b4a989bf3?client_code=tuftsmedicalcenter&ipc=miv

story:
OUR STORY

   

    In January 2010, a group of student leaders from Cornell University embarked on what they called the “Fistula Free Climb”, sumitting Mt. Kilimanjaro in order to raise money and awareness for OperationOF, a non-profit organization founded by Seth Cochran which helps women suffering from obstetric fistulas, a horrific and almost unheard of condition. This climb was inspired by Seth Cochran's Summit for Smiles Campaign in 2007 which raised $40,000 for cleft palate surgery for The Smile Train through climb of Mt. Kilimanjaro.

 

    Inspired by these momentously altruistic feats, “Mountains for Moms” was born. In January 2012, a new group of student leaders from Cornell, along with some very inspired and entrepreneurial alumni, will attempt to summit Mt. Kilimanjaro in support of Obstetric Fistula.

 

    By taking an unorthodox and active approach (climbing a freakin’ mountain!), Mountains for Moms hopes to more effectively rouse and capture people’s attention for a worthy cause that honestly, is overlooked. For more information about the trip, the cause, our climbers, and our efforts, please visit our website, Facebook page or Twitter feed.

 

    Help support us by contributing and/or sharing this page through Facebook / Twitter / Email!

 

THE IMPACT

 

    Every year nearly 100,000 women are diagnosed with an Obstetric Fistula (OF) injury. Sustained during childbirth, OF is the result of a tear in the walls separating a woman’s reproductive and excretory systems. This leads to a never-ending flow of urine and stool, destroying her life and making her a social outcast. Today, more than 2 million young women live with untreated OF in Asia and sub-Saharan Africa.

 

The GOOD NEWS is: Obstetric Fistula is easily treatable with a simple surgery that costs just $200 and is effective in 90% of cases.

 

    Mountains for Moms thinks it’s a severe injustice that so many women in the developing world receive dramatically inadequate maternal health care. We are fund raising for OperationOF, which finds women with obstetric fistula and facilitates their surgical treatment through a treatment partner. A performance-based funding structure is used to support local surgeons. This ensures a high quality of care at a low cost of service and allows us to commit 100% of your donation to the program.

 

CONTACT US

  

   For any questions or comments or how to get more involved, please get in touch with Saummya Kaushal (sk868@cornell.edu).

story:
My name is Cole Winarick. I am 18 years old and am currently a freshman at the University of Delaware. In March of 2008, my father was diagnosed with Melanoma, the deadliest form of skin cancer. Cancerous tumors were found in his chest, some of which were surgically removed. Then in June of 2009, his cancer metastasized when a new tumor was found in his lung. This diagnosis usually comes with a life expectancy of maybe a year or two, but sometimes even a few short months. Because my family is a very positive family, we all refused to accept these statistics.

After intense research over the past couple of years, we have found that there is no cure for melanoma, but even worse, there is a very little funding available for melanoma research, comparatively speaking to other forms of cancer. Luckily, we found a new experimental clinical trial treatment being conducted at the Dana Farber Cancer Institute in Boston. My father was accepted into the trial, and he agreed to participate in it. He was the ninth patient in his phase of the clinical trial, hence the “Patient 9 Foundation.”

This clinical trial was run by Melanoma Specialist, Dr. Stephen Hodi at the Dana Farber Cancer Institute. My father was about 4 months into this experimental treatment when his liver failed, in February of 2010. He spent over one month in the hospital on copious amounts of drugs, specifically steroids, to try to get his liver function to return to normal. After this setback, he was not allowed to go back on the experimental treatment, however, the clinical trial drugs worked so well on his melanoma, that they continued in its attack of the tumors in my father’s body.

For over 6 months, things were looking progressively better; the tumors were shrinking and his liver functioning was back to normal. Then in September of 2010, a brain MRI scan showed 5 cancerous lesions in his brain, the biggest of which is located on his cerebellum which has affected his motor control, balance and coordination. Follow-up full body scans uncovered several other new tumors as well as growth in the pre-existing ones. It seemed as though the uphill battle was becoming evermore steep with each new scan, but we all refused to give up hope. Again, the doctors at Dana Farber had a plan and he had to undergo whole head radiation and even more pinpointed stereotactic radiation.

After a lifetime of smiles, family, friends, and joy, my father passed away on June 25, 2011 from melanoma cancer. It had affected our family, our friends, and myself greatly. Life has been different without him, but I will always know he is with me.

This all led up to my work with the Delaware Community Foundation, within this, the creation of my own legal non-profit foundation called the “Patient 9 Foundation.” My first goal is to raise $250,000 by means of various fundraisers and donations. I plan on donating this money to help fund a melanoma research grant so that my father’s experimental treatment may have a higher remission and/or cure rate and altogether save lives. This website makes donating to the foundation more easily accessible and provides information to the public about “Patient 9 Foundation” and melanoma/skin cancer.

For me, the sky is the limit, and I will not stop until I reach my goal. This foundation means everything to my father, my family, my supporters and to me. Please help join the support and spread the awareness. Thank you

For me, the sky is the limit, and I will not stop until I reach my goal. This foundation means everything to my father, my family, my supporters and to me. Please help join the support and spread the awareness. Thank you

story:
Short Summary

Hawaii Elite Track Team, a non-profit organization, has been in existence since 1992. First established on Oahu, but now making it's home here on Maui since 1996, Hawaii Elite Track Team has catered to the track and field youth community of Hawaii for now seventeen years.

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need $3000 to help send 4 kids, coach and a chaperone to 3-4 Meets on in June and to the Championships in July. This would cover airfaire for the kids only. Any and all help will be great!

Whoever qualifies to make it to the Junior Olympics in Balitimore Maryland at the end of July would need to raise another $2000 per kid, coach and chaperones. But really any amount will bring the kids closer to their goal of achieving this dream.

One of our Team Kids, Selai Dumani has qualified for the past 2 years and represented Hawaii!!  We are hoping that all 4 Runners will be able to make it this year.

They are working hard and already breaking records in their events this year.


Please help support our cause. If you can only give $20, or $10, or even $1 it will truly make a difference. A little goes a long way, and every cent will be greatly appreciated.

 

The Impact

Running at this level is not a casual undertaking. Our Runners train 3-5 times per week with our dedicated Coach Rudy Huber, who puts his heart and sould into this.
 
We are extremely dependent upon the support and help of the greater community.We are asking our professors, our family members, teachers, our friends, the friends of our friends, and yes YOU to help with our cause. You can indeed make an impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute to the cause, please help by getting the word out. Post this on your facebook, youtube and twitter accounts. Send this to friends, coworkers, or someone you know who can help or support us.

We are extremely grateful and appreciative of any effort and support for our cause

story:
Trying to raise money to help defray the costs of a major surgery in that occurred in late February of 2012 and another upcoming surgery due to some complications from the first surgery. My story.... In February of 2012 I ended up hospitalized due to severe stomach pains. An ultra sound was issued and it was found that I had a large tear in my inner abdominal wall. I was scheduled for surgery a day and a half later and they cut my abdominal wall open to repair the inner structure.  During the surgery (5 1/2 hours) I ended up losing about a unit of blood. I was eventually released to go home, and that was where the long road to recovery begins... The following weekend I ended up falling and me being bullheaded did not go back to the doctors right away. I was eventually admitted to the hospital with blood clots and was not able able to return to work for 6 weeks. Finally returning to work I had continued to experience a lot of discomfort due to the surgery and was told I eventually needed another to repair some of the damage from the first surgery that did not heal correctly. During the first surgery a 5 1/2 inch piece of mesh was used to repair the tear in my abdominal wall. We were left with several thousand in medical bills and having a family with two kids have been trying to pay them off before accumulating more medical bills in regards to the next surgery. We are a family that never tries to ask for help, but have come to the realization that sometimes one must do such a thing.   Any help would be greatly appreciated as we come from low income professions, my wife being a teacher and myself in law enforcement/corrections.

Thank you in advance for any help you may find fitting.

God's Blessings

story:
Short Summary

Larry is my dad. Three years ago he battled against prostate cancer by having surgery. He was clear for a year then it came back. After a round of chemotherapy, it was gone, but as he is the sole provider for my mom and diabetic younger brother, the family had amassed a lot of debt.

This June 2012, he went to work one day as if all was normal and began slurring his words. His boss called an ambulance thinking it was a stroke. After many CT, MRI, and PET scans, plus a liver and brain biopsy, he got a new diagnosis of glioblastoma- a very aggressive cancer of the brain. The prognosis with this cancer is very poor- estimates put the survival time after diagnosis if untreated at 3 months and if treated, somewhere between a year and 18 months. Our family is crushed. He has been a healthy, hard-working, brilliant man his whole life and a wonderful father.

It is now 6 weeks after his diagnosis and he is halfway through rounds of chemotherapy and radiation. The doctors can't operate because the tumor is too close to the motor control center of his brain and they are afraid it would render him completely paralyzed, if not kill him. In that time he has gone from looking and acting perfectly normal to being given a wheelchair because he can't walk. He has trouble comprehending words and even more trouble forming words so that he gets very frustrated trying to communicate. He occasionally loses use of the right side of his body so that my mom is having to feed him.

He has swelling in his brain and has had one violent seizure already that left him unable to speak at all for 24 hours. He is on steroids, chemo, radiation, anticoagulants, and anticonvulsants.

What We Need

It took nearly a month before his short-term unemployment benefits kicked in. The insurance company insisted on a diagnosis before they would give him anything. And that required scheduling a liver biopsy (for another questionable lesion) and waiting for those results- which were inconclusive. Then scheduling a brain biopsy, mailing it off, waiting for results...In all that time the family has had no money coming in. Extended family members have been chipping in to pay for groceries and my brother's insulin ($200 a month,) but we don't have a ton of spare money ourselves. The money finally came from the insurance but it was less than promised because they told us it wouldn't be taxed but it is being.

 

The Impact

Please help us provide groceries to Dad, Mom, and my brother, and help pay for my brother's insulin. That's the main point of this fund but if more money can be made, it will go towards paying off some of their bills which are in collection and turning on their phone which has been shut off.
 
This photo used in the campaign is of my dad and me, taken when he was told he had a brain tumor but before the biopsy was back and he was given the news that it is incurable. I prefer to use this photo instead of ones of him in the hospital because I just can't think of him that way and want people to see him as a loving dad, not as a patient.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Pray
  • Share this campaign with everyone you know!

story: Lewis Garcia is a 48 year old husband and father who has suffered from steady heart problems since 1998 when he had his first heart attack at the age of 35. A lifetime soccer player, Lew’s active and healthy lifestyle stirred shock and disbelief as Lew went on to face a 2nd heart attack in 2003 which led to a 6-Bypass surgery. His children were 6, 2 and newborn at the time, and since then he and his family have faced unimaginable odds together as he never stopped working to secure employment that would support his family and provide healthcare. Lew has dedicated his professional life to serving people, committing 15 years to working with foster youth that together can only be described as inspirational and remarkable. Though challenges remained constant, his love for his family has never let up as everything he has done has been for them. His children, now 15, 11 and 9, have lived a financially simple life thus far that has been rich in ways most cannot fathom, as they embrace every day they have with him. They are a family that has been touched by the near-death reality that comes from facing heart attacks and a bypass surgery together. They embrace moments we commonly take for granted, and they love each other and appreciate life out of their experiences together thus far. Lew is my best friend, and approaching this campaign has been difficult in that his loving wife has nowhere else to go. In her search for a minimal amount of funds that would secure his health coverage for a few months, she was completely out of options. Healthcare providers can hesitate, delay and react differently with patients who lack health insurance, and it is devastating to imagine that this factor alone could keep him from receiving the medical attention he needs and in the time frame he needs it, something that could be life threatening in the days and weeks to come as those familiar symptoms have not only resurfaced but worsened. A family needs to know that it did all they could to get their dad and husband the care he needs. I don’t know how his children would cope with the reality that perhaps something could have, but wasn’t, done to treat their Dad so that he could continue being the ever-present and loving father he has always been. I can only aspire to be the wonderful father he is to my own 3 children. He is a true human being in every sense who is loved by many. As difficult as it is for us to step up and ask, we humbly seek donations of even $1 that can serve to help reach our current goal of $2000. Two of us raised $400 over the weekend so far. This amount would cover a few months of premiums as well as basic sustenance for his family as they are between home and hospital. Lew is presently in CCU awaiting confirmation for an angiogram appointment that may likely confirm the need for another bypass procedure. Though we cannot alleviate his very real fear, we can perhaps help him to breathe a bit easier as he would know that his family is carrying less of a burden through it all. “To know that even one life has breathed easier because you have lived … this is to have succeeded.” (Ralph Waldo Emerson.) Thank you for touching his life through the simple act of reading this. Please pray for him and his family in the coming days and weeks.

story:
Why is Psychology Today trying to mess with our minds? Apparently, the editors at Psychology Today felt it was a good idea to publish a post written by Satoshi Kanazawa titled “Why Are Black Women Less Physically Attractive Than Other Women?” The story went viral and was read by millions around the world.  

So, I decided to do a little mind bending of my own. As a black man who is married to a beautiful black woman, I didn’t get mad I got busy.I am creating a photo essay that will portray the beauty of African American women of all shades, shapes and sizes. The final product will be a coffee table book filled with 30 to 40 high quality black & white and color photographs celebrating the beauty and spirit of black women. You will see some familiar faces, but the majority of the photos will be of everyday women and girls from all walks of life. The themes will deal with the hair, skin tone and body images of black women.

As a professional photographer, I own all of the equipment to create the book. I plan to photograph women from all over the country. The call for “models” will go out by word of mouth, over the internet, and in the media. Here’s where I need your help. In addition to raising funds for travel and printing, I plan to hire makeup artists and wardrobe stylists to work with our “models”. 

As you can see we have some cool rewards so please become a backer and share this message on Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, and other social media outlets.

Thank you for helping to celebrate “Beauty in Black.”

story:
Who are we?

We are Squeezease Therapy, a small team based in Vancouver, British Columbia commmitted to improve the lives of individuals with autism through the development of the Snug Vest.  Our goal in the next few months is to make the vest available for everyone who needs one. Visit www.snugvest.com to know more about our company.

What is the Snug Vest?

The Snug Vest is an inflatable therapy garment used for administering evenly-distributed pressure to the sides, shoulders, and back of the torso.  The vest provides Deep Pressure Therapy to relieve anxiety and increase focus and attention for individuals with sensory and anxiety disorders. Click here to read more about the Snug Vest. 

What is Autism?

Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is a life-long developmental disability and neurological dysfunction that affects 1 in 88 children in North America. Individuals diagnosed with autism often have an impaired ability to communicate and engage in social interactions.

Why do we need funding?

We currently have a number of eager parents who want to offer the Snug Vest as a treatment to their child's needs, but currently do not have the capacity to meet this demand. With the funding provided, we can produce more Snug Vests of different sizes at a faster rate by investing in the necessary tools and equipment.

What is our goal?

Our goal is to raise $20,000 to create customized tools that can help make our Snug Vests in larger quantities at a faster rate. Every dollar that is given to this project will go directly towards getting the vest on to the backs of those who this will help.   

What are the perks?

In return for every contribution of $600, you will be providing a Snug Vest to a child in need. Other rewards include T-Shirts, Squeeze Bears, Plush Bears, Massagers, and Pillow Sets. With every contribution over $10, you will receive a personalized card from us and a thank-you from a child waiting for a Snug Vest.

 

Every dollar will make a difference towards our project. We appreciate your participation and contributions of all sizes.

- Team Snug Vest

Click contribute now or any one of the perks to the right to purchase tickets to our event and support cancer patients and caregivers everywhere.

Purchase raffle tickets now- you need not be at the Fall Fundraiser to WIN!  The more tickets you purchase the better your chances!

Win a two night stay at the Hotel Wilshire(http://www.hotelwilshire.com/)
in sunny Los Angeles, CA, located in the heart of the miracle mile on world famous Wilshire Blvd. plus 2 Frontier airline vouchers ($1,300 value). Please purchase raffle tickets with your event tickets on the right side of the page.

Crudités and dip
Crostinis with two different toppings

Black bean empanadas

Great Lakes Brewery

story:
Our Campaign...

• NEW GOAL! Raise $20,000 to support TBI treatments for Veterans

• Warrior Angels Foundation doesn't raise awareness, we solve problems!

Check out our feature on Fox News: FoxNews.com features Warrior Angels Foundation on 9-11

Visit www.warriorangelsfoundation.org for more information on Warrior Angels Foundation,Dr. Gordon and his clinical approach to diagnose and treat TBI, or to fill out a new patient intake form.

Dr. Mark L. Gordon and the Warrior Angels Foundation have formed a partnership to revolutionize the devastating impact of traumatic brain injury on our Veterans. Dr. Gordon’s clinical approach is changing the way we think about traumatic brain injuries, their symptoms - and how to treat them effectively.

The Statistics tell the story...

  • Over 400 hundred veterans are currently on our waiting list for treatment.
  • There are over 2.5 million American veterans of the Iraq and Afghanistan wars.
  • An estimated 460,000 veterans suffer from PTSD.
  • The Department of Defense and the Defense and Veteran's Brain Injury Center estimate that 22% of all combat casualties from these conflicts are brain injuries.
  • Over 8,000 veterans die by their own hands every year… about one every hour.
  • The current system is not working!

Other Ways You Can Help...

We understand that some will be unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word! Share the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/WarriorAngelsFoundation 
  • Check out our blog post at: http://warriorlegacy.me for information and updates.


Patient success stories:

Andrew Marr founded the Warrior Angels Foundation, is a former Special Forces Green Beret, and current patient of Dr. Gordon's. You can hear his amazing story here. https://youtu.be/U5rDlk87hv0

Matthew Gosney is a former Navy CORPSMEN and current patient of Dr. Gordon's, you can hear his amazing story here. https://youtu.be/tbxPxFiOIKc

Most of our patients start experiencing a response within weeks of beginning their personalized protocol. Many return to their pre-injury status after 6 months. The success of the Millennium-TBI program has been in the use of protocols that step outside the conventional boundaries of modern medicine but stay within the confines of science. 


TBI and PTS have been called the signature wound of the war.

Conventional treatment continues to be founded on medication and psychotherapy.

This is clearly not improving quality of life.

We don't raise awareness, we solve problems.

De Oppresso Liber

Matthew Gosney is a former Navy CORPSMEN and current patient of Dr. Gordon's, you can hear his amazing story here. https://youtu.be/tbxPxFiOIKc

Most of our patients start experiencing a response within weeks of beginning their personalized protocol. Many return to their pre-injury status after 6 months. The success of the Millennium-TBI program has been in the use of protocols that step outside the conventional boundaries of modern medicine but stay within the confines of science. 



TBI and PTS have been called the signature wound of the war.
Conventional treatment continues to be founded on medication and psychotherapy. 

This is clearly not improving quality of life.

We don't raise awareness, we solve problems.

De Oppresso Liber

story:
ISSA mikro now available on foreo.com!
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

How does my child use the ISSA mikro?

Depending on their age, children can use the ISSA mikro by themselves or have an adult brush with them. The ISSA mikro has been designed with an ergonomic, lightweight handle so children's small hands can get a comfortable grip when using it by themselves. We recommend always having an adult supervise brushing routines. 

  1. Press the center button once for Brush Mode and a second time for Massage Mode. Depending on your child's age, use with a dentist recommended amount of infant-formulated soothing gel or toothpaste. 
  2. Use the same way as a manual toothbrush, and brush teeth and massage gums with wide, circular movements for two minutes.
  3. Press the center button a third time to turn off the device and rinse. 

Note: The ISSA mikro comes with a How To Guide in the package, plus all Indiegogo supporters will be sent a downloadable Full Manual via email when we ship the perks.
 

Does the ISSA mikro have a spinning brush head?

No, the ISSA mikro uses gentle pulsations instead of spinning action to gently yet effectively clean baby teeth and gums. It is designed to be used with the same circular movement used with a manual toothbrush.
 

Can babies chew on the ISSA mikro?

The ISSA mikro is made from safe, food-grade silicone that’s free of BPA and phthalates, plus its brush head is non-detachable. It is therefore safe for babies to chew on during their brushing routine; however, we recommend the ISSA mikro only be used as an oral-care device and not as a teething toy.
 

 

What is Sonic Pulse Technology and is it safe for babies and young children?

FOREO's Sonic Pulse Technology is essentially gentle vibrations that are completely safe for babies. The sensation feels pleasant and soothing on their teeth and gums. The ISSA mikro channels up to 6,000 gentle pulsations through the soft and flexible silicone per minute and has two speeds so you can also adjust the intensity to suit your baby’s needs and comfort level. We recommend you consult your dental-care professional before adding any new products to your child’s oral-care routine.
 

How do the Smile Helpers help track my child’s brushing? 

The ISSA mikro has two Smile Helpers that appear when the center button is pressed to turn the device on. “Glee” (happy face) appears after 2 minutes of brushing and “Glum” (sad face) appears if your child hasn’t brushed in over 12 hours. “Glee” and “Glum” will both light up if your child hasn’t brushed for the full 2 minutes. The ISSA mikro also has an integrated timer that will lightly pulse to indicate when you should brush another quadrant of the month and to signify the end of the 2-minute brushing routine.
 

What clinical studies and safety tests have been done for the ISSA mikro?

In order to create the safest product for your children and ours, we’ve extensively tested the ISSA mikro. It is PVC-, phthalate-, latex-, and BPA-free. It has been tested by SGS, the largest product material company in the world. Its safety certifications include RoHS Compliant, CE Safety Mark, and IPX7 Protection. The device has also undergone extensive internal testing and clinical trials to confirm its ability to effectively clean teeth and massage gums.
 

 

How do I clean the ISSA mikro?

After each brushing routine, rinse the ISSA mikro with clean running water. The medical-grade silicone bristles prevents bacteria buildup allowing the ISSA mikro to stay clean and hygienic between uses!

For additional sterilization, the ISSA mikro can be washed in the dishwasher: using a maximum temperature setting of 80 degrees Celsius, use a 1-hour wash/rinse cycle and a 30-minute drying cycle. You can also use a baby bottle sterilizer with a maximum temperature of 100 degrees Celsius for a maximum of 20 minutes.
 

How often do I need to replace the ISSA mikro?

Because of its completely encased, one-piece design and hygienic silicone material, you never have to purchase a replacement brush head for the ISSA mikro. Plus, it has a long battery life: 1 hour of charging delivers approximately 8 months of use! After 5 years of age, your child can upgrade to the ISSA mini.
 

Can my child use ISSA mikro with toothpaste or a soothing gel?

Yes. Depending on your child's age, use with a dentist recommended amount of infant-formulated soothing gel or toothpaste. We do not recommend using tooth powder or products with bleachers with children.
 

Can my child use ISSA mikro if they have mouth ulcers, tooth decay, gum disease, or any other oral conditions?

We suggest that anyone who suffers from a serious oral condition should consult their dental-care professional before using an ISSA electric toothbrush.
 

What is the difference between all of the ISSA toothbrushes?

The ISSA is an adult electric toothbrush that has a 100% silicone-bristle brush head. It is perfect for those with gum recession or sensitivities.

The ISSA hybrid is an adult electric toothbrush that has PBT polymer bristles surrounded by silicone bristles. It’s perfect for those who prefer a more vigorous brushing, as well as a gentle gum massage. Although we are not offering the full ISSA hybrid toothbrush via our Indiegogo perks, we are including an ISSA hybrid brush head in select bundles so that those who purchase an ISSA can also try the hybrid technology!

The ISSA mini is an electric toothbrush suitable for children ages 5 and up. It has a 100% silicone bristled brush head.

For more information on the above products, visit www.foreo.com

The ISSA mikro (the newest addition to the range) is an electric toothbrush suitable for children ages 0 to 4 years old. It has a 100% silicone brush head. 
 

When will I receive my perks?

Production for all orders received during our Indiegogo campaign (April 26th - June 24th) will be shipped from our warehouse at the end of July, customers can expect to receive shipments between end of July-early August. All orders placed during our In Demand phase (June 24th onwards) can expect to receive their products earliest end of July. 
 

What is the Authenticity Card?

Each FOREO device comes with its own unique Authenticity Card that allows each customer to register for the product warranty on foreo.com. We strongly recommend registering your product as soon as you receive it so we can verify your 2-Year Limited Warranty and also assist you better with any future customer care inquiries.
 

My question isn’t here, how do I submit a new question? 

You can add a new question related to the ISSA mikro or our Indiegogo campaign in the “COMMENTS” tab of this page, and one of our awesome team members will help you as soon as possible. During times of high-volume inquiries, please be patient as we plan to answer all our valued supporters.

story:
About Me.

My name is John Platero. I've been in the health and fitness industry in one way or another for over 40 years. In that time I've witnessed our country's health get worse and worse.  By the year 2020 our health care costs are estimated to be $1,000,000,000,000 a year! (Yep, that's a trillion dollars)
Over the last 21 years I've been educating and certifying personal trainers. I have a dual master's degree in Exercise Science with an emphasis in personal training and I've also been certified 35 times! 
 I am a state champion, 2-time national champion, 3-time gold medalist in the Master's Pan American Games and a 21-time World Senior Games gold medalist in road racing, mountain biking and the velodrome.  Before that I was an IFBB Mr. South Florida. (That's bodybuidling, International Federation of Body Building) It wasn't easy. I've had 13 surgeries -10 of them orthopedic. I'm a competitor and don't quit.
With the internet we now really have the ability to make a difference. Smart Fitness and my other company, the National Council for Certified Personal Trainers have been certifying people for decades.  We're experts in delivering health and fitness education. We're doing it now. With your contribution we'll be able to expand this program to include many more health and fitness professionals.
The funding is for the software to help integrate fitness devices and integrate the learning marketplace so that all fitness professionals can join in a consolidated effort to help those that need the help. It's not easy in a modern society to stay healthy. People need help and we can give it to them!

Whether we reach our goal or fall short, your contribution will still help us develop the software and continue to recruit, educate and certify more and more fitness professionals who will then go  out and motivate others to live a healthy lifestyle.

The Impact

I'm sure everyone has lost someone to cancer, heart disease, diabetes, etc. Most of these diseases are somewhat preventable with healthy lifestyle changes. If you care about the United States and both our economic future and health, you can help make a difference by contributing to Smart Fitness. We've been successful for 21 years in educating health and fitness professionals. We're ready to start educating the public.

Risks & Challenges

Technology is a challenge because its constantly changing. However, a healthy lifestyle is constant. We know that movement, adequate rest and real  whole foods are key to living healthy. The challenge is to get people to make the right choices. Education, constant reminders and achievable small goals are key to the success of anyone trying to consistently live a healthy lifestyle. Although technology is a challenge it's also a solution, providing easily accessible and readily available tools to help us stay healthy and live longer, more productible, self-sustaining lives.

We've been creating health and fitness education for 21 years. We've help develop three different software projects to assist in the delivery and tracking of this education. We know how to do this and I, don't quit!

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please play this forward to anyone you know who may want to contribute and if you want to jump in an help, go to NCCPT.com to get certified and start motivating others to live healthier more productive lives!

story:
YOU CAN STILL JOIN THE STUDY!

Click HERE to get your Detox Me Action Kit.

For more information, visit us at www.silentspring.org.

 

What is it?

Every day we are exposed to chemicals in our environment and in the products we use. Many of these chemicals are endocrine disruptors that interfere with the natural hormones in our bodies and can cause health effects.

The Detox Me™ Action Kit is an easy and non-invasive urine test that detects the presence of 10 common household toxics in your body. You’ll receive a personalized digital report that compares your results with the aggregate data collected from all Detox Me™ participants and gives you concrete actions you can take to reduce your body’s chemical load.

 

 

The Detox Me™ Action Kit is part of a scientific study run by Silent Spring Institute, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We’re crowdfunding this study to get a better sense of our collective exposure to harmful environmental chemicals. Taking part in the study not only will empower you to live a healthier life, you will also be helping us generate new scientific knowledge about everyday chemical exposures. These data can support stronger policies that protect people from dangerous chemicals in consumer products.

 

Why should I get tested?

Knowledge is not just power, but a prescription for prevention!

 

Your personalized report…

  1. indicates your level of exposure to particular toxics and shows how you compare with others in the study and in the U.S.
  2. informs you about what is known about the health risks associated with each chemical
  3. helps identify the likely sources of your exposure
  4. warns you if your exposure is much higher than others in the study
  5. shows you how to use our Detox Me™ smartphone app to help you reduce your exposures and see how low you can go

 

This is good for Silent Spring Institute because…

  1. it will help us further our mission to empower consumers to take action to lower unnecessary exposures to harmful chemicals called endocrine disruptors that interfere with the body’s hormones
  2. it will allow us to better characterize the public’s exposure to toxic chemicals and identify important sources of exposure
  3. findings from the study could lead to new ways of reducing exposures and better public oversight of the use of chemicals in consumer products

Together, we can create a healthier environment for everyone.

 

As seen in…

 

"It Tears You Down, and Builds You Up," October 28, 2016 (Season 1, Episode 72)

“The Truth About Toxins,” August 12, 2016 (Season 4, episode 5)

 

What chemicals does it test for?

Currently, our test screens for 10 of the most common household and environmental chemicals:

  1. Bisphenol A (BPA)
  2. Bisphenol S (BPS)
  3. Benzophenone-3 (BP-3)
  4. Triclosan (TCS)
  5. Triclocarban (TCC)
  6. 2,4-dichlorophenol (24-DCP)
  7. 2,5-dichlorophenol (25-DCP)
  8. Butyl paraben (B-PB)
  9. Ethyl paraben (E-PB)
  10. Methyl paraben (M-PB)

 

Many of these chemicals are endocrine disruptors and all of them can have harmful effects on your body. Some mimic estrogen or block androgen, so they may affect child development, fertility, and increase your risk of some cancers. By understanding the levels of these toxics in your body, you can begin to take action to reduce your exposures. If this campaign is successful, we plan to add additional chemicals to the test, including flame retardants.

 

Through our Action Kit report, and by using our Detox Me™ app, you will learn how to avoid:

  • lotions and other personal care products that include parabens and benzophenone
  • plastics commonly used in food packaging and processing that include BPA and BPS, a common BPA substitute
  • antibacterial products containing triclosan and DCP

Why these 10?

The Detox Me™ Action Kit tests for 10 common endocrine disruptors—chemicals that mimic and interfere with the body’s naturally occurring hormones. Hormones regulate many important activities in your body, so endocrine disrupting chemicals raise concerns ranging from effects on fertility to child development to cancer.

These 10 chemicals have been detected at different levels in people throughout the U.S., but detecting these chemicals in your urine doesn’t mean you will get sick. It is not known if exposure levels in the general population are above or below levels that cause health effects. Some people are more sensitive to effects than others, and the chemicals can act together, producing effects as a mixture that are not predicted from concentrations of each chemical on its own.

Given these uncertainties, some people may want to reduce their exposures as a precaution while scientists continue to study the effects. (Bergman et. al. 2013) You can learn more about endocrine disruptors and precautionary action in these statements from Project TENDR, the United Nations Environment Programme and World Health Organization, and the Endocrine Society.

 

  • Triclosan and Triclocarban are antibacterial and antifungal agents found in consumer products, including toothpaste, soaps, detergents, toys, and surgical cleaning treatments. Triclosan has been shown to alter thyroid and reproductive hormone levels and reproductive development in animals (Kumar 2009, Stoker 2010, Feng 2016). Studies in breast cancer cells show that both triclosan and triclocarban have the potential to alter the normal activity of estrogen (Gee et. al. 2008 and Ahn et. al 2008). The FDA recently banned the use of triclosan in some personal care products.

 

  • 2,5-DCP is a breakdown product of 1,4-DCB, which is used in mothballs and some toilet deodorizers. 1,4-DCB is classified as a possible human carcinogen (IARC 1999) and has been shown to affect the thyroid gland and thyroid hormone levels in rats (Elcombe et al. 2002). In human adolescents, levels of 2,5-DCP in urine were associated with thyroid hormone levels and hypothyroidism (Wei and Zhu 2016).

 

  • 2,4-DCP is a breakdown product of the widely-used herbicide 2,4-D, and may have other sources. It has been shown to affect the regulation and production of sex hormones and reduce egg hatching success in zebrafish (Ma et al. 2012).

 

  • BPA and BPS are chemicals used in some plastics, food and beverage packaging, and receipt paper. BPA is listed under California Proposition 65 as known to cause reproductive toxicity in women. BPA levels in the general population appear to be below levels where health effects are reported in animal studies, but there isn't clear evidence that current exposures are safe and BPA/BPS can act additively with other chemicals. BPA is estrogenic and alters development of the breast and prostate (Dhimolea et. al. 2014 and Acevedo et. al. 2013). BPS, sometimes used as a substitute to BPA, is estrogenic in rats (Yamasaki et al. 2004) and affects the production and regulation of sex hormones in zebrafish (Ji et al. 2013). BPA and BPS both affect brain development and behavior in zebrafish (Kinch 2015).

 

  • Benzophenone-3 is a chemical found in many sunscreen products. BP-3 has the potential to alter estrogen activity in breast cancer cells (Suzuki et. al. 2005). One study in humans shows changes in hormone concentrations for groups with highest exposure to BP-3 and parabens while another does not (Aker et. al. 2016, Scinicariello et. al. 2016).

 

  • Parabens are the most widely used preservatives in personal care products; they stop fungus, bacteria and other microbes from growing in creams and makeup. Parabens can interact with hormone receptors, similar to natural hormones like estrogen, and have been detected in breast tissue (Okubo et al., 2001 and Barr et al., 2012). For men, parabens may be associated with sperm DNA damage (Meeker et al., 2011).

 

Who is it for?

Our Detox Me™ Action Kit is for anyone age 18 and over who is curious about the toxic chemicals that might be lurking in their home or residing in their body.

While toxic chemicals in your everyday environment can affect your personal health, they also can affect your children’s health. Studies show that exposure to chemicals during critical periods of development—in the womb, during puberty, or during pregnancy—can increase the risk of health problems later in life. These critical periods, commonly referred to as “windows of susceptibility,” represent important stages in life when the body is developing and is most vulnerable to the effects of toxic chemicals.

Exposure to environmental chemicals early in life has been linked with cancer, poor brain development, obesity, diabetes, and other health effects. Because babies and small children spend lots of time on the floor, crawling, playing, and putting their hands in their mouths, they are at higher risk for exposure to pollutants in house dust.

 

 

Research by Silent Spring Institute has shown that numerous chemicals in consumer products build up in air and dust indoors, and these chemicals can end up in people’s bodies. By understanding what your own chemical levels are, you can take steps to protect your family from potentially harmful exposures, and reduce their risk of developing health problems in the future.

By participating in our study, you will be joining a large community that is working to advance science on chemical exposures and create a healthier environment not only for you and your family, but for everyone and for generations to come.

 

Testimonials / quotes

 

“The biomonitoring I did with Silent Spring Institute was revelatory. Not only did it show how easily certain consumer product chemicals cross into our bodies, but I learned how to reduce my levels. It changed the way I think about my household, and the way I think about my body. Regardless of the kinds of actions it inspires—personal, political, artistic—the knowledge is empowering."

 

“I sent my urine samples to Silent Spring Institute and was tested for 28 different chemicals all of which were detected in my body burden test, some at alarmingly high levels…You start to realize that you are surrounded by chemicals. Ultimately, the biggest thing you can do is do the best you can and push companies to do better. And in time, maybe we’ll all see our collective body burden go down. But it’s up to us to make sure things keep moving forward, in the right direction.”

 

“We now understand that factors within our control such as diet, exercise, and exposure to environmental chemicals like endocrine disruptors, influence cancer rates—months, years or even decades later. Even exposure of the fetus before birth to certain chemicals can influence cancer risk later in life. Just as the human genome project transformed our fundamental understanding of cancer, biomonitoring and big data have the potential to radically change our understanding of potentially modifiable risk factors for breast cancer and other diseases.”

 

“Silent Spring Institute has spent 20 years researching the effects of environmental toxicants on human health. Its researchers have published findings in peer-reviewed scientific journals, and the organization is well-respected in the field of cancer prevention research… Their Detox Me™ mobile app is a clever way to avoid toxic chemicals in everyday products. The app takes people through a crash course on household toxic chemicals and how to avoid them. As you advance through the Detox Me™ curriculum, you receive “badges” to mark your progress. You can also set up reminders for behaviors you’d like to work on.”

 

How does it work?

The test

Our test is easy and completely non-invasive. Here’s how it works:

 

The kit contains two glass jars, instructions, a cold pack, a link to our online survey, and a return shipping label.

You’ll take our online survey. It takes about 15 to 30 minutes, and you don’t have to answer any questions you don’t feel comfortable with. Your survey responses, along with your test results will help us personalize the report and recommendations you receive We need this information to learn how specific behaviors affect chemical body burdens.

Then you’ll collect two urine samples: one first thing in the morning, one at the end of the day. Place both jars and the cold pack in your freezer for at least 24 hours so they become frozen solid.

Pack the frozen jars and cold pack into the shipping container provided, slap on the pre-paid shipping label, and mail the package back to us.

After our lab analyzes your samples, we’ll send you a personalized digital report. That process takes about 8-12 weeks.

 

Preview the study consent form at http://silentspring.org/detoxme/consentform.pdf.

 

The report

You’ll access your report through our secure website. You may review it online, or print your results. We formulate our reports to be easy to understand and to give you actionable goals so you can see your levels of each toxic chemical, understand what we know, and what we don’t know, about the associated health risks, and take steps to reduce your exposure.

 

 

The app

Knowledge is not just power, but a prescription for prevention! Our free Detox Me™ app (available for iPhone and Android) walks you through simple, research-based tips on how to reduce your exposure to potentially harmful chemicals where you live and work—and it keeps track of your progress. Use our app to keep your exposures to these chemicals to a minimum.

 

 

The Detox Me™ Action Kit is...

It’s really just an easy urine test that provides amazing, informative, and actionable results for you and important data for our research team to better understand sources of exposure in the general public.

 

What it is not

The Detox Me™ Action Kit is not a detox formula. There’s nothing to drink or eat. It’s not scary or invasive. It’s not a quick-fix. Instead, it’s about making small, simple changes to your daily routine that over time will lower your chemical body burden.

 

Who’s behind this?

The Detox Me™ Action Kit is a project of Silent Spring Institute, a leading scientific research organization dedicated to understanding the link between chemicals in our everyday environment and health, especially breast cancer. Pursuing science for the public interest, Silent Spring’s groundbreaking studies produce new knowledge about the health risks associated with toxic chemicals where we live and work—areas of research that have too often been ignored in cancer research.

 

What are your qualifications?

Founded in 1994, Silent Spring Institute is a recognized leader in the field of exposure science and breast cancer prevention research. Our research was the the first to show that endocrine disrupting chemicals are prevalent in the indoor environment, and that consumer products are the most significant contributor to chemical exposures in the general population. We are also a pioneer in developing innovative tools and ethical methods for sharing chemical exposure and biomonitoring data with participants in large exposure studies.

Silent Spring is staffed by scientists with expertise in epidemiology, toxicology, chemistry, environmental health, and computational science. We collaborate with investigators at Harvard, Northeastern, University of California, Berkeley, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), U.S. Centers for Disease Control (CDC), and other top-tier research institutions, as well as with a diverse group of environmental and health advocacy groups.

This project marks the world’s first crowdsourced study on exposure to household and environmental toxics.

 

From Left: Julia Brody, PhD, Executive Director; Katherine Boronow, Research Assistant; Ruthann Rudel, MS, Research Director; Vincent Bessonneau, PhD, Research Scientist in Chemistry; Kathryn Rodgers, MPH, Staff Scientist; Alexandra Goho, Director of Communications; Herb Susmann, Software Developer and Data Scientist.

 

Why do we need your support?

We need at least 100 participants to make to launch our Detox Me™ Action Kit study.

The more participants that enroll, the more statistical power we will have to draw connections between the products that people use and the level of chemicals in their bodies. As the study grows, we will be able to expand the list of chemicals tested for with the Detox Me™ Action Kit.

 

Can children participate in the study?

No, currently the study is limited to participants ages 18 and over.

 

Is my contribution tax deductible?

Yes! Because Silent Spring Institute is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, the part of your contribution that is above the value of your urine analysis test is tax deductible. We estimate the non-tax deductible portion to be $180 per kit. The tax-deductible portion of your contribution, any amount above $180 per kit, helps us advance our mission by allowing us to fund the purchasing of sampling equipment and pay for the staff time necessary to run the project. Your contributions also help subsidize kits for low-income people who can not afford to pay for testing to ensure a broad pool of study participants that reflects the diversity of the U.S. population.  

 

Risks and challenges

  • We need 100 participants in order to move forward with the study. Unfortunately, it is not feasible for us to run the study if fewer than 100 people enroll. Full refunds will be available for anyone who signed up, if this happens.
  • Problems with sample collection. It’s important that the samples are kept frozen from the time they are collected to when they are analyzed. If the samples aren’t frozen when we get them, we will ask participants to collect another sample and try mailing them again.
  • Problems with analysis. There can be failures at the lab that cause the analysis of a sample to not work. In that case, the sample will be re-tested, which will slow down how fast we can give you back your results.
story_txt:
YOU CAN STILL JOIN THE STUDY!Click HERE to get your Detox Me Action Kit.For more information, visit us at www.silentspring.org. What is it?Every day we are exposed to chemicals in our environment and in the products we use. Many of these chemicals are endocrine disruptors that interfere with the natural hormones in our bodies and can cause health effects.The Detox Me™ Action Kit is an easy and non-invasive urine test that detects the presence of 10 common household toxics in your body. You’ll receive a personalized digital report that compares your results with the aggregate data collected from all Detox Me™ participants and gives you concrete actions you can take to reduce your body’s chemical load.  The Detox Me™ Action Kit is part of a scientific study run by Silent Spring Institute, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We’re crowdfunding this study to get a better sense of our collective exposure to harmful environmental chemicals. Taking part in the study not only will empower you to live a healthier life, you will also be helping us generate new scientific knowledge about everyday chemical exposures. These data can support stronger policies that protect people from dangerous chemicals in consumer products. Why should I get tested?Knowledge is not just power, but a prescription for prevention! Your personalized report…
indicates your level of exposure to particular toxics and shows how you compare with others in the study and in the U.S.
informs you about what is known about the health risks associated with each chemical
helps identify the likely sources of your exposure
warns you if your exposure is much higher than others in the study
shows you how to use our Detox Me™ smartphone app to help you reduce your exposures and see how low you can go
 This is good for Silent Spring Institute because…
it will help us further our mission to empower consumers to take action to lower unnecessary exposures to harmful chemicals called endocrine disruptors that interfere with the body’s hormones
it will allow us to better characterize the public’s exposure to toxic chemicals and identify important sources of exposure
findings from the study could lead to new ways of reducing exposures and better public oversight of the use of chemicals in consumer products
Together, we can create a healthier environment for everyone. As seen in… "It Tears You Down, and Builds You Up," October 28, 2016 (Season 1, Episode 72)“The Truth About Toxins,” August 12, 2016 (Season 4, episode 5) What chemicals does it test for?Currently, our test screens for 10 of the most common household and environmental chemicals:
Bisphenol A (BPA)
Bisphenol S (BPS)
Benzophenone-3 (BP-3)
Triclosan (TCS)
Triclocarban (TCC)
2,4-dichlorophenol (24-DCP)
2,5-dichlorophenol (25-DCP)
Butyl paraben (B-PB)
Ethyl paraben (E-PB)
Methyl paraben (M-PB)
 Many of these chemicals are endocrine disruptors and all of them can have harmful effects on your body. Some mimic estrogen or block androgen, so they may affect child development, fertility, and increase your risk of some cancers. By understanding the levels of these toxics in your body, you can begin to take action to reduce your exposures. If this campaign is successful, we plan to add additional chemicals to the test, including flame retardants. Through our Action Kit report, and by using our Detox Me™ app, you will learn how to avoid:
lotions and other personal care products that include parabens and benzophenone
plastics commonly used in food packaging and processing that include BPA and BPS, a common BPA substitute
antibacterial products containing triclosan and DCP
Why these 10?The Detox Me™ Action Kit tests for 10 common endocrine disruptors—chemicals that mimic and interfere with the body’s naturally occurring hormones. Hormones regulate many important activities in your body, so endocrine disrupting chemicals raise concerns ranging from effects on fertility to child development to cancer.These 10 chemicals have been detected at different levels in people throughout the U.S., but detecting these chemicals in your urine doesn’t mean you will get sick. It is not known if exposure levels in the general population are above or below levels that cause health effects. Some people are more sensitive to effects than others, and the chemicals can act together, producing effects as a mixture that are not predicted from concentrations of each chemical on its own.Given these uncertainties, some people may want to reduce their exposures as a precaution while scientists continue to study the effects. (Bergman et. al. 2013) You can learn more about endocrine disruptors and precautionary action in these statements from Project TENDR, the United Nations Environment Programme and World Health Organization, and the Endocrine Society. 
Triclosan and Triclocarban are antibacterial and antifungal agents found in consumer products, including toothpaste, soaps, detergents, toys, and surgical cleaning treatments. Triclosan has been shown to alter thyroid and reproductive hormone levels and reproductive development in animals (Kumar 2009, Stoker 2010, Feng 2016). Studies in breast cancer cells show that both triclosan and triclocarban have the potential to alter the normal activity of estrogen (Gee et. al. 2008 and Ahn et. al 2008). The FDA recently banned the use of triclosan in some personal care products. 
2,5-DCP is a breakdown product of 1,4-DCB, which is used in mothballs and some toilet deodorizers. 1,4-DCB is classified as a possible human carcinogen (IARC 1999) and has been shown to affect the thyroid gland and thyroid hormone levels in rats (Elcombe et al. 2002). In human adolescents, levels of 2,5-DCP in urine were associated with thyroid hormone levels and hypothyroidism (Wei and Zhu 2016). 
2,4-DCP is a breakdown product of the widely-used herbicide 2,4-D, and may have other sources. It has been shown to affect the regulation and production of sex hormones and reduce egg hatching success in zebrafish (Ma et al. 2012). 
BPA and BPS are chemicals used in some plastics, food and beverage packaging, and receipt paper. BPA is listed under California Proposition 65 as known to cause reproductive toxicity in women. BPA levels in the general population appear to be below levels where health effects are reported in animal studies, but there isn't clear evidence that current exposures are safe and BPA/BPS can act additively with other chemicals. BPA is estrogenic and alters development of the breast and prostate (Dhimolea et. al. 2014 and Acevedo et. al. 2013). BPS, sometimes used as a substitute to BPA, is estrogenic in rats (Yamasaki et al. 2004) and affects the production and regulation of sex hormones in zebrafish (Ji et al. 2013). BPA and BPS both affect brain development and behavior in zebrafish (Kinch 2015). 
Benzophenone-3 is a chemical found in many sunscreen products. BP-3 has the potential to alter estrogen activity in breast cancer cells (Suzuki et. al. 2005). One study in humans shows changes in hormone concentrations for groups with highest exposure to BP-3 and parabens while another does not (Aker et. al. 2016, Scinicariello et. al. 2016). 
Parabens are the most widely used preservatives in personal care products; they stop fungus, bacteria and other microbes from growing in creams and makeup. Parabens can interact with hormone receptors, similar to natural hormones like estrogen, and have been detected in breast tissue (Okubo et al., 2001 and Barr et al., 2012). For men, parabens may be associated with sperm DNA damage (Meeker et al., 2011). Who is it for?Our Detox Me™ Action Kit is for anyone age 18 and over who is curious about the toxic chemicals that might be lurking in their home or residing in their body.While toxic chemicals in your everyday environment can affect your personal health, they also can affect your children’s health. Studies show that exposure to chemicals during critical periods of development—in the womb, during puberty, or during pregnancy—can increase the risk of health problems later in life. These critical periods, commonly referred to as “windows of susceptibility,” represent important stages in life when the body is developing and is most vulnerable to the effects of toxic chemicals.Exposure to environmental chemicals early in life has been linked with cancer, poor brain development, obesity, diabetes, and other health effects. Because babies and small children spend lots of time on the floor, crawling, playing, and putting their hands in their mouths, they are at higher risk for exposure to pollutants in house dust.  Research by Silent Spring Institute has shown that numerous chemicals in consumer products build up in air and dust indoors, and these chemicals can end up in people’s bodies. By understanding what your own chemical levels are, you can take steps to protect your family from potentially harmful exposures, and reduce their risk of developing health problems in the future.By participating in our study, you will be joining a large community that is working to advance science on chemical exposures and create a healthier environment not only for you and your family, but for everyone and for generations to come. Testimonials / quotes “The biomonitoring I did with Silent Spring Institute was revelatory. Not only did it show how easily certain consumer product chemicals cross into our bodies, but I learned how to reduce my levels. It changed the way I think about my household, and the way I think about my body. Regardless of the kinds of actions it inspires—personal, political, artistic—the knowledge is empowering." “I sent my urine samples to Silent Spring Institute and was tested for 28 different chemicals all of which were detected in my body burden test, some at alarmingly high levels…You start to realize that you are surrounded by chemicals. Ultimately, the biggest thing you can do is do the best you can and push companies to do better. And in time, maybe we’ll all see our collective body burden go down. But it’s up to us to make sure things keep moving forward, in the right direction.” “We now understand that factors within our control such as diet, exercise, and exposure to environmental chemicals like endocrine disruptors, influence cancer rates—months, years or even decades later. Even exposure of the fetus before birth to certain chemicals can influence cancer risk later in life. Just as the human genome project transformed our fundamental understanding of cancer, biomonitoring and big data have the potential to radically change our understanding of potentially modifiable risk factors for breast cancer and other diseases.” “Silent Spring Institute has spent 20 years researching the effects of environmental toxicants on human health. Its researchers have published findings in peer-reviewed scientific journals, and the organization is well-respected in the field of cancer prevention research… Their Detox Me™ mobile app is a clever way to avoid toxic chemicals in everyday products. The app takes people through a crash course on household toxic chemicals and how to avoid them. As you advance through the Detox Me™ curriculum, you receive “badges” to mark your progress. You can also set up reminders for behaviors you’d like to work on.” How does it work?The testOur test is easy and completely non-invasive. Here’s how it works: The kit contains two glass jars, instructions, a cold pack, a link to our online survey, and a return shipping label.You’ll take our online survey. It takes about 15 to 30 minutes, and you don’t have to answer any questions you don’t feel comfortable with. Your survey responses, along with your test results will help us personalize the report and recommendations you receive We need this information to learn how specific behaviors affect chemical body burdens.Then you’ll collect two urine samples: one first thing in the morning, one at the end of the day. Place both jars and the cold pack in your freezer for at least 24 hours so they become frozen solid.Pack the frozen jars and cold pack into the shipping container provided, slap on the pre-paid shipping label, and mail the package back to us.After our lab analyzes your samples, we’ll send you a personalized digital report. That process takes about 8-12 weeks. Preview the study consent form at http://silentspring.org/detoxme/consentform.pdf. The reportYou’ll access your report through our secure website. You may review it online, or print your results. We formulate our reports to be easy to understand and to give you actionable goals so you can see your levels of each toxic chemical, understand what we know, and what we don’t know, about the associated health risks, and take steps to reduce your exposure.  The appKnowledge is not just power, but a prescription for prevention! Our free Detox Me™ app (available for iPhone and Android) walks you through simple, research-based tips on how to reduce your exposure to potentially harmful chemicals where you live and work—and it keeps track of your progress. Use our app to keep your exposures to these chemicals to a minimum.  The Detox Me™ Action Kit is...It’s really just an easy urine test that provides amazing, informative, and actionable results for you and important data for our research team to better understand sources of exposure in the general public. What it is notThe Detox Me™ Action Kit is not a detox formula. There’s nothing to drink or eat. It’s not scary or invasive. It’s not a quick-fix. Instead, it’s about making small, simple changes to your daily routine that over time will lower your chemical body burden. Who’s behind this?The Detox Me™ Action Kit is a project of Silent Spring Institute, a leading scientific research organization dedicated to understanding the link between chemicals in our everyday environment and health, especially breast cancer.
