Our research was the the first to show that endocrine disrupting chemicals are prevalent in the indoor environment, and that consumer products are the most significant contributor to chemical exposures in the general population. We are also a pioneer in developing innovative tools and ethical methods for sharing chemical exposure and biomonitoring data with participants in large exposure studies.Silent Spring is staffed by scientists with expertise in epidemiology, toxicology, chemistry, environmental health, and computational science. We collaborate with investigators at Harvard, Northeastern, University of California, Berkeley, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), U.S. Centers for Disease Control (CDC), and other top-tier research institutions, as well as with a diverse group of environmental and health advocacy groups.This project marks the world’s first crowdsourced study on exposure to household and environmental toxics. From Left: Julia Brody, PhD, Executive Director; Katherine Boronow, Research Assistant; Ruthann Rudel, MS, Research Director; Vincent Bessonneau, PhD, Research Scientist in Chemistry; Kathryn Rodgers, MPH, Staff Scientist; Alexandra Goho, Director of Communications; Herb Susmann, Software Developer and Data Scientist. Why do we need your support?We need at least 100 participants to make to launch our Detox Me™ Action Kit study.The more participants that enroll, the more statistical power we will have to draw connections between the products that people use and the level of chemicals in their bodies. As the study grows, we will be able to expand the list of chemicals tested for with the Detox Me™ Action Kit. Can children participate in the study?No, currently the study is limited to participants ages 18 and over. Is my contribution tax deductible?Yes! Because Silent Spring Institute is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, the part of your contribution that is above the value of your urine analysis test is tax deductible. We estimate the non-tax deductible portion to be $180 per kit. The tax-deductible portion of your contribution, any amount above $180 per kit, helps us advance our mission by allowing us to fund the purchasing of sampling equipment and pay for the staff time necessary to run the project. Your contributions also help subsidize kits for low-income people who can not afford to pay for testing to ensure a broad pool of study participants that reflects the diversity of the U.S. population.   Risks and challenges

We need 100 participants in order to move forward with the study. Unfortunately, it is not feasible for us to run the study if fewer than 100 people enroll. Full refunds will be available for anyone who signed up, if this happens.

Problems with sample collection. It’s important that the samples are kept frozen from the time they are collected to when they are analyzed. If the samples aren’t frozen when we get them, we will ask participants to collect another sample and try mailing them again.

Problems with analysis. There can be failures at the lab that cause the analysis of a sample to not work. In that case, the sample will be re-tested, which will slow down how fast we can give you back your results.

story:
I.  Short Summary

1.  The Purpose.  This campaign is to raise funds for us to buy the Hover Passport selfie-drone (https://gethover.com/hover-camera-passport?d=pc) so we can make and post an on-going series of on-the-go short videos of people using the Rocket Rower. The goal of the series of videos is to drive awareness of the power, fun and flexibility of Rocket Rowers to address the epidemic of sitting by giving people short intervals of cardio exercise throughout the day.

2.  The Inventor.  Tim Higginson invented the Rocket Rower for himself as a simple, effective and fun solution to the problem that he sits too much.  Rowing is one of the great all-body exercises. But traditional rowing machines are too big (and expensive) to go where most people sit, not to mention that they require you to sit while using them.  So, Tim (who rowed on top competitive teams for years) designed the world's first STAND-UP rowing machine that fits anywhere, is a fraction of the size and cost of standard rowing machines and adds a new dimension because you row straight upwards, just like a rocket.  He's an avid inventor and entrepreneur.  He holds multiple patents in the US and overseas.  His background includes writing software for spacecraft.  He's designed and built products ranging from sun protective gear to cloud apps.

3.  The Problem. Lack of physical motion is staggeringly bad for us, with very serious health and long term consequences.  And, here's the kicker:  it is not enough to exercise before or after a day of sitting.  And, standing at your desk isn't enough either.  

Read this article about the importance of regular intervals of cardio exercise all through the day https://www.today.com/series/one-small-thing/si....

Here are other links to give you more context

https://www.google.com/search?q=sitting+is+the+new+smoking&oq=sitting+is+the+new+smoking&aqs=chrome..69i57j0l5.3594j0j8&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8

http://www.runnersworld.com/health/sitting-is-the-new-smoking-even-for-runners

You can also watch multiple TED talks on how bad sitting is for us.

4.  What is Needed.  The key is to get physical motion that gives cardio exercise as many times in the day as possible.  In short, quick intervals of cardio exercise throughout the day are critical to our health. 

5.  The Solution.  Rocket Rowers do exactly that.  They are the world's first "at your desk" short interval cardio motion platform.  They fit pretty much anywhere people sit, and are ready for use on a second's notice.  They provide rigorous all-body cardio motion in a few seconds.  Most people can fit 30 or 60 seconds of motion into their day at multiple times, such as after finished a call, sending an email, updating a document, etc.  We want people to think of using the Rocket Rower as a reward for getting things done during their day.  That way, it becomes built in and marks all the successes people have during their day, leading not only to intervals of cardio motion throughout their day, but also a feeling of accomplishment at all that they have achieved.

6.  How does the Rocket Rower work?  The design inspiration for the Rocket Rower is quite literally competition-level rowing shells.  The question was how to take one of those, and make it work beside a desk.  The key to the answer was to rotate it 90 degrees to vertical.  This allowed us to strip out all the size and complexity, and reduce it down to the two most important features:  (1) an inclined platform, and (2) a resistance tube.  The inclined foot platform is used in all rowing shells to allow for a deeper knee bend for a longer leg push.  We took that platform and combined all the other complexity of rowing machines into it:  the moving seat, the oar riggers and oar locks, etc.  Our inclined platform is held in place by the user's weight, and has a swappable "oar lock" system for quickly changing out resistance tubes of various strengths.  By changing the "oar" into resistance tubes, we got rid of all the complex air, water and other resistance systems in rowing machines.  By changing the "oar lock" into a quick-change keyhole design embedded in the platform, a user can change among different strength resistance tubes on the fly in seconds.  (Trust us - or even better, try it for yourself - even the lightest resistance tube makes for a rigorous 30 or 60 second workout!)   

7.  No sweating!  By designing and building a system that gives cardio exercise in short intervals of 30 to 60 seconds, users don't build up a sweat.  People can fit 30 or 60 seconds of cardio exercise into their day right beside their desk or workspace whenever they finish a phone call, send an email, close a document, walk back from a meeting, or basically anytime they want.  There's always at least 3 to 5 times in a day when people step on a Rocket Rower right where they are and do 30 or 60 seconds of real motion with cardio.

8.  What about standing desks and balance boards?  These do not provide cardio exercise, and studies show that short intervals of cardio motion throughout the day are very important.  That's what Rocket Rowers solve.  

 

II.  Here are some specifications and infographics

 

 

 

III.  What We Need & What You Get

Funding will enable us to buy this selfie drone:  https://gethover.com/hover-camera-passport?d=pc (including extra battery, protective case and extra propellers).

We will use the selfie drone to make and post short, dynamic videos of the Rocket Rower in a whole range of fun contexts to increase our outreach efforts to educate people and businesses on the dangers of sitting, and get Rocket Rowers to more people for cardio at their desks.

Our perks range from a beautiful and totally useful microfiber lens cloths with a Rocket Rower logo, to discounts on buying Rocket Rowers to unique, one-off Rocket Rowers with custom artwork by a local artist.

If we raise less than our full goal, the funds will still help increase the quality and reach of our messaging about the dangers of sitting, and the importance of short intervals of cardio exercise through the day.

IV.  The Impact

This project is valuable to you as a contributor and many, many people in our society because educating people (including employers for the health of their employees) on the importance of getting short intervals of cardio exercise throughout the day is truly important for the health of all of us and the people we love. 

By contributing to this Rocket Rower campaign, you will be helping fight back against the societal epidemic of sitting by providing people with education and a powerful antidote in the form not of drug or after-the-fact treatment, but an up-front simple, powerful, fun exercise platform that empowers people to stand up and get short intervals of cardio motion right at their desk.

Your contribution will also help build this small company into a larger one.  We're already helping provide jobs for people around Massachusetts.

V.  Risks & Challenges

We finished the design, prototyping and other development phases and starting full commercial manufacturing earlier in 2017.  We are selling and delivering Rocket Rowers to individuals and businesses now.  We are steadily learning from and improving on our first-round efforts at educating and bringing Rocket Rowers to people and businesses.

We have removed the manufacturing risk because we're already successfully manufacturing, shipping and delivering Rocket Rowers.  If demand increases fast, we will need to meet the challenge of scaling our manufacturing and fulfillment capabilities. 

Our biggest immediate challenge is spreading the word about the importance of cardio exercise throughout the day, and Rocket Rowers as a simple, powerful and fun solution.  We are using a mix of direct outreach to owners and chief health officers of businesses to get these for their employees, social media posts and a very small amount of online advertising.  We would very much like to add some public relations, better product photos and website design and other improvements.

VI.  Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign, the health dangers of sitting and the Rocket Rower.  Something as simple as posting to social media with a link to this campaign and/or our website is a big help.   

To share our Indiegogo campaign, remember that Indiegogo has a great set of sharing tools.

5.  The Solution.  Rocket Rowers do exactly that.  They are the world's first "at your desk" short interval cardio motion platform.  They fit pretty much anywhere people sit, and are ready for use on a second's notice.  They provide rigorous all-body cardio motion in a few seconds.  Most people can fit 30 or 60 seconds of motion into their day at multiple times, such as after finished a call, sending an email, updating a document, etc.  We want people to think of using the Rocket Rower as a reward for getting things done during their day.  That way, it becomes built in and marks all the successes people have during their day, leading not only to intervals of cardio motion throughout their day, but also a feeling of accomplishment at all that they have achieved.
6.  How does the Rocket Rower work?  The design inspiration for the Rocket Rower is quite literally competition-level rowing shells.  The question was how to take one of those, and make it work beside a desk.  The key to the answer was to rotate it 90 degrees to vertical.  This allowed us to strip out all the size and complexity, and reduce it down to the two most important features:  (1) an inclined platform, and (2) a resistance tube.  The inclined foot platform is used in all rowing shells to allow for a deeper knee bend for a longer leg push.  We took that platform and combined all the other complexity of rowing machines into it:  the moving seat, the oar riggers and oar locks, etc.  Our inclined platform is held in place by the user's weight, and has a swappable "oar lock" system for quickly changing out resistance tubes of various strengths.  By changing the "oar" into resistance tubes, we got rid of all the complex air, water and other resistance systems in rowing machines.  By changing the "oar lock" into a quick-change keyhole design embedded in the platform, a user can change among different strength resistance tubes on the fly in seconds.  (Trust us - or even better, try it for yourself - even the lightest resistance tube makes for a rigorous 30 or 60 second workout!)   
7.  No sweating!  By designing and building a system that gives cardio exercise in short intervals of 30 to 60 seconds, users don't build up a sweat.  People can fit 30 or 60 seconds of cardio exercise into their day right beside their desk or workspace whenever they finish a phone call, send an email, close a document, walk back from a meeting, or basically anytime they want.  There's always at least 3 to 5 times in a day when people step on a Rocket Rower right where they are and do 30 or 60 seconds of real motion with cardio.
8.  What about standing desks and balance boards?  These do not provide cardio exercise, and studies show that short intervals of cardio motion throughout the day are very important.  That's what Rocket Rowers solve.  
 
II.  Here are some specifications and infographics
 

 

 



III.  What We Need & What You Get
Funding will enable us to buy this selfie drone:  https://gethover.com/hover-camera-passport?d=pc (including extra battery, protective case and extra propellers).
We will use the selfie drone to make and post short, dynamic videos of the Rocket Rower in a whole range of fun contexts to increase our outreach efforts to educate people and businesses on the dangers of sitting, and get Rocket Rowers to more people for cardio at their desks.
Our perks range from a beautiful and totally useful microfiber lens cloths with a Rocket Rower logo, to discounts on buying Rocket Rowers to unique, one-off Rocket Rowers with custom artwork by a local artist.
If we raise less than our full goal, the funds will still help increase the quality and reach of our messaging about the dangers of sitting, and the importance of short intervals of cardio exercise through the day.

IV.  The Impact
This project is valuable to you as a contributor and many, many people in our society because educating people (including employers for the health of their employees) on the importance of getting short intervals of cardio exercise throughout the day is truly important for the health of all of us and the people we love. 
By contributing to this Rocket Rower campaign, you will be helping fight back against the societal epidemic of sitting by providing people with education and a powerful antidote in the form not of drug or after-the-fact treatment, but an up-front simple, powerful, fun exercise platform that empowers people to stand up and get short intervals of cardio motion right at their desk.
Your contribution will also help build this small company into a larger one.  We're already helping provide jobs for people around Massachusetts.

V.  Risks & Challenges
We finished the design, prototyping and other development phases and starting full commercial manufacturing earlier in 2017.  We are selling and delivering Rocket Rowers to individuals and businesses now.  We are steadily learning from and improving on our first-round efforts at educating and bringing Rocket Rowers to people and businesses.
We have removed the manufacturing risk because we're already successfully manufacturing, shipping and delivering Rocket Rowers.  If demand increases fast, we will need to meet the challenge of scaling our manufacturing and fulfillment capabilities. 
Our biggest immediate challenge is spreading the word about the importance of cardio exercise throughout the day, and Rocket Rowers as a simple, powerful and fun solution.  We are using a mix of direct outreach to owners and chief health officers of businesses to get these for their employees, social media posts and a very small amount of online advertising.  We would very much like to add some public relations, better product photos and website design and other improvements.

VI.  Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign, the health dangers of sitting and the Rocket Rower.  Something as simple as posting to social media with a link to this campaign and/or our website is a big help.   
To share our Indiegogo campaign, remember that Indiegogo has a great set of sharing tools.

story:
We are updating the page to reflect where the walk with take place this Saturday March 31st, as well as update our funds raised through a combination of avenues. At the moment we have raised a total of $4,300 through our campaign page on CURED as well as Indiegogo. We are so excited to be that close to meeting our goal of $5,000 by this Saturday!

For those of you joining us for the walk we will be meeting at

Kiwanis Park in Tempe AZ at the NORTH SOCCER FIELD.

6111 S. All American Way

Tempe AZ 85283

Registeration begins at 8 if you have a shirt to pick up or need to register for the walk. The walk itself starts at 9 am. After the walk there will many fun activities for the whole family including a big inflatable slide, obstacle course, face painting, Bahama Bucks, Sardellas Pizza and much much more! We appreciate teh support and look forward to seeing you there.

Together we can find a cure!
